loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a resident from Ormoc, Leyte. She is a married woman and a mother of a two-year-old child. 

In order to make a living, Estrella has raised pigs for more than four years now. Her husband also provides an additional income through his carpentry job.

Estrella is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise. With this, Estrella believes that she will be able to improve her hog-raising business. 

In the future, Estrella dreams of improving their way of living. She also wants to save money for the future schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a 48-year-old married  woman and a mother of eight children from Carles, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 26 years now. This is the source of their income.

Delia is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of their fishing boat. This loan will help Delia and her husband in augmenting their catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Delia dreams of improving their fishing business so that it will generate more income for their needs especially for the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy new new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat

loans.name: Sandra Amelia

texts.es:
Sandra de 52 años de edad, es madre soltera de 1 hijo por quien ha luchado la mayor parte de su vida. Ella alcanzo un nivel académico hasta bachillerato en el lugar de su residencia. 

Sandra se dedica a la compra y venta de cosméticos, labor que realiza desde hace 20 años, es el trabajo que le ha ayudado a sostener a su familia(su hijo).

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para mejorar su vivienda, comprara cemento, arena, clavos y madera. Todo con el fin de ver mas bonita su pequeña casa.

 A futuro desea tener una estabilidad económica favorable que le permita a ella y su hijo vivir cómodamente. Ademas desea ver a su hijo convertido en todo un profesional.
texts.en:
Sandra is 52 years old and is the single mother of one son whom she has fought for most of her life. She completed her secondary studies in her hometown. Sandra has been working buying and selling cosmetics for the past 20 years. This work helps her to sustain her family (her son).

The loan that she is requesting is to make improvements on her house buying cement, sand, nails and wood. Her aim to make her small house more beautiful. In the future she wants to have a stable financial situation that will allow her and her son to live comfortably. She also wants to see her son become a professional.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, nails and wood with the goal of making her small house more beautiful.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 57 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school, Merlina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Merlina has been in this business for four years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Nelsie

texts.en:
Nelsie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of fishing net for her fishing business.

Nelsie has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from seaweed culture.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing net

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like canned goods, fish, meat, vegetables, etc.

Ofelia has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Ofelia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like canned goods, fish, meat, vegetables, etc

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a resident from Iloilo, Philippines. She is 56 years old and has five children. 

Teresita has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 32 years now. This business provides them the income that they need.

Teresita is asking for a loan to buy a new boat engine, fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items. This loan will help Teresita and her husband in improving their income from fishing. 

In the future, Teresita has hopes of expanding their fishing venture so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine, fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita, 48, is a married woman and a mother of six children from Ormoc, Leyte. 

Amelita earns an income through her sari-sari store business. She sells various goods from food to personal use materials. Amelita has been in the business for more than six years now. Amelita is a very hardworking person. Her husband is a fish vendor.

Amelita would like to take a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, condiments and others. This loan will help her improve her inventories to attract more buyers in her store.

In the future, Amelita hopes to make her business sustainable and profitable. Furthermore, she wants to save money for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Beoneda

texts.en:
Beoneda is 54 years old. She is single and works hard for her needs. 

She has two small businesses to support herself. She is currently engaged in fishing and a sari-sari (variety) store business. These usually earn her 15,000 PHP per month. 

She is asking for additional capital through a loan to buy fishing nets and merchandise such as canned goods, detergent, condiments and toiletries. Beoneda can rely only on herself for her basic and future needs. 

Beoneda dreams of having a good income from her business so she can save for old age.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and merchandise such as canned goods, detergent, condiments and toiletries.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is married and has two children. He resides in Jimenez with his family.

Peter has for many years owned and operated a transport service to earn a living. He has to support the needs of his family's daily expenditures aside from farming. He also has to send his children to school. 

Recently, he took a new loan to cover the cost of repainting and repairing the motor of the motorcycle used for the transportation business. He plans to buy a sidecar for his motorcycle for expansion of his business in the near future.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repainting and repairing the motor of the motorcycle used for the transportation business.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad has been engaged in a vending business to earn a living. Aside from this, she also helps her husband work on their own farm located in the village of  Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Her previous loan used for fertilization was successfully repaid. She is now taking out a new loan for the purpose of cultivating more of the vacant lot in her farm for expansion of her garden. Improving her farm is a way to make her plan of renovating their house a reality.

loans.use: to cultivate more of the vacant lot in her farm for expansion of her garden.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 61-year-old married woman and a mother of four grown-up children from Carles, Iloilo. 

She is engaged in a fishing business with her husband. For more than 15 years now, fishing has provided them the income that they need for sustenance.
 
As of now, Evelyn wants to obtain a loan to buy fishing nets, outriggers, lead weights, and hooks. This loan will allow her and her husband to improve their fishing business as well as increase their income. 

In the future, Evelyn has hopes of making their fishing business more profitable and stable.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, outriggers, lead weights, and hooks

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 39 years old and is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 7 years. Trinidad requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients and materials for her food production business.

In the future, Trinidad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Teofila has been in this business for 10 years now.

Teofila requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Teofila would like to save enough money to provide her family with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a  woman with four children. She is a very hard -working entrepreneur. Veronica is 47 years old and has one child who is in school.

Veronica has a buy-and-sell frozen food business in the Philippines. Veronica requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

Veronica has been in this business for two years.  In the future, Veronica would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 50 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, sugar, rice, etc. to sell.

Ailyn has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening .

She aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, sugar, rice, etc. to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is sitting next to a basket with freshly-caught crabs. She is 36 years old, from the town of Carles in Iloilo.  She is married with two young daughters who are six and eleven years old. 

For six years now, she has engaged in the buying and selling of crabs from fishermen and also invested in this business. She usually earn 6,500 PHP every month out of this business. She also buys and sells rice for additional income. 

She is asking for a loan to buy crab traps and more fresh crabs. With the availability of additional capital, Melanie will be assured that she can maximize her business efforts and the return on her investment.

In the future, she hope to expand her business, manage it well, and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy crab traps and fresh crabs

loans.name: Marelin

texts.es:
Marelin es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tiene una preciosa hija quien es su mayor motivación en la vida para salir adelante, vive en San Martin junto a su familia. Desde hace muchos años se dedica a la venta de ropa y cree que le está yendo bien porque es una excelente trabajadora y siempre está aprendiendo nuevas técnicas de venta. En sus tiempos libres le gusta confeccionar prendas de vestir ya que es su mayor pasión.
Marelin está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería para su tienda de ropas, de esta manera sus ingresos mejorarán y ella continuará saliendo adelante por el bienestar de su familia y espera más adelante cumplir su sueño de ver a su hija convertida en una gran profesional.
texts.en: Marelin is woman who really wants to get ahead. She has a precious daughter who is her biggest source of motivation pushing her forward in life and she lives in San Martin with her family. For many years she has worked in clothing sales and believes that it's going well for her because she's an excellent worker and she's always learning new sales techniques. In her free time she enjoys sewing garments because that's her biggest passion. Marelin is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their support she'll be able to purchase merchandise for her clothing store. In this way her income will rise and she'll continue forging ahead for her family's welfare and in the future she hopes to fulfill the dream of seeing her daughter become a professional.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal clothing for her business.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en:
Pelagia, 55, is a widowed woman with nine children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Pelagia has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries like detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioners, snack foods, coffee, etc. to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Pelagia has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Pelagia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioners, snack foods, coffee, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 59 years old and widowed with two children. Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like chocolate drinks, juice, cereals, sanitary pads, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like chocolate drinks, juice, cereals, sanitary pads, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old and married with eight children, five of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a broom making business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for broom making.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid back 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the brooms making business for 22 years and also earns an income from farming sugar cane.

Jocelyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for broom making.

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en:
Benjie is 27 years old and single. He dreams of becoming successful and financially stable in the future. 

Due to lack of job opportunities, he is operating a motorcycle transport business within his community. To continue to run his motorcycle, he wants to take out a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy wheels, gasoline and spare parts needed for its maintenance. 

Through hard work and strong determination, Benjie believes that he will earn a higher income and achieve his goal someday.

loans.use: to buy wheels, gasoline and spare parts needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Nyamdelger

texts.en: Nyamdelger is sixty years old and lives with her four daughters and grandson in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a janitor at a private firm since 2012. Her eldest two daughters work and the other two study at university. As winter is coming to Mongolia, she needs to renovate her house. She is requesting a loan of 2,300,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam. After the renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is from Carles, Iloilo. She is 43 years old, married, and has two children, ages 17 and 21. 

She has been in a fishing business for 21 years now. Fishing is not easy but she perseveres. There are nights when the weather is not good and she and her husband just have to go home without any catch. This livelihood is not for the faint-hearted.

Marilou would like to improve her family's living condition and she is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, fishing weights, nylon and ropes. She hopes that this will further help them in their business. Her income will be for a healthy diet and school fees.

In the future, she hopes to have a stable income from her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, fishing weights, nylon and ropes.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is a 30-year-old married man and a father of three children, ages 7, 5, and 1. 

For more than three years now, Gilbert has operated a small sari-sari or variety store business. He sells different kind of goods like biscuits, canned goods, rice, soap and detergents among others. This is his main source of income.
 
Gilbert wants to improve his business in order to augment his income. So he decided to take a loan to buy more merchandise to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries. soft drinks, coffee and other beverages. This loan will enable him to increase his stocks, which will attract more customers and buyers.

It is Gilbert's dream to improve his way of living and to support his children's schooling. And he believes that he can make it possible through hard work and perseverance.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries. soft drinks, coffee and other beverages.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is standing next to a pile of ropes used for seaweed farming. She is a forty-eight-year-old single woman from the town of Carles, Iloilo. Two years ago, Elenita started a business in seaweed farming and cooking snacks like rice cakes and pancakes. She works hard so she can buy the things she needs for herself. She is asking for a loan to finance her business. She will use the loan to buy straw, seaweed seedlings, ropes and fuel for seaweed farming, sugar flour, yeast, coconut, cooking oil and margarine for her snacks business. 

Elenita hopes that the loan will make a difference to her business by making it easier to manage and increase her income.

In the future, she hopes to see her business become more successful.

loans.use: to buy straw, ropes, seaweed, sugar, flour, yeast, coconut, cooking oil, margarine and fuel

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a merchant from Ormoc, Leyte. She is thirty-nine years old, married and has three children. Erlinda runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Erlinda is standing next to cases of soft drinks and beverages. These are her best selling items.

Erlinda wants to take a loan to buy more stock to sell, such as soft drinks, other beverages, rice, canned goods and animal feed. She believes that through this loan, she will be able to improve her inventories and thus attract more buyers to her store.
 
In the future, Erlinda hopes to make her business stable and profitable.

loans.use: buy soft drinks, rice, canned goods, animal feed and other goods to sell

loans.name: Erica

texts.en:
When Erica got married, she learned to embrace the life of the people in Carles, Iloilo. She is engaged in fishing, which she learned from her husband. This business started three years ago. She is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP. This amount will go a long way. It will be used to buy fishing tools for the boat such as plywood, nylon, nails, bamboo, fishing nets, paints, adhesive and a boat engine. 

Erica dreams of seeing her business become successful so that she can support her two year old son's needs and send him to school someday. 

Erica is twenty-four years old.

loans.use: to buy plywood, nylon, nails, bamboo, fishing nets, paints, adhesive and a boat engine

loans.name: Gemmacel

texts.en:
Gemmacel is standing next to cases of bottled soft drinks. She is a sari-sari (variety store) owner from Ormoc, Leyte. She is 20 years old, married and has two young children. 

Gemmacel has been in this business for almost two years now. In order to improve her store, she has decided to take a loan from CEVI to buy more stock like soft drinks, rice, animal feed, snack foods, soap and detergents. With this, Gemmacel will be able to attract more buyers to her store. 

In the future, she would like to save money to reinvest in the same business, and to send her children for further schooling.

loans.use: to buy more stock like soft drinks, rice, animal feed, snack foods, soap and detergents

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza has been farming for many years and she earns better income from this. With her previous loan, used for buying livestock to raise, she was able to raise more and was financially prepared for the next cropping season. 

She had successfully repaid her previous loan and is now planning to take a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer in order to restore farm nutrients to have a productive harvest. She is now happy to say that, with this loan, the entire farm will be fertilized and she may rest assured that she can expect a productive farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients to have a productive harvest

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Ormoc, Leyte. 

She earns an income through her coconut wine and soft drink selling business. Coconut wine is a common drink in local areas of the country. It can also be fermented into vinegar.

Gloria needs a loan for her business. She is asking for a loan to buy more coconut wine and soft drinks. With this, she will be able to improve her stock thereby allowing her to sell more to her customers.

In the future, Gloria hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut wine and soft drinks.

loans.name: Romer

texts.en:
Romer is a father of 2 who operates a piggery, growing and selling pigs to earn a living. He has been in this business for more than a year, and he earns well for his family. By selling pork meat in their villages, he was able to earn more profit than selling it in whole.  

He took a new loan recently from GDMPC micro credit to buy feed for his piglets. 

He plans to build another cage for his pigs as an expansion for his piggery in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed for his piglets

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is 31 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a nipa roof-making business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of nipa leaves, bamboo, etc to make bamboo mats.

Genelyn has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the nipa roof-making for three years and also earns an income from direct selling personal collection products.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of nipa leaves, bamboo, etc to make bamboo mats

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa is 36 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

Jessa has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell nipa roofing business for 11 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Jessa aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling frozen products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,500 through NWTF to purchase additional frozen products to sell for her business.

Rona has been in this business for 3 years. Rona earns additional income from rice retailing and pig fattening.

Rona has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional frozen products to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 35 years old and has one child.

Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct selling personal products business in the Philippines and has doing this for 2 years. She requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like lotion, soap, toothpaste, etc. to sell.

Rosemarie has borrowed and paid back 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She also earns an income from pre-paid mobile loading and food vending.

Rosemarie aspires to save enough money to provide her family with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like lotion, soap, toothpaste, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is fifty-seven years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Antonia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for seventeen years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar and biscuits. 

Antonia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Florcefida

texts.en:
Flocefida works hard to support her family. Flocefida is married and has a pig-raising business in the Philippines.

She requested a 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Flocefida has been in this business for eight years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Flocefida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 30 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Josie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc.

Josie has been in this business for eight years. 

In the future Josie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc

loans.name: Heriberto Antonio

texts.es:
Heriberto de 27 años de edad, es agricultor, su familia era de muy bajos recursos económicos y debido esto solo cursó hasta sexto grado, ahora está acompañado y junto a su pareja procrearon una niña que actualmente tiene 4 años de edad y es el motor para luchar día con día, su compañera de vida es quien le ayuda con la agricultura.

Heriberto se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería desde que tenía 18 años, trabajo que le enseñaron sus padres, y que ahora agradece ese gran esfuerzo que hicieron por él de enseñarle, ya que es de donde se sostiene económicamente para cubrir las necesidades del hogar, él siembra maíz y el terreno lo tiene a un kilómetro de distancia de su casa, viaja todos los días para ver su cosecha y no se descuida para que de buenos frutos.


El crédito sera utilizado para preparar la tierra y a la vez para la compra de insumos agrícolas tales como abono, semilla, veneno, sulfato y también para cubrir algunas necesidades en su hogar


El sueño es ampliar la cosecha, es decir tener la posibilidad de sembrar mas terreno en la próxima cosecha, tener un negocio propio que le genere ganancias para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar, darle estudio a su pequeña hija para que tenga mejores oportunidades de trabajo en un futuro y mejorar la vivienda para que vivir dignamente.
texts.en:
Heriberto is a 27 year old farmer whose family was very low-income and due to this he only attained a 6th grade education. Currently he's in a relationship and he and his partner had a daughter who currently is 4 years old. She's what pushes him to to strive every day, and his partner helps him with the farming.

Heriberto has worked in farming and livestock since he was 18 years old. His parents taught him the job and now he's grateful for the great efforts they put into teaching him, because this is how he supports himself financially and how he pays for household expenses. He plants corn and the field is a kilometer away from his home. Every day he travels to see his crop and he doesn't neglect it, so that it will yield a good harvest.

The loan will be used to prepare the soil and also to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, seed, pesticides, sulfates, and also to cover some household expenses.

His dream is to expand his harvest, that is, to have the chance to cultivate more land for the next harvest, and have a business of his own to generate profits to cover the household expenses, pay for his young daughter's education so that she can have more job opportunities in the future, and improve the home so that they can live respectably.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seed, pesticides, sulfates, and also cover some household expenses.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is married with 2 children and he lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with his family. 

He grows and harvests rice, and this is work that he has done since he was young. He gets up early and goes to the fields where he has to take care of his crops. 

He has taken out a new loan recently to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides for his farm, in order to have a more productive harvest. 

In the future he plans to buy a vehicle to use for transportation from farm to market.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides for his farm, in order to have a more productive harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and stone to install a cement patio at her home.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda owns and operates a tricycle unit. She has been successful in this business for years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income to provide for their everyday needs and necessities.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. She is requesting an amount of 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) for the maintenance of the tricycle and to pay for the renewal of franchise agreement/permit so she could continue her business operation.

In the future, Melinda wants to buy another unit of tricycle for business purposes. She hopes to have enough savings to pay for the renovation of their house. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Cresencia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from furniture making. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like shampoo, groceries, etc.  

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Cresencia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of building and expanding her businesses to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is 30 years old, married, and has two children. With one child currently in school, Mary Rose works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Rose runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, candies, sugar, vinegar, cooking oil, noodles, milk, etc. to sell.

Mary Rose has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, candies, sugar, vinegar, cooking oil, noodles, milk, etc. 

Mary Rose would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, candies, sugar, vinegar, cooking oil, noodles, milk, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Hermosilia

texts.en:
Hermosilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a livestock-raising business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her raising of livestock business.

Hermosilia has been in this business for 20 years. Hermosilia earns additional income from selling tobacco.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Hermosilia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma works hard to support her family. Norma is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, etc.

Norma has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Norma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Blanca Flor

texts.es:
Blanca de 69 años de edad, estudio hasta 2º grado y no pudo continuar por los escasos recursos de sus padres, esta casada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, son padres de 6 hijos.

 Blanca se dedica a la agricultura desde la edad de los 10 años, trabajo que aprendió de sus padres, ya que no continuo con sus estudios se dedicó por completo a la agricultura, y con el paso del tiempo aprendió la ganadería. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para la preparación de la tierra para la siembra de riego, con lo restante comprara un novillo para el repasto. El sueño de Blanca es obtener mejores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Blanca is 69 years old. She studied up to the 2nd grade, and couldn't continue due to the scarce resources of her parents. She is married, her husband works in agriculture and they are parents of 6 children.

Blanca has worked in agriculture since she was 10 years old. She learned the work from her parents. Since she couldn't continue with her studies, she dedicated herself completely to agriculture, and over time she learned cattle raising.

The loan that she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is for the preparation of the land to install irrigation. With the remaining balance, she will buy a steer for the pasture. Blanca's dream is to obtain more income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to prepare her land to install irrigation. With the remaining balance, she will buy a steer for the pasture.

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en:
Ganchimeg used her previous loan for house renovation. Now her family lives in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating. 

This time she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to install an electric heater in order to further decrease heat loss. If the house preserves its heat at its optimal level, her family won't need to burn coal for heating. According to the state research bureau, burning coal is considered the main source of air pollution in Mongolia.

loans.use: to install an eletcric heater in order to preserve energy

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es: A sus 76 años de edad Teodoro es un señor  alegre que vive con su hijo de 33 años de edad y juntos se dedican a la agricultura, Teodoro necesita el crédito para invertir en la compra de abono, pago de mano de obra y fungicidas para mantener sus cultivos sanos, la aspiración de este señor es de seguir trabajando y sembrando sus pequeñas huertas de papas para de ahí obtener los ingresos necesarios que le permitan cubrir sus gastos diarios.
texts.en: At 76 years old, Teodoro is a happy man living with his 33 year-old son. They work together in agriculture. Teodoro needs the loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizer, fungicide and manual labor in order to maintain the health of his crops. This man's hope is to continue working and planting small patches of potatoes in order to earn the income necessary to meet his daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, fungicide and manual labor.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
This is Leonisa, 40, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Leopoldo, a driver. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Leonisa operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings, when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a common family tradition but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. However, it is considered a waste of money and time to use cooking gas and food for one or two people only, as buying cooked rice and food costs less than the raw ingredients. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Leonisa hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members*  to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Erdenetsogt

texts.en:
Erdenetsogt, 53 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife and eldest daughter are teachers at high school. 

Erdenetsogt has been rendering taxi services to local people since 2004. The car he uses for a taxi has been deteriorating over the years and is now in need of repair. Therefore he is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to buy automobile spare parts to repair his car. With this, he can continue to offer his taxi service to local people and to generate income.

loans.use: to buy automobile spare parts in order to repair his car

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife has been farming for many years, and she earns a better income from this. With her previous loan used for buying fertilizer, she was able to raise more and was financially prepared for the next cropping season. 

She has repaid successfully her previous loan and is now planning to take a new loan for to purchase fertilizer to have a more productive farm. She is now happy to say that with this loan, the entire farm will be fertilized and she will be rest assured of a productive farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to have a more productive farm

loans.name: Gimena Del Rocio

texts.es: A sus 42 años de edad Gimena tiene una hija de 14 años, Gimena  es casada pero su esposo vive lojos por motivos de trabajo, Gimena vive arrendando y tiene un salón de belleza el cual es su fuente de ingresos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de belleza para utilizarlos y comercializarlos en su negocio, Gimena aspira de su negocio seguir conservando sus buenas clientas y mejorar su negocio para salir adelante y de estos ingresos darle la educación a su hija ya que ella asiste al colegio y lo que más quiere Gimena es que su hija sea una profesional.
texts.en:
At the age of 42, Gimena has a 14-year-old daughter. Gimena is married, but her husband lives far away for work reasons. Gimena lives in a leased space, and she has a beauty salon, which is her source of income. She is going to use the loan to buy beauty products to use them and sell them in her business.

The aim of Gimena's business is to continue maintaining her good clients and to improve her business to get ahead. From the income, she will provide her daughter with an education, since she is already going to middle school. What Gimena wants the most is for her daughter to be a professional.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Julieta is 50 years old, and two children are still in school.

Julieta has a handicraft business in the Philippines. Julieta requested an 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Julieta has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Julieta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Estela Daysi

texts.es:
Estela es una mujer muy dedicada al trabajo, ella estudio hasta sexto grado pero tubo que abandonar los estudios para dedicarse solamente al trabajo ya que su familia es de escasos recursos y tenia que apoyar llevando ingresos al hogar. Estela esta casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y a la elaboracion de tejas.  Es madre de cuatro hijos y todos estudian y ella realiza los quehaceres del hogar, tambien trabaja en la agricultura ayunadole a su esposo. Ademas a trabajado en el comercio vendiendo pollo de engorde.

El préstamo lo utilizara en la compra de tres puertas y dos ventanas métalicas para la mejora de su vivienda 
ya que no cuenta con estas.

El sueño de Estela es poder tener una tejera propia donde trabaje su familia, ya que en la actualidad trabajan por jornal en tejeres ajenas.
texts.en:
Estela is a woman who is really dedicated to work. She studied up to the sixth grade, but had to abandon her studies in order to commit full time to work because her family's lack of economic resources forced her to help support by bringing home an income. Estela is married, her husband is a farmer and a shingle maker. She is the mother of four children, all of them students, and also takes care of household chores as well as helping her husband farm. She has also worked in commerce, selling chickens for fattening. 
She will use the loan to purchase three doors and two metallic windows to improve her home as she does not currently have these. Estela's dream is to be able to have her own shingle factory where her family can work as they currently work as day laborers at other factories.

loans.use: purchase three doors and two metallic windows to improve her home as she does not currently have these.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cirila is 43 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Cirila has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested an 18,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Cirila has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 47 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Norma is borrowing 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

Norma has been raising livestock for three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 38 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising cows in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase an additional cow to raise.

Evelyn has been raising cows for 15 years and also earns additional income from pig raising.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow to raise

loans.name: Phokham Group

texts.en:
Nounmee is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. The silver nitrate-infused ceramic element removes and destroys bacteria and similar agents of water borne diseases. 

Nounmee's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in his village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. Even though some people in the village, including Nounmee, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. 

Nounmee and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. 

Nounmee's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; increasing time available for productive work also improves a family’s income and overall well-being.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

Bualeevan's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; increasing time available for productive work also improves a family’s income and over all well-being.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong, 53, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two children and her husband. Hong and her husband earn money through their business producing screws. Hong is sometimes unable to provide the volume of screws required by her customers. Consequently, she would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of material to increase her production to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy materials to make screws for selling.

loans.name: José Ándres

texts.es:
José de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta sacar su bachillerato. Actualmente se dedica a la agricultura, esta casado su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tiene dos hijas las cuales se encuentran estudiando, una estudia cuarto grado y la otra segundo grado.

José es agricultor y jornalero, él se dedica a trabajar una hectárea de maíz y en el tiempo de verano se dedica a arreglar la milpa, este trabajo lo aprendió de su padre su producción de cultivo esta a cuatro km de su casa.  

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar insumos agrícolas para fertilizar su milpa, como abono y sulfato y obtener mejores ganancias y pagar sus créditos a tiempo y con las ganancias que le quede desea cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar y de su familia		

Él sueña con sacar mejores cosechas y poder mejorar económicamente, para  sacar a sus hijas adelante en la educación y alimentación
texts.en:
Jose is 36 years old, he is a high school graduate. He currently works in agriculture, is married and his wife tends to the household chores. They have two daughters, both currently students. One is in fourth grade and the other in second grade. 
Jose is a farmer and day laborer, he works an hectare of corn and during the summer he tends to the cornfield. He learned this trade from his father. His crop production is located four km away from his home. 
He will use the loan to purchase agricultural inputs to fertilize the cornfield, such as fertilizer and sulfur, in order to obtain better incomes and be able to pay his debts on time. With the remaining income he wants to cover the basic necessities of the home and of his family. 
He dreams about producing better harvests and improving economically in order to provide for his daughters' education and nutrition.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and sulfur for his corn harvest.

loans.name: Hadxiengtom Group

The silver nitrate-infused ceramic element removes and destroys bacteria and similar agents of water borne diseases. Meexai's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in his village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; increasing time available for productive work also improves a family’s income and over all well-being.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Enkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Enkhtsetseg, 35 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband have operated an online shop for two years. Their children stay at kindergarten. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and it needs to be repaired. She requests 4,000,000 MNT to buy bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam for house renovation. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place without the need to burn coal excessively for heating.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal.

loans.name: Sherlinda

texts.en:
Sherlinda is a 53-year-old married woman with seven children. one attends school.

She has raised pigs for 9 years and requests 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has previously borrowed 10 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Sherlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 38 years old and married with eight children.

She has earned a living raising cows for 3 years and requests  12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a cow and feed.

She earns additional income from raising pigs.

She works tirelessly to  attain her dream which is to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a cow and feed.

loans.name: Khanh

texts.en: Khanh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and to offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her to increase the size of her store and to increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida is 59 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She  has run a general store for 10 years and requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shampoo and groceries.

In the future Bienvenida would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's  financial stability.

loans.use: to buy shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Teresa is 42 years old, and three children are currently in school.

Ma. Teresa has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Teresa requested a 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Ma. Teresa has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ma. Teresa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Marylou

texts.en:
Marylou is 56 years old and married with nine children. With one child still in school, Marylou works very hard to provide for the family.

Marylou runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like milk, juice, chocolate drinks, seasonings, canned goods, etc., to sell.

Marylou has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items such as milk, juice, chocolate drinks, seasonings, canned goods, etc. 

Marylou would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like milk, juice, chocolate drinks, seasonings, canned goods, etc., to sell

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 38 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising livestock, which she has been doing for 14 years, and earns additional income by farming sugarcane. Emelyn is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy an additional cow to raise.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional cow to raise.

loans.name: Tham

texts.en: Tham is requesting a new loan to buy hairdressing tools and shampoos to better satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve the processing capacity and sales of her business. She hopes that her new loan will help her to increase the size of her business and her income, thus improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing tools and shampoos

loans.name: Nancy America

texts.es: Nancy es una señora muy trabajadora, ella está casada y tiene 47 años de edad,  y tiene  2 hijos de los cuales la menor que tiene 16 años se encuentra estudiando, Nancy vive con su hija en una casa por la que paga arriendo, su esposo vive lejos por motivo de trabajo, Nancy se dedica al comercio de papas, el crédito lo necesita para comprar mercadería en quintales de papas, la aspiración de Nancy es comercializar en  mayor cantidad su producto y así  mejorar su negocio y por ende sus ingresos que le permitan terminar de dar los estudios a su hijo.
texts.en:
Nacy is a hard-working woman. She is married, and 47 years old. She has 2 children, the younger of which is 16 years old, and is in school. Nancy lives with her child in a house that she rents, and her husband lives far away for work reasons.

Nancy earns a living selling potatoes. She is requesting a loan to buy inventory in 100 lb bags of potatoes. Nancy aspires to sell her product in greater quantities, and in this way improve her business and gain an income that allows her to finish giving her child an education.

loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: M. Tufail

texts.en:
M. Tufail, 32, lives in Lahore. He is married with three children and has a small farm where he raises and feeds his animals.

He earns a living by selling milk to households and general markets, but although he is a hardworking person, he is unable to save money due to increasing daily expenses. He has, therefore, planned to buy an additional buffalo, hoping to increase his earnings and start saving for the future. 

M. Tufail has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan. He is thankful and hopeful for a better future.

loans.use: To buy an additional buffalo for producing milk.

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.en:
Rafoat lives in the northern part of Tajikistan, in the Spitamen district. She is engaged in breeding sheep and goats. Rafoat started this business 10 years ago and has gained good experience in this field. Her family helps her to conduct this business. Rafoat is married and has four children. She is 44 years old. She has loved animals since childhood. When she was young, she helped her parents breed cattle.

Now Rafoat has stocked up on livestock feed for the winter, but she lacks funds to purchase sheep. So Rafoat asks for a loan to purchase sheep in order to continue her favorite business. She needs your financial help.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a resident of Cavite, Philippines. She has a child and works in a garment factory. She was employed through the assistance of Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Lourdes is a Quality Control Officer. She inspects garments, such as men's denim slacks, during manufacturing operations to determine the number of defects per worker and reasons for rejects by examiners. She counts the number of pattern parts, lays of cloth prior to cutting, number of stitches per inch during sewing operation, and other measurement knowledge.

One of the main dilemmas of employees, like Lourdes, is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who captured their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Lourdes is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to  loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in returning it back since the loan payment is being deducted every pay day. She looks forward for your positive response and anything coming from you will surely be of great help. Lourdes also find ways to improve her income by selling pizza  and tocino, and she will use her loan to buy raw ingredients needed to generate more profit from this sideline. She will also use the loan for her child’s educational expenses.

Lourdes wants to be always efficient and productive in her workplace, and she also hopes to grow her business. She dreams of giving her family a better future through all her hard work. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conducts fellowship meeting for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre and post working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to buy supplies needed to make pizza and tocino.

loans.name: Tuan's Group

texts.en:
Tuan, 43 years old, is divorced and has a son. For the past four years, Tuan has been running an electrical shop to repair old products to earn an income to support his family. He is the Group Leader of a 7-member loan group that lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

In the picture he is standing on the right and wearing a striped T-shirt. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. He is requesting a loan to purchase some electrical tools for his business. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and attract additional ones. 

He also hopes that through his loan he will be able to increase his income and save money for any future difficulties facing his family.

loans.use: to buy some electrical tools for his electronics repair service.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza, 41, is a married woman with four children, two of whom are currently in school.

She is a very hard working entrepreneur with a barber shop business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 18 years. Liza requests a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

In the future, Liza would like to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her to increase the size of her store and to increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, 35, is married and has a son and a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a worker for a local company. 

Hong started a tailor shop fifteen years ago and requests a loan to expand her business by buying materials and fabric to make and sell clothes. She wants to better satisfy her customers. She hopes that her business will run smoothly and  generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabric and material to make and sell clothes.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is 39 years old and is married with a daughter. Lan and her family lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband supports the family by running his own business. 

Lan started her business to sell shoes ten years ago. She requests a loan to expand her business by buying  beautiful, quality  shoes to meet her customers' needs. 

She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy and sell shoes.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en: Dung is requesting a new loan to buy a motorbike to enable her to more easily travel and transport raw ingredients from her local market to her house, where she prepares food to sell from her stall. This purchase will help her to be more efficient and to better satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her to increase the size of her food stall and to increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to go to and from the market.

loans.name: Hong's Group

texts.en:
Hong is 38 years old and lives with her two children and husband. Her husband is now retired because of illness. For the past 18 years, Hong has run a business of sewing clothes to earn income to support her family. Hong is the group leader of a six-member loan group in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, she is the second from the right wearing a light yellow blouse. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities.

Hong is requesting a loan to purchase better quality sewing materials. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties her family might face.

loans.use: to purchase better quality sewing materials

loans.name: Wakorintho Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who was born in 1968, is a widow with five children:  two are married and the others attend school. For four years since her husband died, she has managed a small food business, a local restaurant. This business serves a breakfast of soups, bites and tea; and a lunch of rice, ugali and cooked banana with meat, vegetables, and beans. Her business is open from 6 AM to 6 PM. With these hours, she is able to make a fair profit, which she uses to cover school fees, rent, family meals, and purchases of a cupboard, bed and mattress, and business chairs. 

She is really working hard to sustain the well-being of her family. In the coming years, Mariam would like to make sure her kids can attend a university. 

Mariam is now requesting her third loan via Tujijenge Tanzania, a Kiva partner. She managed to repay back the previous loans successfully and used them  to buy charcoal cooking stoves, utensils and ingredients. She really improved her business, and much thanks goes to Kiva lenders who supported her business and other group members. Even though Mariam migrated to a new place without having anything but her family, loans from Tujijenge Tanzania made all of this possible.
 
Mariam will share this credit with her group, Wakorintho, which consists of seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Mariam will invest her portion of credit to replenish her restaurant with rice, beans, baking and maize flour, together with ingredients for soup.

loans.use: to replenish her food cooking store with rice,beans,baking and maize flour together with making for soup in the morning.

loans.name: 22-Alpaquitas De La 16 Group

texts.es:
Esperanza es un mujer de 34 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 8 años y una hija de 14 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida típica.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, constante, paciente, de buen carácter, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la populosa zona ‘Gran poder’ un lugar caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas y por la festividad del señor Jesús del Gran Poder; que es tradicional, costumbrista y se celebra con una extraordinaria demostración folclórica en honor de la imagen (en lienzo) que se venera en el Templo del lugar.
Esperanza es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español por el comercio (sentada a la izquierda, sueter rosado). Su vida la realiza con sus dos hijos que estudian en la escuela y viven en una casa antigua de adobe que cuenta con electricidad, agua, gas y telefono. La necesidad de prosperar en su negocio la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de chompas, tejido de ropa de bebe, venta de papas fritas, venta de ropa deportiva, tienda de barrio, carnicería y tienda de videos, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades comerciales. Su negocio es la venta de comida típica y almuerzo, como; saice (carne molida y arroz), plato paceño (choclo, papa, habas, queso y carne), trucha frita, revuelto (papas fritas, carne molida, arvejas y arroz), sajta de pollo (pollo picante) y otros, en un puesto de venta que heredó de su mamá hace más de veinte años. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en todo el tiempo que viene cocinando. Su negocio cuenta con clientes habituales que trabajan en el lugar y comen ahí todos los días, también reparte comida en las tiendas cercanas que trabajan durante toda la jornada diaria. Su sueño es tener una cadena de restaurantes reconocida. Ella desea invertir todos los ahorros de su vida en la compra de un pequeño terreno en la ciudad de el alto, para construir una casa y dejarles de herencia a sus hijos.
Es por esos motivos que Esperanza solicita un préstamo para la compra de un pequeño terreno para darles a sus hijos donde vivir.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a 34 year old woman, she is single and has an 8 year old son and a 14 year old daughter. She makes a living selling typical food dishes. She is enterprising, independent, consistent, patient, of good character, responsible and hard working. She works in the populous "Gran Poder" zone, a place characterized by its abundant commerce and the "Señor Jesús del Gran Poder" festivity, a traditional, costumed celebration that is an extraordinary folkloric demonstration in honor of the image that is venerated in the area's temple.
Esperanza is tan skinned, has short, braided, black hair. Her native tongue is Aymara and she speaks Spanish for commerce (she is seated on the left with the pink sweater). She lives her life with her two children, both students, and they live in an old home where she has electricity, water, gas and a telephone. 
Her need to prosper in her business led her to establish a communal bank of people who make a living in a variety of ways such as: selling jackets, knitting baby clothing, selling french fries, selling sportswear, running a small neighborhood store, running a butcher shop and running a video store. Her intentions are to request a loan and improve their commercial activities. 
She personally makes a living selling typical lunch dishes such as: saice (ground beef and rice), plato paceño (corn on the cob, potatoes, broad beans, cheese and meat), trucha frita (fried trout), revuelto (french fries, ground beef, peas and rice), sajta de pollo (spicy chicken) and others. She sells them out of a stand that she inherited from her mother more than twenty years ago. 
This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in all the time that she has been cooking. Her business enjoys regular clients that work in the area and eat there every day. She also distributes food to the nearby stores that work during the whole workday. 
Her dream is to have a renowned chain of restaurants. She wishes to invest all of her life savings in the purchase of a small piece land in the city of El Alto to build a a house and leave it as inheritance for her children. This is the reason that Esperanza is requesting a loan for the purchase of a small piece of land to give her children a place to live.

loans.use: purchase a small piece of land to give her children a place to live.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Retailing helped Jonathan survive for the family. He sells charcoal and earns a meager income of PHP 7,000 per month. He found the business of buying and selling charcoal easy and simple because all he needed to do is to weigh and repack the charcoal for his buyers. Jonathan plans to expand her retailing business. He has applied for a loan to PMPC for the needed capital. He wants to purchase inventories of charcoal for retail. Jonathan smiles at the fact to see all his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Luis Armando

texts.es: Luis es un señor de 48 años de edad, el esta casado y tiene 6 hijos, pero de ellos solo 2 viven con el y se encuentran estudiando, Luis trabaja de chofer y tambien se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y es su esposa quien le ayuda en este negocio, el credito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para criarlos en unos corrales que construyo con uno de sus hijos ya que dice que este negocio es familiar, la aspiracion de Luis es que le siga yendo bien en este negocio y seguir trabajando con el apoyo de su esposa para tener buenos ingresos para en algun momento comprar una casita que sea propia ya que en la actualidad viven arrendando.
texts.en: Luis is a 48 year old man, he is married and has 6 children, but only two of them live with him and are studying.  Luis works as a driver and also makes a living raising young animals and his wife helps him with this business.  He will invest the loan in buying pigs to raise them in a pig pen which he built with one of his sons, as he says that this is a family business. Luis's aspiration is that things keep going well with his business and that he can keep working with his wife to have a good income so that at some point he can buy a little house which he could own, as they currently rent.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh, 52, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her  daughter and her husband. Hanh and her husband earn money through their general store and sell food and household items. They have had this business for twenty years. 

Hanh would  like a loan to buy food and beverages to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her child, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages.

loans.name: Blandie

texts.en:
Blandie is 53 years old and married with five children, two attend school, Blandie works very hard to provide for them.

She has run a general store for 4 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar.

In the future, Blandie would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy  canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Trinh

texts.en:
Trinh, 50, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her  two sons and husband. Trinh's husband earns money as a driver for hire. 

Trinh  has run a food shop for 17 years, to sell meals to her local customers. She would like a loan to buy quantities of  food and ingredients to make better meals to meet her customers' needs. 

She also hopes that her business will ensure that her family members, especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy food and ingredients to make meals.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a handicraft business in the Philippines. Mildred has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more raw materials like shells, nylon threads, wire, etc. for her business. She has been in this business for 12 years now. In the future, Mildred would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials like shells, nylon threads, wire, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 45-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past several days, his rickshaw has not been working properly. Because of that, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. 

However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore, Musarat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to repair the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Musarat is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC  Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es:
José  de 27 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene 3 hijos de 3, 8 y 13 años de edad, solo dos estudian. Él solo estudio hasta 3° grado de educación básica, dejo la escuela para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar. Solo su pareja y sus hijos viven con él.

José  es agricultor tiene 10 años de experiencia, oficio que aprendió de su padre con quien trabajaba desde muy pequeño, su pareja le apoya con las actividades agrícolas, cultivan maíz, pipián y tiene una parcela sembrada con plátano a 1km de su casa.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar semilla, fertilizante y pesticidas, también para preparar el terreno y pagar mano de obra para la siembra de maíz. Su sueño es construir una casa de ladrillo y comprar 3 vacas lecheras.
texts.en:
José, 27, is in a relationship and has three children aged 3, 8 and 13. Two of them go to school. He could only study up to the third grade of primary school, when he had to  quit to help his parents to cover the home expenses. He lives with his partner and his children.

José has been working in agriculture for ten years. He learned this activity from his father, with whom he works since he was a little boy. His partner helps him to grow corn and squash, and he has a plantain plantation located 1 km [0,6 miles] away from home.

He will use this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides, and to prepare the land and pay for the labor needed to grow corn. His dream is to build a brick house and buy three dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides, prepare the land, and pay for the labor needed to grow corn.

loans.name: Francis Juanah

texts.en:
Francis Juanah is a 22-year-old married woman and a mother of a 2-year-old child from Ormoc, Leyte. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than two years now. Francis Juanah also earns an additional income through her retail sales of clothing and skin care products.

Francis Juanah is asking for a loan to buy animal feed for the pigs. With this loan, she will be able to improve her hog-raising business, as well as her profit from it. Moreover, she wants to save money for reinvestment in the same business and for the future schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a merchant from Leyte, Philippines. She is 62 years old and has been in the business for more than three years now. She sells various goods and items to the people in her place. Imelda is sitting next to empty bottles of soft drinks. She plans to buy more for her store.

Imelda is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like soft drinks, rice and animal feed. This loan will enable her to improve her business. Imelda hopes to make her business more sustainable and profitable so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soft drinks, rice and animal feed.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is driven by the passion to sell. At the age of 56, a married woman living in Dumalinao, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, she runs a store that primarily supports her family. Everyday, she never grows tired of tending her store.
