Marieta is a full fledged member of PMPC and has been awarded several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. Now, she requests another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Having enough inventory would provide income opportunities. 

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell.

location.town: Pagadian - Anonang, Dumalinao, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 64 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling books in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of different books to sell.

Leonila has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell book business for 20 years and also earns an income from food vending. Leonila aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of different books to sell.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan es un joven trabajador, tiene 26 años de edad y se dedica a la crianza de pollos y tambien trabaja de albañil, el es un joven colombiano que se vino a Ecuador en busca de trabajo ya que en su pais natal no tenia en que trabajar, el  credito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para criarlos en un pequeño galpon que hay en la casa en la que vive arrendando, la aspiracion de Juan es trabajar duro y mejorar su negocio salir adelante.
texts.en:
Juan is a young worker, 26 years old, who raises chickens and, also, works as a bricklayer. He is a young Colombian who came to Ecuador in search of work, since in his country of birth, he was unable to find employment.

He plans to invest his loan in purchasing chickens to raise in a small existing pen in the rental house where he lives. 

Juan's ambition is to work hard and improve his business in order to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Salasala Group

texts.en:
Felix is a married father of two sons who are at school. He is aged in his mid 30s. For seven years now, he has been managing his family by running a business of products supplies; he buys different items and resells them to shopkeepers around the streets. He uses the motorbike to supply those products, but he wishes he could manage a minibus so as to be able to better manage his business and customer demand. His working time is from 4 a.m., early in the morning, and he ends up at 3 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his 20th credit request. He has paid back all his previous loans successfully. Felix and the other six members from Salasala group will hold each other accountable for paying back the 20th credit request. He used the previous credits to buy a motorbike, which he uses to supply products, and bought more improved business inventories. Felix earned profit which he used to cover school fees and household expenses. In the coming years, he would like to manage successfully his enterprise. 

He will use part of his loan to buy products to resell.

loans.use: to buy products to resell.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia sends you her thankfulness for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to purchase additional bags and tailoring supplies. The loan also helped with their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will help her borrow an amount of 19,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stocks of bags and other supplies needed in her business. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will then result in Sonia's business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from buying a new sewing machine, Sonia wants to renovate their house. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for bags needed in her business.

loans.name: Luis Armando

texts.es: Luis tiene 20 años de edad, y son 3 años que se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, el vive con sus padres pero su  criadero de chanchos y pollos los tiene en un lugar de un  clima calido  que queda retirado de su casa  asi que la mayor parte del tiempo pasa en ese lugar cuidando a sus animales, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para mejorar su negocio y seguir adelante con su negocio, lo que Luis espera de su negocio es readecuarlo para que su negocio sea mas rentable y productivo.
texts.en: Luis is 20 years old and it's been 3 years since he's been making a living raising small animals.  He lives with his parents but his pig and chicken farm is in a place with warm climate located at a distance from his home and so most of his time is spent in this location taking care of his animals.  He will invest the loan in buying pigs to improve his business and move his business forward.  What Luis hopes most for his business is to readjust it to make it more profitable and productive.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Faith And Hope Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Helen, a member of Faith and Hope Women Group. She is 39 years old, married, and blessed with two children.  She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in December 2013. Helen operates a retail kiosk, where she sells goods like flour, sugar, cooking fat and other household items. She has undergone HiH EA training, which has enabled her acquire skills of enterprise and financial management.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to expand her business by adding more stock of flour, sugar and cooking fat. This will attract more customers, hence more income, which will assist her to educate her children, and to provide medical care and other family needs. Helen is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Kihingo Fadc Commercial Farmers Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is named Mary, a member of Kihingo FADC Commercial Farmers Self Help Group. She is 31 years old, married, and blessed with seven children. 

Mary does maize farming to earn a living. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to be trained on savings mobilization, enterprise creation, and financial management.

Mary is borrowing a loan from Kiva to boost her farming by buying fertilizer and hybrid seeds. She hopes the crop yield will improve, hence, increasing her income. This will enable her to cater to her family's needs, such as food and education. 
 
Mary is very grateful to Kiva and promises to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hybrid seeds.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: In the year 2010, Lorna learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it offers. As a farmer in Liloy, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to start her mango production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Lorna feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Lorna wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply mangoes in wholesale in big markets.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lolita works hard to support her family. She sells used clothes in the Philippines, and also earns income from food vending.  

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She is now requesting a PHP 30000 loan to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell. 

Lolita hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Lisseth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lisseth de 21 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 1 hijo que estudia en el kínder, su esposo es empleado, trabaja como auxiliar en una ferretería de la localidad. Ella convive con su madre, hermano parea e hijo.

Lisseth es comerciante, tiene algo tiempo de administrar una tienda, ella comenta que le va muy bien incluso a veces gana más de lo que se proyecta. El préstamo será utilizado para comprar arreglos florales, se acerca la fecha de los difuntos y su cas esta camino al cementerio general y quiere aprovecha el día para hacer algún tipo de negocio por la gran afluencia de gente.

Lisseth piensa invertir en su tienda, su hijo esta creciendo y pronto necesitara estudiar y ella piensa costear sus estudios.
texts.en:
Lisseth, 21 years old, is in a relationship and has a child in kindergarden.  Her husband is employed; he works as an assistant in a hardware store in the area.  Lisseth lives  with her mother, brother, partner and son.

Lisseth is a business woman; she has been running a store for quite a while.  She comments that this is going well for her, and that at times she even earns more than she had expected.  The loan will be used to buy some floral arrangements.  The Day of the Dead is approaching and her house is on the way to the main cemetery, and Lisseth wants to take advantage of the day to make some sales due to the large number of people in passage.

Lisseth wants to invest in her store; her son growing and soon will need to be in school, and she is planning how to pay for his education.

loans.use: to buy floral arrangements

loans.name: Narannyam

texts.en: Mr. Narannyam has used his previous loan to buy clothes in large amounts. Due to the increasing demand for winter clothes, he is planning on buying winter boots from China. For this cause, he is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT. The borrower is a hardworking individual who cares deeply for his mother and sister.

loans.use: to buy winter boots to sell

loans.name: Jessierre

texts.en:
Jessierre is a hardworking entrepreneur who has been operating a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines for four years. She earns additional income selling cosmetics.

Jessierre has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 14000 to purchase more stocks to sell such as pants, shirts, etc. 

Jessierre dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell such as pants, shirts, etc

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 26-year-old woman, who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years; he is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family. Balqees is also providing sewing services to earn income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.
 
She needs different kinds of goods like needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc. for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories, and also help her to increase monthly sales and profits by providing better sewing services. Balqees is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
This is Zipporah, a 40-year-old married mother blessed with five children. Zipporah joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2012 and benefited from training on savings mobilization, enterprise creation and financial management. She earns her living by practicing maize farming. 

Zipporah is borrowing to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds for planting. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and hence increased income. This will help her meet the cost of educating her children. 

Zipporah is grateful to Kiva and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for planting

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon is a 32-year-old, married man from Leyte, Philippines. He earns a living through his retail sales of coconut wine and soft drinks. Marlon is asking for a loan to buy more coconut wine and soft drinks. He believes that a loan will greatly help him to improve his business, thus augmenting his income. In the future, he wants to improve his way of living. He also wants to save money for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine and soft drinks.

loans.name: Muong Phang 10 Group

texts.en:
Un is a Thai lady who has had experience in working at cultivation since she was a child. She has married, and her husband is also a farmer. They have been working hard on a small land to provide for their family of nine people. 

Cultivating rice is the main production of the family, but it doesn't generate enough income to cover all their living expenses. Thus, Dien raises pigs, chickens and fish to have additional earnings. 

To expand production, she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program to buy young fish because fish farming has brought her the best profits in comparison to the others. This is the first loan she has had in the program, and she hopes that her investment will go prosperously with the support of the socio-economic team of Anh Chi Em. 

In the picture, Dien is the woman who wears a Thai traditional costume with a pink shirt and stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy young fish

loans.name: Maritza Gabriela

texts.es: Maritza es madre soltera, ella tiene 24 años de edad y su hija tiene 3 años, Maritza  vive con sus padres y se dedica a la crianza de cuyes desde hace 3 años atrás, ella necesita el crédito para comprar cuyes y tenerlos en cuyeras que construyo con su madre para tener sus animales, comenta que le va bien en este negocio ya que los cuyes se los vende a buen precio, ella aspira seguir adelante  con su negocio y tener los ingresos suficientes para darle lo necesario a su hija.
texts.en:
Maritza is a single mother, she is 24 years old and her daughter is 3 years old. Maritza lives with her parents and has made a living raising guinea pigs for the past three years. She needs the loan to purchase guinea pigs to keep in the coops that she built with her mother to keep her animals. 
She mentions that she does well in this business since the guinea pigs are sold at a good price. She aspires to continue with her business and to have enough income to provide whatever is necessary for her daughter.

loans.use: purchase guinea pigs

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
This is Milka, a mother of two children. She practices poultry farming and also does vegetable farming. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH-EA) to benefit from training for enterprise creation and financial management. The knowledge acquired has greatly helped her manage the enterprise effectively. 

She is borrowing a loan to buy fertilizer and manure to expand her farming.  She believes this will greatly boost her farming enterprise and ensure that she maintains food security in her household. Milka is grateful to Kiva and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Suma Sarnaka¥A Group

texts.es:
Edwin es un hombre de 34 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de tres años y su negocio es la confección y venta de calzados.
Él es emprendedor, activo, optimista, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Alto Chijini’ un lugar caracterizado por el comercio de frutas que traen desde el norte de la ciudad en grandes camiones para ser vendidos por mayor a comerciantes que se encargan de repartirla en diferentes mercados.
Edwin es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymará que utiliza con sus familiares, en el trabajo habla español (a la izquierda con suéter verde). Su vida la realiza con su pareja que se ocupa de las ventas y su pequeño niño que se encuentra al cuidado de la madre, viven en un departamento de ladrillo propiedad de sus suegros y cuenta con agua, electricidad y teléfono. El sueño por mejorar su calidad de vida para el futuro de su hijo lo llevó a conformar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de sándwiches, artesanía en yeso, venta de refrescos, librería, venta de productos cosméticos, venta de ropa y venta de fruta, para solicitar un préstamo y generar mejores utilidades. Su negocio es la confección y venta de zapatos, trabajo que realiza desde hace diez años, él se encarga de la confección de zapatos, botas y otros; realizando la compra de los materiales como, cuero, suela, tacos, etc., para que su esposa se encargue de la venta en su puesto de venta fijo en inmediaciones de la misma zona. Su sueño es adquirir una tienda con techo propio para realizar mejores ventas. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución. Él desea realizar la compra de una máquina de coser industrial, porque la que tiene ya se encuentra malograda por el constante uso.
Es por esos motivos que Edwin solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser industrial para ampliar su negocio y brindarle un futuro mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
Edwin is a 34-year-old man who lives with his wife and their 3-year-old son. His business makes and sells shoes.

Edwin is enterprising, active, optimistic, responsible, and hard-working. His business is located in the “Upper Chijini” district, known for its trade in fruit, which comes from the northern part of the city in large trucks to be sold at wholesale to merchants who resell the fruit in different markets.

Edwin's skin is dark, his black hair is cut short, and he is of medium stature. His maternal tongue is Aymara which he uses with family members. In his work, he speaks Spanish. (Edwin is on the left, wearing a green sweater.) He lives with his wife, who handles sales and cares for her small son. They live in a brick apartment that belongs to their in-laws and has water, electricity, and telephone services.

Edwin's dream of improving the quality of life for their son's future led him to form a bank of people with businesses such as: selling sandwiches, clay artisan works, soft drinks, books, cosmetics, clothing and fruit. They are requesting a loan to generate greater profits. 

Edwin makes shoes, work he has done for some 10 years. He creates shoes, boots, and other items, using materials such as leather, soles, heels, etc. His wife takes charge of sales in her market stall near the same zone.

His dream is to acquire a store with its own roof to improve sales. 

This is the bank's first loan cycle with this institution. Edwin hopes to purchase an industrial sewing machine because the one he has is worn out from constant use.

These are Edwin's motives for requesting a loan to purchase an industrial sewing machine in order to expand his business and offer his son a better future.

loans.use: buy an industrial sewing machine to expand his business and offer a better future to his son.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana de 54 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos,  dos son mayores de edad y solo uno vive con ella. Ana no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por lo que se dedicó al trabajo del campo, su esposo era agricultor y murió a la edad de 40 años. Solo su hijo vive con ella.

Ana trabaja la tierra con su hijo, desde que estaba muy pequeña trabajó con sus padres y aprendió, luego trabajó con su esposo y ahora lo hace con su hijo, cultiva ajonjolí desde hace 10 años y es de esta manera como se gana la vida.

El préstamo será utilizado para cosechar el ajonjolí, es el momento de hacer y si ser espera mucho la semilla se cae y creando pérdidas para la familia.

Ana espera contar siempre con l ayuda de CrediCampo para cuando necesite trabajar.
texts.en:
Ana of 54 years old, is a widow and has 3 children, 2 are older and only 1 still lives with her.  Ana didn't have the opportunity to study which is why she made a living doing farm work. Her husband was a farmer and died at 40 years old. Only her son lives with her. Ana works in the fields with her son.  Since she was a little girl she worked with her parents and learned, later she worked with her husband and now she does it with her son.  She's been farming sesame for 10 years and this is how she earns a living. 

The loan will be used to harvest the sesame as it is time to do so and if too much time passes, the seed will fall and this creates losses for the family. Ana hopes to always count on the help of CrediCampo for when she needs work.

loans.use: to harvest sesame

loans.name: Rosmila

texts.en:
Rosmila works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear to sell.

Rosmila has been in this business for 10 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear to sell.

loans.name: Pedro Fabian

texts.es: Pedro es un señor que se dedique a la agricultura y también trabaja de chofer, pedro tiene 3 hijos de los que es responsable y está pendiente de lo que ellos necesiten, Pedro va a invertir el crédito en la compra de fungicidas y abono para tener sanos sus cultivos y para tener una buena cosecha, la aspiración de Pedro es seguir trabajando para mejorar su negocio y de ser posible le gustaría comprarse un terreno para sembrar sus cultivos ya que en la actualidad tiene que pagar arriendo para sembrar sus productos.
texts.en: Pedro is a man who works in agriculture and also as a driver. Pedro has three children under his charge, and he is attentive to their needs. Pedro will use the loan to buy fungicides and manure in order to have healthy crops and a good harvest. Pedro's dream is to keep on working to improve his business. If possible, he would like to buy a piece of land to grow his crops, because at the moment he has to rent the land where he grows his products.

loans.use: to buy manure and fungicides.

loans.name: Nayyer

texts.en:
Nayyer is a 29-year-old married women, and she is responsible mother of one son. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 20 years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to make maintenance of his taxi, because the current condition of his taxi is not good.  It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to make the maintenance of his taxi. Therefore, Nayyer  has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this, loan Nayyer's husband can easily afford the maintenance cost, and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Nayyer also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income, to meet her family's needs in the future. Nayyer is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Daysi Verónica

texts.es:
Actualmente se dedica al comercio de celulares, cámaras digitales  y otros objetos electrónicos  a profesionales en los hospitales, centros educativos y otras instituciones.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar  artículos electrónicos para aprovechar la época de feria en su comunidad, que según su análisis es cuando más se venden este tipo de productos, celulares, cargadores, cámaras, cables de transferencias de archivos, memorias y más.

Daysi tiene pensado formalizar su negocio poniendo un local estilo boutique de accesorios electrónicos.
texts.en:
Currently she makes a living selling cell phones, digital cameras and other electronics to professionals in hospitals, educational centers and other institutions.  The loan will be used to buy electronics to take advantage of the fair season in her community, which according to her analysis is when this type of product (cell phones, chargers, cameras, cables to transfer documents, memory cards and more) is most sold.

Daysi is thinking of formalizing her business by opening up a boutique style shop of electronic accessories.

loans.use: to buy more electronics to take advantage of the fair season in her community

loans.name: María Celsa

texts.es: María invertirá el préstamo en su tienda, quiere comprar 4 quintales de granos básicos, arroz, maíz frijol y maicillo para venderlo por libra en su tienda y sacarle más provecho. Ella espera mantener estable su tienda para dar el sustento a sus hijos.
texts.en: María will use the loan for her store. She wants to buy 4 quintals of basic grains, rice, corn, beans and sorghum, so she can sell them by the pound in her store and get more profit. She hopes to keep her store stable so she can provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy four quintals of basic grains, rice, corn, beans and sorghum

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 26-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of three children, and her husband is a plumber by profession. He is only responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Samina has also been doing her business of clothes selling for the past six years and contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

Samina needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, she is not in the position to buy these clothes for her business purpose; therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.

loans.use: to increase her clothes business by buying different types of clothes for reselling

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina is 53 years old, and married with three adult-age children. She lives in Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines.  She engages in selling flowers in a neighboring village.  She joined Paglaum last 2007, and availed loans to buy fertilizer and compost for her flower garden.  She hopes and prays with the support of Paglaum financing, she will become a flower supplier in neighboring towns and hopes to open her own flower shop someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost for her flower garden.

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.en:
Abdurahmon was born in the year 1996. He is a clever and industrious man. Abdurahmon is not married and lives with his parents, sister and brother. He graduated school with excellent marks and successfully applied to the Tajikistan State University Commerce. He is a student of the first course now. Abdurahmon learns economy. He works after classes as a master of repairing houses, and he earns his living in this way. 

Abdurahmon needs to financial support now, because he must pay for tuition. He is asking for a loan of 600 USD to pay for university. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Kadiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de  femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé en Décembre 2013. Il regroupe en son sein des femmes  qui sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente et solidarité les membres. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Kadiatou   (debout à droite avec une main levée), est emprunteur vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 22 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03enfant (02 garçons et 01 fille). Elle s’active dans la vente de petits ruminants, qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour la revendre après engraissement.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter cinq moutons à un prix moyen de 20 000 F  CFA l’un pour les revendre plus cher au boucher et vendeur  de viande dans la commune.

 Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de mieux soutenir son mari dans la gestion de la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group is made up of women who are very active in the 'Banc Villageois' which was created in December 2013.  The women all come from the same neighbourhood, get along well with one another and are mutually supportive.  They all work in small commerce businesses.

Kadiatou (standing on the right with her hand raised) is the group representative.  She is 22 years old, married and has three children (2 boys and 1 girl).  She sells ruminant animals which she buys from the weekly markets.  She then fattens them up before selling them on.

Kadiatou plans to use her loan to buy five sheep for an average price of 20,000 francs CFA each.  She will then sell them on to local butchers and meat sellers, for a higher price.  Her profits will be used to help her husband provide for the education expenses of their children.

loans.use: to buy 5 sheep for fattening up and then resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bulk grains, personal hygiene products, kitchen goods, sweets, drinks, fruits and some vegetables.

loans.name: Min

texts.en:
Min is 52 years old and married with 2 children, a son and a daughter who are both married. He has a pig farm in rural China. He has been running this business for 13 years. His wife is helping with the business as well. The couple started this business with just a few pigs 13 years ago.  Every single day since, the couple, with their standard working attire, cleans the sty and feeds the pigs from dawn to dusk. Min and his wife are hardworking and determined individuals.

Min requested this loan through MicroCred for ¥20,000 to purchase pig feed. He says that the extra income from this loan will expand his business and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Santos Emigdio

texts.es:
Santos de 66 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos que ya son mayores de edad y tiene su hogar propio. Él vive solo con su esposa. Santos es empleado, trabaja como jardinero en una institución gubernamental muy importante y es encargado del que las plantas estén en muy buen estado.

El préstamo lo necesita para hacer una reparación urgente en el techo de su casa, no cuenta con el dinero que necesario por lo que opto por el préstamo. Santos piensa trabajar un par de años más para luego disfrutar la vida junto a su esposa.
texts.en:
Santos, who is 66 years old, is married and has three children who are already adults and have their own households. He lives with only his wife. Santos is employed. He works as a gardener at a very important government institution, and he is in charge of keeping the plants in very good condition.

He needs the loan to make an urgent repair on the roof of his house. He doesn't have the money that is necessary, and so he opted for a loan. Santos is thinking of working for a few more years, and then enjoying life with his wife.

loans.use: to make an urgent repair on the roof of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, nails, varnish and paints needed for furniture making.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, 54 years old, is single and has been buying and selling grocery goods in her village to make a living. She earns better income from this business and was able to sustain it and make some home improvements out of her profit.

Lydia borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to purchase additional grocery goods to attract customers. She plans to buy cosmetics and grains, in addition to her inventory stocks, to have more to offer.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to attract customers.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is a 43-year-old woman who is a mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Fozia’s husband is fruit seller who sells apples, bananas, grapes and other fruit. He is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing their household income. Fozia's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits to sell to increase the size of his business, improve his sales, and earn maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position, he is not able to purchase fruits for his business. 

Fozia is requesting a Kiva loan from the field partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase fruit to sell. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase different types of fruit to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover some family expenses that he has

loans.name: Jacquilou

texts.en:
Jaquilou is a married woman and a mother of two children, ages four and five. She lives with her family in Ormoc, Leyte. Jaquilou is engaged in retail sales of coconut wine and soft drinks. Coconut wine is a local drink that can also be fermented into vinegar. 

Jaquilou is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell such as coconut wine and soft drinks. With her loan, she will be able to cater to more buyers in her store. In the future, Jaquilou hopes to make her business productive and sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy coconut wine and soft drinks

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie enjoys managing her bakery business. She has bakery boys who bake bread to sell in her stall. Lanie shares that, through her business, she is able to provide for her children's needs in school. 

Lanie wants to extend her business since she has gained more customers. She needs additional capital for her business and decided to borrow a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy flour, sugar, margarine and other ingredients for baking bread. Lanie hopes for continued growth of her business for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, margarine and other ingredients for baking bread.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 43 years old and is single. 

She has a sari-sari (variety) store business where she can generate income to support her family. She has been in this kind of business for 20 years and has gainfully made earnings. Because of it, she needs to have her sari-sari inventory to supply the needs. 

She borrowed money from PMPC amounting to 10,500 PHP (Philippines pesos). This is a great help for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy various sari-sari (variety) store commodities to supply the demand of the customers

loans.name: Shehnaz Bibi

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 42 years old and a mother of seven children. Along with her husband, she runs a dairy farm. Shehnaz and her husband work together to earn more income to support their big family. BRAC Pakistan has initiated a program called Ambitios to empower women by giving small enterprise loans, other then microfinance loans, to women entrepreneurs in Pakistan. 

Shehnaz is requesting a loan to purchase additional cows for her farm as part of the Ambitios loan program. She is happy with BRAC's initiative and is hopeful that her loan will help her increase her earnings. Shehnaz wants to save some income for the future.

loans.use: to buy additional cows to increase milk production and supply

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en: Adelia is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 15 years, Adelia has operated an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials such as abaca fiber, etc. for her business. In the future, Adelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials such as abaca fiber, etc. for her business

loans.name: Ramatoulaye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc village est créé le 01 décembre 2009,  ce groupement est très actif. Les membres sont très dynamiques et désireux d’améliorer leurs conditions socio économiques. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village depuis plusieurs décennies, elles un bon esprit de groupe caractérisé par la solidarité. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce accompagné de la culture sous pluies.

Madame Ramatoulaye (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle âgée de 39 ans, est mariée et mère de quatre  enfants dont deux garçons et deux filles. Elle s’active dans la vente  du sucre qu’elle achète auprès des fournisseurs  par sac et des grosses de thé. 

Avec ce nouveau prêt elle compte s’approvisionner pour au moins 04 sacs de sucre  à 20 000 F CFA le sac et du thé à 1000F la grosse  pour la revente par détail à 600 F CFA le kg et le thé à 100f. 

Les bénéfices qui découleront de ces activités lui permettront de mieux  soutenir son mari dans le prise en charge des besoins de sa famille en améliorant l’alimentation.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was created on December 1, 2009 and is a very active group. The members are very dynamic and intent on improving their socio-economic conditions. They have all lived in the same village for several decades and they have a good group spirit, characterized by solidarity. Their main activity is small-scale commercial businesses accompanied by rainy season agriculture. 

Madame Ramatoulaye (seated on the far right with her hand raised), is the featured borrower of this group. She is 39, married, and the mother of four children, two sons and two daughters. She sells sugar, which she buys from suppliers by the sack, and cartons of tea bags. 

With this new loan she intends to stock up by buying at least four sacks of sugar at 20,000 F CFA per sack, and tea at 1000 F the gross to sell retail at 600 F CFA per kilogram and, in the case of the tea, at 100 F. 

The profit that will be derived from these activities will permit her to better assist her husband in covering the expenses of the family and improving their nutrition.

loans.use: to stock up on sugar and tea for resale so that she can improve her family's nutrition

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a businesswoman from San Miguel. She is 50 years old, married and has expertise in sales. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. 

Delia is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without record of default. Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. 

Delia continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

location.town: Pagadian - San Miguel. Zambo. del Sur

loans.name: Essa

texts.fr:
Elle pratique le commerce comme son principal activité.

Essa est une femme mariée et mère d'un garçon. Elle est âgée de 22 ans
Elle mène comme activité la restauration et le commerce.

Avec son crédit,elle compte réfectionner son restaurant et aussi acheter des équipements comme les assiettes,un réfrigérateur.

avec les bénéfices réalisés par son activité,elle va augmenter son épargne et soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Essa is a married woman and mother to one son.  She is 22 years old and she runs a restaurant business and works in commerce.  She plans to use her loan to renovate her restaurant and buy some new equipment, such as plates and a refrigerator.

Essa will use her profits to increase her level of savings and help her husband to provide for their family.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena, 53, is married and a mother of two grown up children. She lives with her family in Ormoc, Leyte. Elena is engaged in retail sales of coconut wine and soft drinks. She is sitting next to a container of a coconut wine and cases of soft drinks. 

Elena is asking for a loan to buy more stock such as coconut wine, soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries. Elena believes that this loan will help her in improving her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as coconut wine, soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 38 years old and has two children. She is married and her two children are in school.

Aileen is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Aileen requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in the pig fattening business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Aileen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is single woman who has no children. For the past three years, she has operated a dairy farm, selling retail at the market to local residents and restaurant operators. Fatuma’s major business challenge is seasonality at her farm. She owns a house with electricity and running water and her greatest monthly expense is food. Fatuma decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her savings. 

Fatuma is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase medicine for her livestock and to buy cow feed.

loans.use: to purchase medicine and feed for her livestock

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba is 19 years old. She is a student of the second course at Tajikistan State University, Politics and Business. She is a single woman. 

Nasiba studies at the faculty of Finance Management. She is one of the successful students. Nasiba often goes to the library and reads a lot of books. She has read both classic literature and modern literature. 

After graduating university, Nasiba plans to work in the manufacturing sector and develop this sector of Tajikistan. 

She is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Nemsie

texts.en:
Nemsie makes good earnings on her farming activities in Liloy. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her five children to school. 

She wants to increase her farm yield, especially now that she has high cost of living when her children entered college. Nemsie approached Paglaum to borrow an amount to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: SOKHNA est une femme âgée de 56 ans et qui s’active toujours dans l’habillement. Elle est mariée et mère de famille et elle a un parent bénéficiaire de crédit dans l’institution. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans et sollicite ce montant pour acheter des habits, des chaussures et des parfums pour les revendre à ses clients. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des charges quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.  Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. Elle voudrait à l’avenir avoir sa propre cantine afin de pouvoir renforcer son stock de marchandises et diversifier ses produits. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et épargner de l’argent à coté.
texts.en:
Sokhna is a 56-year-old woman who works in the clothing business.  She is married and has children.  She also has a family member who works with the same field partner.

Sokhna has more than ten years' experience in her business.  She plans to use her loan to buy clothing, shoes and perfumes to sell to her customers.  She helps her husband to provide for the day-to-day expenses of their family and the schooling costs of their children.  Sokhna starts her working day at eight in the morning and finishes at six in the evening.

In the future, Sokhna would like to have her own shop so that she can increase her stock levels and diversify the range of products she offers.  This would, in turn, increase her revenue, improve the living conditions of her family and increase her savings level.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes and perfumes for resale.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a 55-year-old married woman with five children. One of her children is still in school. Marilou is a merchant from Dulag, Leyte, who runs a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells basic items such as cooking oil, soap, noodles, canned goods, sugar, bread, seasonings and soft drinks. She also catches and sells fish to nearby communities. Marilou has been engaged in these businesses for almost 10 years.

Marilou is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan to purchase various stocks for her store as well as fishing materials such as a fishing net. These are essential tools that would improve her catch and attract more customers. In the future, Marilou would like to expand both of her businesses to improve her living status. She also wants to continue to send her youngest child to school to complete a college education.

loans.use: to purchasestock for her store and a fishing net

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is 45 years old and lives in Calaran, Calamba, Philippines.  He has experienced hardships, especially during the time when he had no permanent work. It came as a blessing to him when he was offered work in a bakery and eventually he assumed the running of the operation by himself. Sammy and his boss agreed to pay for the bakery equipment and rental of the space in installments.

Sammy joined Paglaum Cooperative because he was in need of additional working capital. He has applied for a loan to buy baking ingredients such as flour, sugar, etc. and a portion of his loan will be paid to the bakery.  Being an MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, Sammy has been able to manage his income and provide for his family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour and sugar

loans.name: Scolasticah

texts.en:
Scolasticah is a single mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, Scolasticah has operated a clothing sales business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is the high cost of transportation. Scolasticah dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

Scolasticah wants to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 39-year-old woman who is married and a mother of one son. She resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. For the past two years, Suriya’s husband has been running a general store. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Her husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business. But due to financial constraints he is not in suitable position to buy all of the above products for reselling purposes. 

Suriya has applied for a Kiva loan from the field partner BRAC Pakistan to enable her husband to buy all these commodities. Her loan will also be helpful for him to earn the maximum profit to manage his household and business. Suriya is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other items for her husband's store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a 51 year old married mother of three from Ormoc City, Leyte. Elisa earns an income through a motorcycle transportation business. Her husband uses it in transporting passengers around their locale. Elisa also has additional income through her hog raising business. 

Elisa would like to take a loan to buy spare parts for the motorcycle, like a wheel, a tire, nuts and bolts, chains etc. Additionally she will buy piglets to raise. Through this loan, Elisa is confident that she can improve her business and her income.  Moreover, she wants to save money in order for her to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for their motorcycle like a wheel, a tire, nuts and bolts, chains etc.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (variety) store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Rosita was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Luís Alfredo

texts.es:
Luís de 28 años de edad,  estudio hasta  6ª grado por lo económico y que tenia que caminar muy largo abandono la escuela, esta acompañado y su pareja cuida la familia tiene 3 hijos.
 
Luís desde hace 7ª años se dedica a prestar su servicio como seguridad y dice que la necesidad llevo a dedicarse a este trabajo, en su tiempo libre siembra maíz, pues se lo enseño su padre su trabajo se encuentra a unos 10 km y para llegar sale a pie de su casa, camina como 25 minutos; luego toma un micro bus para llegar a su destino. Él labora 24 horas dentro y 24 horas descansa, su día comienza a las 5:00 a.m pero comenta que lo hace con dedicación pues su sueños es sacar adelante su familia.


El crédito sera invertirá en la compra de 2 novillas. Su sueño es construir su casa de ladrillo, hoy vive en una de bahareque, que sus hijos se preparen, pues él no pudo hacerlo. Con su trabajo espera pagar el crédito, para que les queden las novillas.
texts.en:
Luís, 28, studied up to sixth grade.  He left school because of the cost and because he had to walk a long way.  He lives with his partner, who takes care of the family and his three children.

Luís has worked in security since he was seven years old.  He said that need led him to get into that line of work.  In his free time he grows corn, which he learned from his father.

His job is about 10 kilometers away, and to get there he walks about 25 minutes from his house, then takes a bus.  He works 24 hours, then rests 24 hours.  His day begins at 5 a.m., but he said he does it with dedication because he dream is to get his family ahead.

The loan will be invested in buying two heifers.

His dream is to build a brick house (his current house is made of bamboo) and for his children to get an education, because he wasn't able to.  He hopes to pay the loan with his job so he can keep the heifers.

loans.use: to buy two heifers

loans.name: Elinita

texts.en:
Elinita is 50 years old and lives in Dumalinao, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with five children. For the past seven years, Elinita has run a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells basic commodities to meet the needs of her consumers. She has been a member of PMPC for five years.

Elinita is requesting a loan to restock her sari-sari store with basic commodities such as canned goods, noodles, and vinegar. In the future, she hopes to renovate her sari-sari store building.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, noodles, and vinegar

location.town: Pagadian - Anonang, Dumalinao, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, 40 years old, lives outside of Honiara in a rural community called Ngalimera just within the Guadacanal plains. She is married with one child and two adopted children. 

Previously, she used to do gardening and sell betel-nut to provide her family's financial needs. Additionally, she and her husband also planted one hectare of cocoa, prior to that she used to buy wet cocoa beans from the community for $400 since she didn't have any source of capital to buy more. With the loan she got from SPBD, she managed to buy more cocoa beans, which in return increases her income. 

She believes that after getting more loans from SPBD, she will be able to improve the living condition of her family, help her two adopted children to access education, and further improve her business by building a bigger cocoa drier to earn more income in her business.

loans.use: To buy cocoa beans for her business

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a married woman; she has four children, all of whom attend school. Purity owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Purity operates a firewood selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her same business.
 
With the 35,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and also her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of firewood for resale

loans.name: Betry

texts.en:
Betry, age 31, lives in the Skyline community with her husband and her little boy. She learned dyeing skills and has been doing it for four years. At first, she could produce just a little with the little money she earned from her finished products.

With her loan, she is now able to increase the production to meet her customers' demands. Not only that, but she is also able to purchase new materials that will help make her production more efficient and effective. She believes that by continuing to access other loans, she will be able to make more improvements in her business and help her to complete her new home.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to dye

loans.name: Elleen

texts.en:
Ellen is married with one child and lives just within Honiara City. She’s been doing marketing to support her family financially ever since she came to reside in Honiara. 

With her third loan she has managed to complete her home, pay for her only child’s education, and partially invest in or expand her marketing. Prior to that, since she did not have enough capital, she used to do marketing on a small scale where her business earned little income in return.

Ellen believes that with her other loans, she will further improve her living conditions and build another house to rent out to assist in paying for her child’s education.

loans.use: To pay for the family's financial needs

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca  is married with five children who live in central Honiara. Previously, for the last couple of years, she has been running a small canteen which supports her family financially. 

She was privileged enough with the loans she got from SPBD that she managed to start her poultry business. With her second loan she managed to expand her business by increasing the number of chicks which in return increased her business income. 

Rebecca acknowledges SPBD because the loans she got really supported her in her business and family as well. Prior to that she depends on her husband’s income but now she can assist him.

She strongly believes that with her upcoming loans she will build her permanent home for her family.

loans.use: To expand her poultry business

loans.name: Floridelia

texts.es:
La señora Floridelia de 34 años de edad, tiene un hijo que depende de ella, tiene casa propia, vive en San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, se dedica hace 5 años al negocio de abarrotería, como ser productos lácteo, frescos, granos básicos y otros productos de la canasta familiar, tiene una buena clientela por  estar  ubicada en un punto muy  bueno para este tipo de negocio. 
Doña Floridelia solicitando el préstamo para compra de más productos como  jabón, manteca, papel higiénico, frescos, pollo, azúcar, frijoles, café, etc. con el apoyo del préstamo espera que mejore su calidad de vida y la de su familia en su negocio.
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo- Honduras - Octubre del 2014.
texts.en:
Señora Floridella, who is 34 years old, has a son who depends on her. She has her own house. She lives in San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. She has worked for five years in the grocery business, with products such as dairy products, cold drinks, basic grains, and other products for the family food basket. She has a good customer base because she is located at a very good spot for this type of business.

Doña Floridella is applying for a loan to purchase more products, such as soap, lard, toilet paper, cold beverages, chicken, sugar, beans, coffee, etc. With the help of the loan, she hopes to improve her quality of life and that of her family through her business.

Her dream is to improve her business and her quality of life.

San Lorenzo- Honduras - October 2014.

loans.use: to buy soap, lard, toilet paper, cold drinks, chicken, sugar, beans, coffee, etc., for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Maylyn

texts.en:
Maylyn is 31 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. For the past seven years, she has run a general store in the Philippines, and she also earns an income from poultry. Maylyn works hard to provide for her family. She has borrowed and repaid five previous loans through NWTF.

Maylyn is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. In the future, she aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is a soft drink retailer from Ormoc, Leyte. She is 49 years old and a mother of four grown up children. She has been in the business for more than two years now. Merlina is sitting next to empty bottles of soft drinks. She needs capital to buy more soft drinks to sell.

Merlina is asking for a loan to buy more soft drinks to sell. With this loan, she will be able to improve her store, thus attracting more buyers. Merlina hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Manuel de 38  años de edad, tiene dos hijos que depende de él,  vive con su esposa en  casa propia en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, Valle al Sur de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 20 años  al negocio de compra venta de pescado  y camarón atiende a varios restaurantes.
Don Manuel es una persona trabajadora y muy puntual en sus pagos, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de camarón para empacar y luego venderlos a un mejor precio. Con el apoyo del préstamo el pretende mejorar sus ingresos y seguir apoyando a su familia es una persona luchadora y uno de sus sueños es mejorar su negocio cada vez más y también su calidad de vida. 

San Lorenzo- Honduras - Octubre del 2014.
texts.en:
Manuel is 38 years old and he has two children who depend on him. He lives with his wife in their own home in the city of San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras. 

He has worked for the past 20 years buying and selling fish and shrimp at various restaurants. Manuel is a hard-working person who is on-time with his payments. 

He is requesting a loan to buy shrimp to package and later sell for a better price. With the support of the loan, he hopes to improve his income and to continue supporting his family. He is a determined person and one of his dreams is to improve his business further as well as his quality of life.

San Lorenzo- Honduras - October 2014.

loans.use: to buy shrimp for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make cakes and to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only that she is doing her hobby, but she earns an income, as well. At the age of 43 and married, Cristina busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. 

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her gardening activities. 

Recently, Cristina applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizer. In the future, she wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizer.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 46 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Aurelia is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Aurelia has been in pig fattening for three years and earns additional income from buying and selling firewood.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Amorlina

texts.en:
Pamela is 19 years old and is the third of four children in the family. Her mother Amorlina, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her tailoring business in the Philippines. Pamela is currently in her third year of studying psychology to obtain a Bachelor of Science degree. 

Amorlina is requesting a 21,840 PHP loan to pay for her daughter’s tuition for the first semester of the school year 2014-2015. In the future, Pamela plans to graduate and find gainful employment.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her daughter

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Girlie is 36 years old and has three children who are in school.

Girlie has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Girlie requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more bread and utensils for her food business.

Girlie has been in this business for four years. In the future, Girlie would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bread and utensils for her food business.

loans.name: Sheerlay Mishel

texts.es: Mishel tiene 21 años de edad, vive con sus padres que se dedican a la agricultura, y a la crianza de animales,  por este motivo es que  Mishel se dedica al igual que sus padres a la crianza de animales menores y que en la actualidad el crédito lo va a utilizar en la compra de pollos para tener otro ingreso aparte del jornal que es la actividad a la que se dedica, lo que Mishel aspira de este negocio es mejorarlo y de la rentabilidad que le genere desea pagar los estudios ya que va a retomar sus estudios que los dejo por falta de recursos económicos.
texts.en: Mishel is 21 years old. She lives with her parents, who work in agriculture and raise animals. As a result, Mishel, like her parents, raises small animals, and now she is going to use the loan for the purchase of chickens in order to have another income in addition to what she earns from her day work. What Mishel hopes for from this business is to improve it and the profitability that it generates. She wants to pay for an education, since she is going to return to her studies, which she had to leave because of the lack of economic resources.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

Basilisa requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bicycle for her business.

She has been in this business for six years now.

Basilisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bicycle for her business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store.

Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant business.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Rebecca, sixty-eight years old, married, and a mother of nine children. She does maize and beans farming, and also practices poultry farming. She is happy with the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa enterprise management training, which equipped her with skills to manage her business.

She is borrowing from Kiva, to further expand her farming activities by buying fertilizer and chicken feed. She hopes that the loan amount will assist her by boosting her business, hence increasing her income. This will enable her to improve the living standard of her family, which includes quality education for the children and modern housing.

Rebecca is grateful to Kiva and their lenders, and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and chicken feed

loans.name: Shakila

texts.en:
Shakila belongs to a poor family and is living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her son is a blacksmith; he manufactures iron accessories, doors and windows which are usable in houses. He has been providing door-to-door services to weld broken accessories.

A few days ago, his welding machine become out of order due to overheating, and it needs to be replaced with a new one. He wants to buy a new welding machine, but he does not have money due to lot of household expenses. 

Therefore, Shakila requested a loan from BRAC, which is an active field partner of Kiva, so that her son would be able to buy a welding machine for manufacturing.  

Shakila thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine for her son's business

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila, 63 years old, lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She was gifted with five children. Mila is the breadwinner for the family. She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member finds herself plowing the rice field, planting vegetables and other varieties of crops.

In need of additional working capital, Mila decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already, and recently she requested PHP 10,000. She will use this loan for buying garden fertilizers, and paying labor costs for cultivating their land.

Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Mila is very thankful because, if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances. She hopes that all her children have a good future.

loans.use: to buy garden fertilizer and pay farm laborers

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Gesila

texts.en: Gesila landed at the right place for her capital requirements, when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet after going broke when her first bsuiness went bad. PMPC came to Gesila's rescue, lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she has requested another loan for the next cropping season. She will use the loan for land and seedbed preparation.  Gesila perseveres and always believes that she will reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is 43 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 12 years. Rhodora earns additional income from selling recycled materials.

Rhodora requested her twenty sixth loan from NWTF for 29,500 PHP, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell. She hopes to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married mother with three children all of whom attend school. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees and food for her children.

Grace cooks food for sale at the market and sells to town dwellers and passersby. She cites price fluctuations as a challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing her cafe.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase chairs, tables and a television. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables and a television

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is 32 years old and a married woman. She is a mother of four children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a clothing sales business, which is the only source of income for the family. Presently he needs additional capital for the growth of the business. Therefore, Rehana is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell. The new inventory will enable him to respond quickly to customer needs. With the help of the profit amount, he will put aside some savings to pay the electricity and gas bills. Rehana hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her husband's clothing sales business.

loans.name: Guilberto

texts.en:
Guilberto is a resident from Dulag, Leyte. He raises and sells pigs for a living. He is a 45-year-old married man and  a father of four children. His oldest child is 16 and the youngest is 8.  He has been in the hog raising business for 5 years now. 

Due to a limited amount of capital to finance his hog raising livelihood, Guilberto has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy piglets and pig feed. With this loan, he can raise and sell more healthy pigs in the coming months. Thus providing his family with good food and better living conditions.

In the future, Guilberto hopes to have a stable income that would help send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is managing her eatery business in Candanay Norte, Siquijor. She is a widow and raises her children alone. She has been doing well in supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and will also accept catering for added income. 

Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be more happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man with one child. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business where he sells match boxes, sweets, ear buds and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years.

Daniel's primary customers are locals. He says that his biggest business challenge is inadequate capital. His business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. He hopes that in the future he will have several branches. 

This is Daniel's first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more sweets, ear buds, match boxes and other items for his retail inventory.

loans.use: to buy more sweets, ear buds, match boxes and other items for his retail inventory.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Margie works hard to support her family. She operates a sari sari, or general store, in the Philippines and earns additional income by selling charcoal.

Margie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She is now borrowing 50,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell. In this way she is building her business incrementally.

Margie hopes that her hard work will pay off in the growth of her business. She is also working to save enough money to repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of used clothes to sell to customers.

Eva successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Eva's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick runs a mixed farm, in a rural location in the North Rift region of Kenya. He does dairy and poultry farming, for the production of milk and eggs for consumption and sale. He also grows crops and engages in other agriculture-related businesses, to make extra income.

Patrick is appealing to Kiva lenders to help him with a loan of KES 30,000. He will use the money to purchase more poultry and increase his egg production, to meet the demand in the market.

He will use part of the revenue to repay the loan, part to reinvest in the business, and the rest to take care of the basic needs of his family of five children. Setting off his children's educational expenses ranks almost at the top of his list of priorities.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds and increase egg production

loans.name: Zaib Ul Nisa

texts.en: Zaib ul Nisa is aged 28 and she is a mother of two children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore, Zaib ul Nisa has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Zaib ul Nisa is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the repair costs of her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly es una mujer casada desde hace 20 años y tiene un hijo, ella vive en Warisata en una casa de adobe que es propia y solo tiene luz y agua. Nelly se dedica a la agricultura y a la produccion de leche y quiere un credito para comprar una vaca lechera que le permita incrementar su produccion, el esposo de Nelly trabaja como  profesor rural en la provincia, la familia goza de buena salud y tienen nucha fe en su proyecto  por eso Nelly pide su ayuda
texts.en: Nelly has been married for 20 years and has one son. She lives in Warisata in a house made of adobe that she owns. Her house has water and electricity. Nelly makes a living farming and producing milk. She wants this loan to help her buy a milk cow that will help her to increase her production. Nelly's husband works as a teacher in their province. The family is in good health and has a lot of faith in their project. For this reason, Nelly is asking for this support.

loans.use: to buy a cow for milking that will help her increase her production.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is 56 years old and married with five children. She lives in Solinog, Calamba, Philippines. She is a hardworking mother. She helps her husband support the family through the profit of selling fish.

She joined Paglaum Cooperative and repaid her previous loan seriously. Now she is applying for a loan of PHP 50,000 to pay the tuition fees of her graduating daughter in college this semester.

Dionesia believes and prays that Paglaum Cooperative is the instrument that is enabling her to achieve her dreams for her children. She is thankful that she become a member of it.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fees of her graduating daughter

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.en: Marcosa is 62 years old and lives in Bunawan, Calamba, Philippines. She is separated and blessed with ten children. She sells bananas to earn a living and has had this type of work for five years. She has requested a loan to purchase more bananas to sell. Marcosa has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to save for emergency.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is a responsible mother who is requesting a loan from Paglaum MPC. She will use this loan to increase her inventory. She wants to purchase more kilos of bananas and restock her small store with salt, oil and soy sauce to sustain the needs of her neighbors. This way, she will be able to sell more products, which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of bananas and restock her small store with salt, oil and soy sauce.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married and has two children. She operates a door-to-door motorcycle transport business, which she has been doing for three years.

Asha requested a loan, which she will use to purchase a second hand motorcycle, so she is able to meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase a second hand motorcycle

loans.name: Rozina

texts.en:
Rozina lives with her two children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband supports the family through his scrap business.

One of Rozina’s sons has been running a mobile phone shop for the past three years. He would like to offer a variety of phone accessories, but without sufficient money he is unable to do so.

Therefore, Rozina has applied for a 35,000 PKR loan through Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to help her son buy a variety of accessories for his shop. This expansion should make his business more profitable, and he will be able to better support his family.

Rozina would like to express her thanks to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her son buy a variety of mobile phone accessories for his shop.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Selina operates a grocery stall, where she sells vegetables at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.
