With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized steel, wood, cement, sand and gravel to repair the roof of his house and cement the corridor floor

loans.name: Foziljon

texts.en:
Foziljon lives with his mother and sister in a flat in northern Tajikistan. His father is doing migrant work in Russia, and his mother works in a kindergarten.

Foziljon is in college studying to become a nurse. He applies himself well and takes part in many college clubs.

Foziljon is applying for an 840 USD loan through IMON International to help pay for his annual tuition fees. He awaits your mercy and thanks in advance KIVA lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to help pay for his annual tuition fees.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Lilibeth works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Lilibeth is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell to customers.

Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Majeeda

texts.en:
Majeeda is a 49-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the past many years. 

For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order, so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. Therefore, Majeeda has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Majeeda is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, from the Nyamira region of Kenya, is a smallholder farmer deep into dairy, poultry and tea farming. He started farming 6 years ago, about the same time he married Deborah, with whom he has 2 babies. Stephen's growing family has brought him a lot of joy in life, as well as expenses. The only way he can keep up is by improving the state of his farm to become more productive. 

Stephen is appealing to lenders to afford him a KES 60,000 loan. This is how he will use the loan: KES 20,000 to construct a cowshed; KES 20,000 to purchase poultry; KES 20,000 to fence his farm.

Stephen is a hardworking man who is focused on filling gaps in the market. He learned to be independent at an early age through keeping a budget, tracking expenses and being eager to seize opportunities. Your loan will be used in a manner that will improve animal health and productivity on his farm, and enhance security.

loans.use: to improve the state of his farm

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Jovelyn has been able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to purchase additional grocery items for her sari-sari store. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her sari-sari store.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
In 2007, Benita learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it offers. She tried her luck on creating a business focusing on her farming activities. 

Benita is now requesting another loan to pay for labor, corn seedlings, and fertilizers for the next cropping season. This loan will give her farming income a big boost and help support the financial needs of her children. Benita looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for labor, corn seedlings, and fertilizers.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

Nenita would now like to apply for a 24,000 PHP loan to use as her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items such as rice, coffee, soda, and rice noodles, which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. The income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and the children's education. Nenita thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Nenita dreams of having a grocery store and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to sell at her store.

loans.name: Romelie

texts.en:
Romelie works hard to support her family. Romelie is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Romelie has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Romelie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with seven children. Jocelyn is 46 years old and one of her children is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Jocelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like fish, meat, spices, vegetables, etc. for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years. Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like fish, meat, spices, vegetables, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of eight children, Eva works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Eva is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: St Mary Immaculate Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Hannah, a member of St Mary Immaculate Women Group. She is married and blessed with six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training courses on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge of business management.

Hannah's economic activity is dairy farming. She needs a loan to buy quality fodder for her cows. This will increase their milk production and help Hannah keep up with the increased demand for milk in Nakuru, Kenya.

She hopes this will increase her level of income so she can continue supporting her family and in the long run improve their living conditions with better health care and modern housing.

Hannah is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support

loans.use: to buy fodder for dairy cows.

loans.name: Wilter

texts.en:
Hello there! The above picture presents to you Wilter, who lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, also known as the land of bananas because it produces high quality bananas.

Wilter is the mother of one lovely and adorable child that she really treasures and values. She is 44 years of age and has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years. Over those years, she has gathered much experience and has all of the farming techniques at her fingertips. Wilter is a very dedicated farmer and has been able to support her family and take her child to school.

Although she has been making a profit, not everything has been good for this enterprising mother. She wants to start poultry farming and take advantage of the ready market for poultry products that is already there in her village. Wilter has a never-say-die attitude and has always had challenges accessing funds, but she now feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva help enterprising women like her.

Wilter has learned the saving culture and she is sure that with the increased income from selling eggs and poultry products, she will be able to open a large business where she will be selling poultry feed and also poultry products. Wilter's dream is to get out of poverty, and this loan will be a stepping stone towards realizing her dream of improving her living condition and securing the future of her school-going child.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús nació en la comunidad de El Sardinal en el año 1973. Jesús desde pequeño realiza la labor de cortar café, y desde pequeño lo hacía con su padre. Actualmente Jesús está casado con Mercedes, a quien conoció a la edad de 20 años, hoy en día tienen tres hijos, dos varones y una mujer. Jesús trabaja sembrando café y granos básicos en el terreno que le heredó su padre y también ha podido comprar mas tierras con el esfuerzo de su trabajo. En la comunidad donde viven Jesús y su familia no existe energía eléctrica comercial, es por eso que su única opción para poder tener energía es obteniendo un pequeño sistema solar, de esta manera ellos podrán tener luz y ver televisión.
texts.en:
Jesús was born in the community of El Sardinal in 1973. Jesús has worked harvesting coffee since he was young. He worked with his father. Now Jesús is married to Mercedes who he met when he was 20 years old. They have three children two sons and a daughter.

Jesús works growing coffee and basic grains on the land that he inherited from his father and on land that he has bought through the efforts of his work. In the community where Jesús and his family lives there is no commercial electricity so his only option to have electrical power is through a small solar system. This way they can have light and watch television.

loans.use: to buy a solar power system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman and mother of five children. She lives with her family in the province of Leyte, Philippines. For more than 2 years now, Maricel has operated her sari-sari or retail store business. She sells various goods such as soap, noodles, coffee, and beverages, among others. This is her source of income.

Maricel is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, such as noodles, canned goods, bread, biscuits, soap, and toiletries. A loan will enable Maricel to improve her inventory, thus attracting more buyers to her store.

In the future, Maricel hopes to make her business more stable and profitable. She wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more stock.

loans.name: Geralyn

texts.en:
Geralyn resides in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with her two children. 

She has been operating a shop supplying gowns for rental and a flower shop. She has successfully repaid her previous loan which she used for buying additional gowns and accessories. Her business is growing and doing well. 

Geralyn took a new loan recently to buy assorted flowers for sale in addition to her business. She plans to expand her business to include a beauty parlor in order to provide more services and gain more income for the future needs of her family .

loans.use: to buy assorted flowers for sale.

loans.name: Pastor

texts.en:
Pastor owns and operates an ornamental plant business. He has been successful in this business for three years, and he was able to repay his previous loan. He also has found ways to boost his income by managing a farm business.

Pastor would like to take out a new loan to buy additional gardening materials and supplies. He is requesting PHP 15,000 to buy greater quantities and varieties of ornamental plants such as ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias and various hanging plants.

In the future, Pastor hopes to extend the land he uses for his agricultural activities. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials and supplies, such as wire, baskets, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married, with five school-going children. They live in their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Grace has operated an agricultural-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces major challenges of disease outbreak and pests affecting her crops.

With the loan she is requesting, in the amount of KES 20,000, Grace wants to purchase more seedlings and a water pump for water irrigation of her farm. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and a water pump for water irrigation on her farm.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen, 34, is married and has three children. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband works making shutters for houses under construction.

In this regard Yasmeen’s husband needs more materials for manufacturing iron fixings for his shutters. To accomplish this Yasmeen is applying for a 45,000 PKR loan through Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy these materials for her husband.

This loan will help Yasmeen’s husband to generate more income to support his family. She is thankful for this assistance from Brac Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy materials for her husband's shutter-building business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a mother, all Delia cares for is the welfare of her family. She joined PMPC to avail herself of needed capital to invest in her farm. She owes much to the cooperative for consistently supporting her financial needs.

Now Delia is taking out another 9,000 PHP loan in anticipation of the next growing season. She will use the money to pay for eggplant seedlings and fertilizer for her garden. Delia perseveres and always works hard to provide continuously for her family.

loans.use: to pay for eggplant seedlings and fertilizer

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plaster and reinforce the walls of her house and replace the door.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to enhance her husband's oil sales business by enabling him to buy more oils for resale.

loans.name: Hagigat

texts.en:
Hagigat is a widow and she lives with her two children in the Absheron region. Her first daughter is married and has two children, and her second daughter is learning the fourth course at university. Her husband died in a car crash and she stays alone.

All the time she worked as a teacher in a school and helped her own children. Hagigat loves children and working with them. After school she prepares students for university. Today she wants to buy books and tests for her students, because she has a lot of IDP (Internally Displaced Person) students who can't buy them.

Therefore, she has applied to Komak Credit Union for a loan amount of 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Hagigat says she is thankful to the Kiva organization and its lenders for their help. In the future, she wants to buy a computer to better teach her students.

loans.use: to buy books and tests

loans.name: Elesio

texts.en:
Elesio is a 48-year-old, married man from Leyte, Philippines. He has seven children. Elesio earns a living through his hog-raising business. He has raised pigs for more than three years, now.

At this time, he wants to expand his business, but he lacks the financial resources to do so. Elesio is requesting a loan to buy more piglets to raise, and animal feed.

In the future, he hopes to expand his piggery, so that he will be able to raise more pigs. Moreover, he hopes to make his business more sustainable. He also wants to save enough money for his children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila, 50 years old, lives in Liloy, Zambo Del Norte, with her husband and two children. Her husband is a minimum-wage earner. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she found ways to earn income herself, through snack and food vending. She began with selling a small amount of viands and snacks to their neighbors. She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January of 2014.  Now, she applies for 5,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a married woman from Carles, Iloilo. She has four children, ages 6, 7, 10 and 13. Jessica is engaged in a fishing business, while her husband works as a carpenter. She is asking for a loan to buy a new boat engine and a boat propeller, which will ensure uninterrupted fishing. Jessica always ensures that everything runs smoothly, for better business profitability.

Her income will then be used for healthy meals for her children, and their school fees. In the future, she hopes to expand her fishing business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a boat engine and a boat propeller.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is 48 years old, married and has six children, three of whom are in school. For the past seventeen years she has farmed rice.

Belen has applied for and successfully paid off two loans from NWTF in the past. She is applying now for a 7000 PHP loan to buy additional fertilizer.

Belen’s goal is to save enough to buy more farmland in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer for her rice fields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ceramic figures.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty es una mujer de 23 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de tres años, y su negocio es la panadería.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, sencilla, práctica, constante, buena madre, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona de ‘el Torno’ una localidad rural que agrupa a productores campesinos de carne, leche, verduras, granos, etc., y comerciantes revendedores mayoristas que se encargan de vender esos productos en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo; con una temperatura ambiente de aproximadamente 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Betty es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es tradicional (manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Quechua que utiliza con sus familiares, para el comercio habla español. su vida la realiza con su pequeño hijo que se encuentra a su cuidado. Su negocio es la panadería y sus productos son; EL " Pan Khasi" El que no tiene manteca, La "Chama" Cuando a la masa de harina blanca se le aumenta una porción de afrechillo, El "Pan Integral" el que está elaborado de harina de trigo del lugar, pura, a la que no se ha cernido el afrecho ni el afrechillo, El "Pan Sarnoso" el que está adornado por encima con queso desmenuzado. Esta variedad de productos fueron transmitidos por parte de sus abuelos que se dedican a la misma actividad en otro horno, actualmente trabaja con un horno heredado por sus familiares el cual ya no funciona correctamente debido al paso del tiempo y al uso diario, esto le hace perder tiempo y ventas. Esta es la primera secuencia de prestamos con la institución en un año que viene realizando esta actividad. Su sueño es que su hijo sea profesional. Ella desea realizar la compra de un horno industrial nuevo para producir pan en grandes cantidades, generar mejores ingresos económicos y satisfacer la necesidades de su pequeño hijo.
Es por esos motivos que Betty solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno industrial para producir mayor cantidad de pan y satisfacer las necesidades de su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Betty is a 23 year old woman.  She is single with a three year old son, and her business is a bakery. She is a good mother, as well as a practical, independent, unassuming, persevering, responsible, hardworking, entrepreneur.  She conducts her business in the “El Torno”, an area with a very warm, humid, tropical climate, and an ambient temperature of approximately 30 degrees Celsius throughout the year.  It is a rural town where farmers that produce meat, milk, vegetables, grains, and other products organize together and, commercial wholesale resellers are responsible for selling these products in the various city markets.  

Betty has a dark complexion, long braided black hair, and wears traditional clothing (a poncho and skirt).  Her native language is Quechua, which she uses with her family, and she speaks Spanish for business.  She lives her life with her small son who is in her care.  

Her business is a breadmaking, and her products are “khasi” bread, which doesn’t contain shortening; “chama” bread, a white flour dough to which a portion of bran has been added; whole wheat bread made from pure local wheat flour from which neither the course nor fine bran have been sifted; and “sarnoso” bread, which is garnished with shredded cheese on top.  This variety of products was handed down by her grandparents who were engaged in this activity in another oven.  Currently, she is working with an oven she inherited from her family.  However, it’s not working properly due to the passage of time and daily use, which causes her to waste time and lose sales.  

This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the year that she has been engaged in this activity.  Her dream is for her son to become a professional.  She wishes to purchase a new industrial oven to produce large amounts of bread, generate better income, and meet her small son’s needs. These are the reasons that Betty is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial oven to produce large amounts of bread and meet her small son's needs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

She requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock of ready-to-wear clothes, to resell.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear clothes, to resell.

loans.name: Marizel

texts.en:
Marizel is 24 years old and married with one child. Marizel works very hard to provide for her family.

Marizel runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and school supplies. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. 

In the future, Marizel would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman. She has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her kids.

Mbeyu has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she sells palm wine to supplement her income.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Edgar Fernando

texts.es: Fernando es un joven casado  de 25 años de edad, el se dedica a trabajar de albañil y juntamente con su esposa se dedica  al crianza  de animales menores, ellos tiene 2 hijos de 1 y 5 años de los cuales el mayor asiste a la escuela, el credito lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos, la aspiración de Fernando mejorar su negocio aumentar sus ingresos y a futuro comprar una casa para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Fernando is a young married man of 25 who makes a living as a bricklayer and, along with his wife, breeds small animals. They have 2 sons of 1 and 5, the oldest of whom goes to school. 

He needs the loan to invest in buying pigs. 

Fernando's goal is to improve his business, make a better income and, in the future, buy a house to help improve his sons' quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, cheese, ham and drinks

loans.name: Angel Enrique

texts.es:
Recinto playas del Rio Blanco un lugar de clima cálido húmedo lleno de gente amable y trabajadora, a este Recinto llegan muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros a disfrutar de los maravillosos paisajes y sitios de descanso que encontramos en la vía.
En este recinto vive y tiene el negocio el señor Ángel un hombre luchador de 67 años es soltero vive solo en la finca que tiene en este Recinto, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería tiene ganado para carne y ganado productor de leche, aprendió de esta actividad junto con sus padres, viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos y desde muy niño tuvo que trabajar muy duro, a este negocio le dedica un promedio de 8 horas diarias.  
El señor Ángel tiene adicional un pequeño balneario en la finca, solicita el crédito para terminar una pequeña cabaña, poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a los cliente, con esta inversión mejoraran sus ingresos económicos y los de su familia 
El señor Ángel agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
The Playas community of Rio Blanco is a warm, humid place, filled with friendly and hardworking people. A lot of national and foreign tourists come to this community to enjoy the marvelous landscapes and places to relax that are found along the way.

Ángel lives and has his business in this community. He is a determined 67-year old man. He is single and lives alone on the ranch that he has in this community. He makes his living in agriculture and livestock. He has beef cattle and dairy cattle. He learned this business from his parents.

He comes from a family of modest means, and from a young age, he has had to work very hard. He spends an average of 8 hours a day on his business.

Ángel also has a small swimming resort on his ranch. He is applying for the loan to finish a small cabin, so that he can offer better service to his customers. With this investment, income will improve for him and his family.

Ángel is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for the support and the opportunity.

loans.use: to finish a small cabin located within his ranch, so that he can host foreigners who visit his farm.

loans.name: Tania Graciela

texts.es: Tania de 31 años de edad es una mujer tenaz que siempre está  buscando la manera de mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y es por ello que hace 4 años tomo la decisión de instalar un negocio de crianza y venta de pollo en su vivienda, es gracias a esta actividad que ha logrado dar el apoyo necesario a su compañero de vida para mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar. Ella es una mujer muy decidida que habita junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 4 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace mucho tiempo. Tania desea que su negocio de pollos se amplié, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos, concentrado y vitaminas para que sus ganancias sean mejores y poder contar con mejores finanzas mejorando así su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Tania is 31 years old and is a woman who is always looking for a way to improve her quality of life. Because of this, 4 years' ago she made the decision to start running a business breeding and selling chicken breeding from her house. Thanks to this work she has managed to give the necessary support to her life partner to improve her family's quality of life. 

She is a very dedicated woman who has lived in her own house with her life partner and her son of 4 for a very long time. 

Tania hopes that her chicken business grows and with this in mind she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: chickens, chicken feed and vitamins to help her increase her profits, improve her financial situation and, in turn, improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in: chickens, chicken feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Delmy Concepcion

texts.es: Delmy de 40 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida desde hace 3 años como instructora de ejercicios de un centro infantil, pero ella es una mujer que siempre está buscando las posibilidades de mejorar su calidad de vida y es por ello que decidió dedicarse a la venta de productos de belleza y ropa para mujer los fines de semana. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 16, 8 y 5 años de edad desde hace muchos años por lo que se siente muy feliz de tener un lugar donde vivir tranquila con su familia. Delmy sabe que en su vivienda siempre ahí necesidades sin solventar, es por ello que ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su negocio ya que ha observado que cuando tiene variedad de productos las ventas son mejores, es para ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pantalones, blusas, faldas, vestidos, camisas, etc. Para tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Delmy is 40 years old and is a hard-working woman who has earned a living for the past three years as an exercise instructor at a childcare facility. But she is a woman who is always looking for ways to improve her quality of life, and that is why she decided to sell beauty products and women's clothing on weekends. 

She has lived in her own house for many years together with her husband and three children who are 16, 8, and 5 years old.  She feels very happy to be able to live in a peaceful place with her family. 

Delmy knows that there are always things that need to be paid for in her house and that is why she decided to invest in her business. She has noticed that when she has a good variety of products, sales are better. So she is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in pants, blouses, skirts, dresses, shirts, etc. to have a better variety of products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to invest in  pants, blouses, skirts, dresses, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Angel tiene 24 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre. Él es jornalero, trabaja en una finca desde hace mucho tiempo lo cual le ha permitido llevar el sustento a su hogar. Angel ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea mejorar las condiciones del corredor de su vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento arena, grava, lámina galvanizada, madera, etc. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y así proceder a la reparación del techo y el piso del corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en: Angel is 24 years old and lives in his home with his mother. He is a day laborer and has been working on a farm for a long time, a job that has enabled him to support the household. Angel has decided to ask for this loan because he wants to improve the condition of the walkway that goes around his house. With the amount he has requested, he will buy cement, sand, gravel, galvinized metal, lumber and so on. He hopes to be able to count on this assistance and thus begin the repair of the roof and floor of the walkway of his living quarters.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, gravel, galvinized metal, lumber to repair the roof and floor of the walkway outside his house.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has mastered his hog raising business in San Juan, Siquijor. This is how he makes a living and is able to support his family. At the same time, Stephen is engaged in a buying & selling business, and he is also a tricycle operator.

He was at his lowest point when he didn't have enough capital for his business. When he joined PMPC, he was truly grateful to avail himself of credit to fully support his business. In the same way that he takes care of his hog raising business, so it is with his membership with PMPC. He wants to maintain his membership in good standing so he can always run for any financing needs.

Now, the loan of PHP 50,000 will help him build a concrete pig pen that will support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to build a concrete pig pen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in flour, margarine, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Adiba

texts.en:
Adiba lives in a large family. The family members are eight. They live together happily. 

Adiba is not married. She studies at the Pedagogical University of Tajikistan. She is learning pedagogy and psychology. Adiba is a student of the first course. She dreams to be a successful pedagogue after graduating university. 

She is asking for a loan because she must pay for tuition, but her parents have not enough money. She awaits your mercy, and in advance, thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for her education.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Edna works hard to support her family. She has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock. Edna is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as milk and sugar for her business.

Edna has sustained her business activities through three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, jewelry and fashion items

loans.name: Maria Carmen Amelia

texts.es: Maria tiene 52 años de edad, ella vive con 2  hijos, su yerno y 2 nietos, Maria se divorcio de su esposo pero saca adelante a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la crianza de chanchos y también trabaja  en una tienda pesando azúcar, avena, arveja, harina entre otros, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para tenerlos en una chanchera que le presta su hermana, la aspiración de Maria es seguir trabajando para apoyar a sus  nietos en sus estudios y alimentación también de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 52 years old and lives with her two children, her son-in-law and two grandchildren. María got divorced from her husband but she has got her children ahead. She earns a living raising pigs and she also works in a shop weighing sugar, oats, peas, flour, etc.. 

With the loan, she is going to buy pigs which she will keep in a pigpen which her sister has let her use. María's dream is to continue working in order to support her grandchildren with their studies, and to help her children as well.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
A resident from Ormoc, Leyte, Jennifer earns a living through her retail sales of soft drinks. Jennifer is a married mother of a 4-month-old child.
For more than two years now, this business has provided Jennifer the income that she needs. 
She is asking for a loan to buy more soft drinks to sell. This will enable her to expand her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers.
Jennifer hopes to improve her business so that it will become more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey owns and operates a jeepney unit. He has been successful in this business for 12 years, and has repaid a previous loan for the business. He also finds other ways to improve his income to provide for his family's everyday needs.
 
Joey would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for his vehicle. He is requesting an amount of PHP 9,000 to maintain the jeepney unit and to buy other materials needed in his business.

In the future, Joey hopes to buy another jeepney unit and expand his business, so he will be able to help his children finish their studies. He meets with his fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from his study of the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Ruzzel

texts.en:
Ruzzel is 37 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.

Ruzzel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ruzzel has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from a beauty parlor.

Ruzzel aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jenelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs. Jenelyn is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to purchase additional meat, hot dogs, etc. to sell for her food-vending business.

Jenelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat, hot dogs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 50 years old, married (for 15 years) and has five children. He lives in a community in the Mitua location of Kenya. Andrew earns his living in agriculture through the production and sale of milk, eggs and bananas. He sells the goods at the Misanga market where he gets a good price. 
He is applying for a loan to buy poultry and to expand his banana farm. This investment will help him to grow his business which will improve his harvest and income. 
His future plan is to keep improving his family's livelihood

loans.use: to purchase poultry and to grow more bananas

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 47 years old with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, canned goods, etc.

She has borrowed and paid back 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice. Lea aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Toto

texts.en:
Toto is married and has five children, all of whom are adults. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family.

Toto operates a food selling business, making dumplings and flat bread to sell. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 45 years old. She is a mother of four children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband runs a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well. Some of his relatives also like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with a monotonous tone that is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous and his business is running well. Due to these good relations, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to meet the demand. 

Shehnaz has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy more stock, including wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, and biscuits. Shehnaz gives thanks to Kiva and Field Partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's general store.

loans.name: Saleema

texts.en:
Saleema is 46 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son owns a shoe shop selling a variety of shoes. He buys shoes from different shoe manufacturing companies and sells them at his shop. He has been selling men's shoes only but now he wants to offer ladies' shoes as well to meet customers’ demand. His major problem is the lack of cash to buy shoes. 
Therefore, Saleema requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son would be able to buy ladies' shoes. 
Saleema is very happy for this loan and says thanks to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her son's shoe sale busienss

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the repairing cost of her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.en:
Firdavs studies at the university. He is a student of the second course. Firdavs studies at the National University of Tajikistan. He is learning management and economics. He is one of the best and most hardworking students. 

He is not married and lives with his mother, father and sisters. His family members total 6. His mother is a cleaning woman. His parents have no money to pay his tuition. He is asking for a loan to pay tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay his tuition.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is grateful that she was previously granted a 30,000 PHP loan to buy more piaya to sell. Her income from her business helped cover personal and household expenses and the schooling of her kids.

She is now requesting for a 30,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of piaya (a flat unleavened bread filled with muscovado sugar) to increase her inventory. Piaya is one of the favorite snacks of Filipinos because of its yummy, sweet taste. She is encouraged she will get a good return on her investment and is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Melinda hopes to give her children a better future and dreams for her business to continue growing. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Miro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more piaya (unleavened bread) to sell.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
This is Eugenia, 50, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Norberto, a carpenter. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Eugenia operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. 

It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings and frozen food products. 

Eugenia aims to expand her food stall and she desires to give her children a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, as well as other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Marissa works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish. 

Marissa is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 26 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. Mary Joy has been farming corn for 6 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and rice.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional new varieties of corn seed. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional new varieties of corn seed.

loans.name: Hermel Adolfo

texts.es: Adolfo tiene 32 años de edad, vive con sus padresy 2 hermanos menores que estudian  y comenta que junto a su  padre van saliendo adelante, Adolfo se dedica 9 años a la  agricultura y tambien cria ganado, el credito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono y fungicidas para tener sanos sus cultivos y que le de una buena produccion, la aspiracion de Adolfo es de seguir en sus cultivos junto a las personas a las que les paga para trabajar y asi lograr buenas cosechas.
texts.en:
Adolfo is 32 years old. He lives with his parents and two younger siblings who are in school. He says that together, he and his father have been making a living. Adolfo has worked in farming for nine years, and he also raises livestock. 

He is going to use the loan to invest in the purchase of soil amendments and fungicides in order to have healthy crops that produce well. Adolfo's aspiration is to continue with his farming, along with the people whom he pays to work, and to achieve a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy fungicides and soil amendments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, meat, chicken, condiments, rice, beans, bananas, potatoes, yucca, cabbage, etc. to supply her business.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Pedro de 30 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos una niña de 7 años y un varón de 4 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se esfuerza para sacar adelante a sus hijos poniendo todo de su parte, ya que sabe que al no contar con la madre de sus hijos el debe asumir toda la responsabilidad. Pedro es un hombre inteligente que logro encontrar la manera de sacar adelante a sus hijos sin descuidarse de ellos, es por ello que decidió dedicarse a la compra y venta de ganado bovino la cual realiza desde hace 3 años y actualmente desea adquirir un crédito que le permita comprar más ganado, para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en ganado bovino para mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Pedro, 30 years old, lives in his own house with his 2 children, a girl, 7, and a boy, 4. He is a hard worker who strives to bring up his children by giving all of himself, because he knows that since the mother of his children is not there, he must take full responsibility. 

Pedro is an intelligent man who managed to find a way to raise his children without neglecting them; he decided to make his living buying and selling cattle, which he has been doing for 3 years. He wants a loan that will allow him to buy more cattle, so he is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in cattle to increase his profits.

loans.use: to invest in cattle.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a forty-five-year-old woman with a family of five. She is a public servant and has been a head teacher for the last ten years, and before that twenty-five years as a teacher. She is described as a hardworking and resilient woman who has the zeal to educate children, even those who are not hers, since she considers it as the way to a better life.

Alongside teaching, Betty supplements her salary with agriculture production, especially coffee. She has a three acre coffee plantation, which has contributed to the income needed to pay tuition fees for her children who have graduated through the university level.

Betty is acquiring this loan in order to add fertilizers to her coffee plantation and to buy coffee plants for planting during the rainy season. Her biggest problem affecting coffee production is the vagaries of weather, especially the dry season that leaves coffee plants dry, plus the fluctuation of coffee prices.

She believes the future is bright with this opportunity from UGAFODE which has helped her to boost her income, which she would otherwise not have done without their support. She is appreciative of the services offered by UGAFODE.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Artimiza

texts.pt:
A senhora  Artimiza de 40 anos é comerciante, mae solteira de 5 filhos dos quais 4 a frequentarem o ensino primario 1 ja maior de idade vive na casa propria.
Com o  valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, chapas de zinco, varroes, portas  para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Tem como projectos e sonhos e terminar a construcao de sua casa, oferecer melhores condicoes de vida a sua familia e ampliar o  seu negocia.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros  e faz xitique como forma de guardar o seu dinheiro, e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en: Artimiza is a 40-year-old businesswoman. She is a single mother to 5 children, 4 of whom are at primary school while her eldest has already flown the family nest.The loan will be used to buy cement, zinc sheeting, rods and doors in order to continue with building work on the borrower's home. Her projects and dreams include finishing her building work - to provide better living conditions for her family - and expanding her business. She says that the greatest challenges that she has faced are in relation to finances. She saves her money in a xitique initiative and plans to apply for further loans in order to fulfil her plan.

loans.use: to buy cement, zinc sheeting, rods and doors

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is thankful that she was granted a 25,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan which she will use as part of her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles and frozen foods, which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Helen dreams of having a bigger General Store and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rolinda

texts.en:
Rolinda is 45 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Rolinda has borrowed and paid off 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for 6 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough to renovate a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Mary, an ever-smiling young farmer who is responsible and has had to overcome many difficulties through her life. However, she has always found the strength to move forward and to keep growing in her life.

She has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. She is the proud owner of a small parcel of land, on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years. Her primary sources of income are selling eggs and milk, and through this venture she has earned a decent income. She also engages in personal business in order to make ends meet.

Mary passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She is an early riser and wakes up every day in the morning to go and milk her cows. Although this humble mum has been making profits by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk. 

Mary is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. With the loan capital, she will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 litres of milk a day. This will help to fully satisfy the demand.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a field partner, she attended training sessions and was taught the best financial management skills. This will help her save more money in order to repay the loan fully and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new wheels for her husband's vehicle, a mini bus.

loans.name: Wanje

texts.en:
Wanje is a married woman with one child who attends school and is under her care. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. 

For over three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door and from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan of KES 50,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase a bale of kids' wear clothing for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of kids' wear clothing for resale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she has rental houses that earn her other income. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge in her business. Maria dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking oil and sugar for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking oil and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Conceleta

texts.en:
Conceleta is a woman eager to get ahead. She is 62 years old and is blessed with 10 adorable children. She lives with her large family in the Kitale area of Kenya. Her children are  her greatest motivation in life to persevere, because she wants to provide them with a better future.

Conceleta was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 20 years. She always says, “I have always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in my blood.” As an example of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows “maua” (flower), which makes her a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. 

Through her dairy cow, she is able to get between 10-15 liters a day, and this helps her support her family. Conceleta also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements. That is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. 

Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and as a result, increased profit levels. Conceleta is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. 

Conceleta believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Conceleta’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
A senhora  Ana de 22 anos é comerciante, casada mae de 1 ainda menor e vive na casa propria.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar feijao, ovos, amendoim, moelas, coco, acucar para reforcar o seu negocio.
Tem como projectos e sonhos crescer no seu negocio responder todas as necessidades de seus clientes e terminar a construcao de sua casa comprar uma viatura para facilitar o seu negocio.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros  e faz xitique como forma de guardar o seu dinheiro, e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano
texts.en: Ana ia a 22-year-old businesswoman. She is a married mother with a little one and she lives in her own home.She plans to spend the loan on purchasing beans, eggs, nuts, gizzards, coconut and sugar to restock her business. Her projects and dreams include growing her business so that she can fulfil her customers' every need, to finish the building work on her home and to buy a vehicle to make her work easier. She says that the greatest challenges she has faced are in relation to her finances. She saves her money in a xitique initiative and she plans to apply for further loans to complete her plan.

loans.use: to buy beans, eggs, nuts, gizzards, coconut and sugar.

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy is 45 years old, married, and has three children she is sending to school. Through her vending business, Jovy is able to meet her children's basic needs, particularly in financing their education. Her husband is a meat inspector. 

Jovy wishes for a loan amounting to PHP10,000 to buy grocery items and clothes to sell. She would be very happy to get the loan because it is an opportunity for her to extend the products she sells to her customers. Jovy will prioritize her children's education from the income she raises through her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Suhbatkhon

texts.en:
Suhbatkhon is 35 years old. He is a hard-working and clever man. He is married and lives with his wife and three children. 

Suhbatkhon works in a state organization and also, three years ago, he applied to the National University of Tajikistan. He studies well at the university. He is one of the best students. He studies in absentia. He must pay for his tuition at the university, but he does not have the money. 

Suhbatkhon is asking for a loan to pay for his education at the university. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Juma is married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water.

She has operated a food vending business for the past three years, cooking chapati (flat bread) rice and beans. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan of Kes 10,000, she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and salt for her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and salt for her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a merchant from Ormoc, Leyte. She is 47 years old and a mother of three children. Jocelyn is engaged in retail sales of soft drinks, rice and animal feed. Jocelyn has been in the business for more than two years now.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy more soft drinks to sell, as well as rice and animal feed. Jocelyn hopes that someday she will be able to improve her business and make it more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks,  rice, and animal feed to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 4 years to 22 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a business where she sells livestock. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. 

Josephine describes her biggest business challenge to be drought. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more livestock for resale. Her business goal is to be a wholesale distributor of animal products within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be self-reliant. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to resell

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario has faithfully repaid his previous loan which he used for his business. He has been operating his own parlor shop for many years, and he earns well from this. He had to work hard, with the determination of having a better income, to provide for his everyday needs.

To improve his business, Mario would like to apply for a new loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase beauty and hair products that he needs. He is sure to make his service satisfying and worth it for the sake of his customers. He sincerely lets you know his heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, he hopes for his business to become better and he wants to continue helping his family. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beauty and hair products for his salon.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Fishing has been Mila's livelihood for 26 years now. It is not an easy business because the weather is always a challenge when she and her husband are at sea. But with ten children, Mila is used to working hard to provide for them. She is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets. Mila is confident that new and sturdy fishing nets will allow them to catch more and bigger fish. 

Mila is 45 years old from Carles, Iloilo. She dreams of seeing her children aged 5-18 as successful someday.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Milagro De Los Angeles

texts.es: Milagro de 23 años de edad es una joven trabajadora que todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano para cuidar de sus gallinas y los fines de semana a preparar los ingredientes para la elaboración y venta de enchiladas y pasteles de carne, los cuales realiza desde hace 3 años en su vivienda, además buscando la manera de tener mejores ingresos vende ropa de hombre y mujer de forma ambulante en los cantones cercanos. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su pequeño hijo de 3 años y es para darle lo mejor a él que pone todo su esfuerzo ya que sabe que como madre soltera su esfuerzo debe ser mayor. Milagro se siente feliz de contar con pequeños negocios para sacar adelante a su hijo, sobre todo porque esto le permite cuidar de su hijo y ganarse la vida. Milagro desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI para invertir en: pantalones, faldas, blusas, camisas y gallinas para mejorar sus negocios y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Milagro is a 23-year-old young and hard-working woman.

She gets up very early every day to take care of her chickens. On the weekends she prepares the ingredients and makes enchiladas and meat pies at home to sell them later. She has been doing this for 3 years now. Looking for a way to improve her income, she also works as a vendor selling men and women's clothing in nearby cantons.

She lives in her own house with her little 3-year-old son and all the efforts she makes, which are bigger as a single mother, are meant to provide for him.
Milagro is happy to have small businesses that allow her to do so, especially since with them she can take care of her child and make a living.

Milagro wishes to acquire a loan from FUSAI to buy trousers, skirts, tops, shirts and chickens to improve her businesses and increase her income.

loans.use: to stock her business with trousers, skirts, tops and shirts, and to buy chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize, beans, tomatoes, meat, chicken, fish and onion etc.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime has owned and operated a transportation service for many years to earn a living. He supports the family's daily needs with this income in addition to the income from their retail store.  

Recently, he requested a new loan to repair his motorcycle which is used for his transportation business. A portion will be used to buy additional goods for their retail store. He plans to buy a side-car for his motorbike in order to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle used for his transportation business and a portion will buy additional goods for his retail store.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: In 2011, Mercy learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives. As a farmer in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to start her corn production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Mercy feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Mercy wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is from Waitaluk location in the Kenyan countryside. He has 4 children with Naliaka who he married 32 years ago. She has helped him to overcome the many adversities of life. She has also been very instrumental and supportive in their farming business since he ventured into it 7 years after they tied the knot.  

Simon owns a 5 acre piece of land that he uses to keep 3 cows, 15 head of poultry and to grow maize/corn. He has also grown 150 trees on the farmland out of concern for climate change. 

Agribusiness has enabled him to get ahead and make progress as the head of his family. The short term plan he has for his farm is to construct a shelter for his dairy animals and improve feed intake in a bid to boost milk production. 

This is the reason he is appealing to Kiva lenders for a loan investment to construct a cowshed and buy a chaff cutter for chopping hay. With the investment, he will be able to earn a better income and improve his family's quality of life, which means the world to him.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed and pay for a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 50 years old and married with four children. She lives in Sulipat, Calamba, Philippines. Her husband is a laborer.  

Lydia is engaged in buying and selling coconuts. She wants to help her husband in providing for the needs of their family, especially tuition fees and the allowances of their four children.  

Lydia heard about Paglaum Cooperative helping in financial assistance with additional benefits. So, Lydia decided to join the Paglaum program and apply for a loan to buy materials for a copra dryer for her coconut business.  

Lydia hopes, that someday her children will finish their studies and have a better living.

loans.use: to buy materials for a copra dryer.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and blessed with one child who is still young. They live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food. 

Mary has operated a clothes selling business, selling women's and gent's suits in a shop. She cites seasonality and stiff competition from other clothes operators to be her major challenges. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale at her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale at her business.

loans.name: Richie

texts.en:
Richie is 29 years old and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married, with two children. 

She has a shop where she sells products of different brand names. She has had this business for six years. 

Richie requested a loan to purchase more products of Personal Collection, MSE, Natasha, and Avon for direct-selling to her neighbors and friends. Richie has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for three years. 

In the future, Richie hopes to have her own business site and have more clients, for more sales.

loans.use: to purchase more products of Personal Collection, MSE, Natasha, and Avon for direct-selling.

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en:
Parviz was born in 1994. He lives and studies at the capital of Tajikistan. Parviz is a student in the third year at the National University of Tajikistan. Parviz is learning law. He is a clever and smart young man. He is going to be a successful lawyer after graduating university. 

Parviz is asking for a loan to pay for university tuition. Parviz thanks Kiva lenders in advance for support.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 53 years old, married and a resident of Calaran, Calamba, Philippines.  Her husband is a tricycle driver. They are blessed with 4 children. 

Because it is hard for them to survive if only her husband is working, she decided to engage in selling. She started a sari-sari (mini- grocery) store with a capital of 3,000 PHP. Her primary customers are her neighbors. She was successful and able to manage it well. 

She was able to finance the daily needs of her family with the help of Paglaum Cooperative; she became a member in April 2007. She was able to avail herself of two loans and repaid them religiously. Now, she is applying for a loan of 14,900 PHP to finance the purchase of additional stock for her sari-sari store. 

She is looking forward to expanding her sari-sari into a Mini-mart someday.

loans.use: to buy stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Adelita

texts.en: In 2013, Adelita learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it offers. She tried farming activities and it turned out to be successful with a good harvest.  She feels she owe her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Adelita borrowed another amount to purchase two sacks of fertilizers for her gardening activity to have more harvest to sell. This will help to give her farming income a big boost. Adelita looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Narlie

texts.en:
This is Narlie. She sends you her thankfulness for your generosity because her previous loan had greatly enhanced her business. She was able to buy spare parts and accessories for her vehicle. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs and expenditures.

Narlie is very positive that she could further improve her business, if you will let her borrow an amount of PHP 10,000. This new loan will go to additional supplies of accessories and spare parts for her tricycle. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family, if the unit is regularly maintained and in good condition.

Narlie is hoping that her house will be renovated and she could continue to support the educational needs of her children. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence, a married mother of a four-year-old, describes herself to be ambitious. For three years now she has been offering beauty services through  her salon, which is located in a busy area. Florence's primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest challenges as seasonal changes and financial constraints. 

Florence will use this Kes 20,000 loan, her second with SMEP Microfinance Bank, to buy more stocks of beauty products. Her goal is to be a wholesale distributor of beauty products within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will sustain her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of beauty products

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en: Miraflor is 32 years old and lives in Balangasan District, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 2 children. She has an internet cafe and has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan to purchase another three computer sets for her business to serve more clients and earn more to sustain her family's expenses. She has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Miraflor hopes that through her business, her children can finish their studies and have a stable job .

loans.use: to purchase another three computer sets

location.town: Pagadian - Balangasan District, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a store where she sells hardware items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of goods. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of hardware items. Her business goal is to open another branch within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy land. This is third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of hardware items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar lamp and an improved jiko stove

loans.name: Eraj

texts.en: Eraj is a hardworking and ambitious young man. He is 19 years old and lives with parents. His father is a businessman who always tries to provide a good education for his son. He does his best. Eraj now studies at the National University of Tajikistan. He is a student of the second course. Eraj studies full-time and is a successful student. He is asking for a loan to pay for university tuition. He thanks Kiva lenders in advance for their generosity.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: María de 52 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se desempeña como jornalera en un cultivo de loroco en su cantón, por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con un trabajo del cual subsistir. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo, ya que los otros hijos ya hicieron sus propios hogares pero no se olvidan de su madre y le brindan su apoyo económico.
