María siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer tenaz que siempre busca las mejoras y es por ello que desea encementar el piso del corredor que es de tierra y para eso solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y mano de obra para encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
María is 52 years old. She is a hardworking woman who works as a day-laborer on a loroco [an edible Central American flower] farm in her community; she is happy to be able to count on a job to provide for herself. She lives in her own house along with her son; her other children have already formed their own households, but they don't forget their mother and they provide her with financial support.

María has always been known for being a tenacious woman who always seeks improvement. That's why she wants to cement the dirt floor of her veranda. To do that, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and labor to cement the floor of her house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and labor to cement the floor of her house

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Flavia works hard to support her family.

She has a used clothing business in the Philippines. Flavia is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF in order to buy a bundles of used clothes to offer for resale.

Flavia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothes to offer for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a market for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan ksh 20,000, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her family and business

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Bahman

texts.en:
Bahman lives in the Absheron region with his family, but is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fizuli. He was married and has three children. His elder son just went to university, his second son is in ninth grade in school, and his little and sweet daughter goes to kinderland. He loves his big family. 

This is Bahman's second loan. The first loan was repaid on time. Now he is invited to different weddings, birthdays and etc., to cook Kababs. Today Bahman needs 1300 AZN to buy cookware (casseroles, equipment for making Kabab, etc.). He says thankful to Kiva organization and lenders for help.

loans.use: to buy cookware.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: pants, shirts, skirts, blouses, t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida hails from the municipality of Carles in Iloilo province. For a decade  now 59-year-old Lida and her husband have been engaged in fishing to earn a living. She also manage a sari-sari store for additional income. Her store sell items like spices, cooking oil, soy sauce, canned goods, sugar, milk, coffee and shampoo. She is asking for a loan to replenish her store inventory and buy items like canned goods, noodles, eggs, candies, biscuits and condiments. Sometimes, she has to miss some sales because of a lack of capital.

It is her hope that her loan will enable her to maximize her profit and eventually make her store bigger. Lida's five children are now grown.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, candies, biscuits and condiments

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en: Consolata is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 9 years to 19 years. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be seasonal changes. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler of clothes within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be self sustained. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, and her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as being ambitious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, milk, flour, and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. 

Angelina will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stocks of sugar, milk, bread, and other items. Her business goal is to have a supermarket within five years. 

She hopes that, in the future, she will be self-reliant and can sustain her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, milk, bread, and other items.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia de 53 años de edad todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano para ganarse la vida como jornalera en los cultivos de loroco y plátano que ahí cercanos a su cantón desde hace mucho tiempo, además sus dos hijos ya son mayores y le apoyan con los gastos del hogar. Ella vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos mayores de edad en vivienda propia desde hace 35 años, lo que la motiva y la hace sentirse muy feliz ya que para ella tener donde vivir un gran beneficio. Amelia se siente muy feliz con su vivienda, pero desea colocar energía eléctrica en ella ya que actualmente no cuentan con este servicio, y es para ello que Amelia solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: derecho de instalación, tubos, alambre eléctrico, tomacorriente y caja térmica para instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Amelia is 53 years old. For a long time, she has gotten up very early every day to earn her living as a day laborer in the banana and loroco [an edible Central American flower] farms near her community. Her two children are adults, and they help her with the household expenses. She lives with her life partner and their two adult children in a house that they have owned for 35 years, which motivates her and makes her feel very happy; to her, having a place to live is a real blessing. 

Amelia feels very happy with her house, but she would like to install electricity in it, since they do not currently have this service. That's why Amelia is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in installation fees, tubing, electrical wire, outlets, and a circuit breaker box to install electrical service in her house.

loans.use: to invest in installation fees, tubing, electrical wire, outlets, and a circuit breaker box to install electrical service in her house.

loans.name: Raul Ernesto

texts.es:
El señor Raúl un hombre luchador tienen 46 años es padre soltero tiene 5 hijos el mayor de 22 años y la última de 5 años, ellos viven con la mama, vive y tiene el negocio en San Miguel de los Bancos más conocido como  Cantón del amor lleno de gente amable y trabajadora, es un lugar muy turístico, por las diversas cascadas y hosterías y el maravilloso clima cálido húmedo, aquí encontramos la cascada del amor al cual se puede llegar muy rápido por el teleférico que tenemos en este Cantón.
Se dedica a la producción de pollos aprendió de esta actividad por iniciativa propia, al negocio le dedica un promedio de 6 a 8 horas diarias, el viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos y no pudo continuar con sus estudios, y sabe lo duro y difícil que es salir adelante sin tener preparación, solo tiene primaria, por eso se esfuerza y trabaja duro para poder ayudar a sus hijos a tener un futuro mejor.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en el negocio para el arreglo y ampliación de los galpones con esta nueva inversión podrá incrementar su producción y mejoraran sus ingresos económicos, el señor Raúl agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Raul is a fighter. He is 46 years old, is a single dad, and has five children—the eldest is 22 years old and the youngest is 5 years old. They live with their mother. 

He lives and works in San Miguel de los Bancos, best known as the "Cantón del Amor" [Hamlet of Love]. Full of kind and hard-working people, it is a popular tourist destination because of its various waterfalls, lodging options, and wonderful warm and humid climate. Here is where the Waterfall of Love is found, which can be accessed very quickly via the cable car in the hamlet.

He makes a living raising chickens, an occupation he learned on his own initiative. He devotes an average of six to eight hours a day to the business.

He comes from a low-income family and couldn't continue with his studies. He only finished elementary school, and he knows how hard and difficult it is to get ahead without an education. That is why he puts every effort into everything he does and works very hard to be able to help his children have a better future.

He is requesting a loan to invest in the business. He wants to fix and expand the sheds. With this new investment, he will be able to increase his production and improve his income.

Raul is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support and the opportunity they have given him.

loans.use: to invest in his farm. He wants to fix and expand the sheds. With this investment, he will improve his quality of life and that of his children by providing them with the education he never had.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María de 54 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo de 19 años de edad al que ha logrado sacar adelante a base de mucho esfuerzo. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida elaborando prendas de vestir tales como: faldas, blusas, chaquetas, pantalones, trajes, etc. Todos sus productos son elaborados con muy buena calidad por lo que tiene una buena cantidad de clientes. María siempre está buscando brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes es por ello que desea comprar una maquina industrial collaretera para poder elaborar otro tipo de prendas de vestir y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en una maquina industrial collaretera y telas para elaborar prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old, is a single mother, and lives in her own house with her 19-year-old son. She has succeeded in going forward based on a lot of effort. She is a hard-working woman, who makes a living making clothing, including skirts, shirts, jackets, pants, suits, etc. All of the products are very good quality, so she has many clients. Maria also offers good service to clients. 

Because of this, she wants to buy an industrial cover stitch machine so that she can make other types of garments. It is for this that she requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in an industrial cover stitch machine and fabric to make clothing.

loans.use: to invest in an industrial cover stitch machine and fabric.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines. Jacinta operates a small sari-sari, or retail store business, in her home. She sells various goods to the people in her locality. This venture has provided Jacinta the income that she needs. With this, she is able to send her children to school.

As of now, Jacinta wants to expand her business. So she decided to apply for a loan from CEVI. She is now requesting a loan to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap, and toiletries. This loan will enable her to expand her stock and cater more buyers to her store.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap, and toiletries

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a 57-year-old merchant from Ormoc, Leyte. She earns a living through her small retail business. She sells soft drinks, rice, coconut wine and other items. This is the source of her income. Right now, her stocks are limited and that is why she cannot accommodate all the needs of the buyers. Because of this, she would like to avail a loan to purchase more stocks to sell like rice, soft drinks and coconut wine. 

In the future, Avelina hopes to make her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like rice, soft drinks and coconut wine

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, milk, flour, and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, milk, bread, and other items. 

Her business goal is to have a mini-supermarket within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will create employment. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, milk, bread, and other items.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 49 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Salome has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and earns additional income from raising livestock.

Salome aspires to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Ligia Marlene

texts.es: Marlene tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera sus dos hijas tiene 8 y 18 años de edad y asisten  a la escuela, Marlene trabaja en una planta  florícola y también se dedica a la crianza de animales, ella vive con sus hijas en unos cuartitos por los que paga arriendo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para, lo que Marlene espera de su negocio es  criar adecuadamente a sus chanchos para venderlos teniendo una buena ganancia y seguir trabajando para el bienestar de sus hijos
texts.en:
Marlene is 40 years old and is a single mother. Her two daughters are 8 and 18 years old, and they attend school. Marlene works in a flower factory, and she also raises animals. She lives with her daughters in some small rooms she is renting. 

The loan will be invested in the purchase of pigs. Marlene plans to raise them well to sell them for a good earning. She will continue working for the wellbeing of her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma Fe works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business farming sugarcane in the Philippines.

Ma Fe is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Ma Fe is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Monica es una joven madre soltera de un hijo Ella vive con sus padres en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a su familia Monica gana dinero como empleada domestica pero ella ha visto que mejor suerte corren aquellas personas que elaboran comida, por eso ella quiere un credito para aperturar un carrito salchipapero (la salchipapa es un bocadillo compuesto por salchichas y papas fritas) y comprar insumos como salchichas, aceite, etc. Monica es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Monica is a young single mother of a son. She lives with her parents in La Paz in a brick and cement house, which belongs to her family. Monica earns money as a domestic employee, but she has noticed that people who prepare food can have a better income. Therefore, she wants a loan to start the business of a cart from where to sell salchipapas (a snack which is the mixture of sausages and french fries), and to buy ingredients such as sausages, oil, etc. Monica is the only source of income in her household. Because of this she needs your help.

loans.use: to start the business of selling salchipapas (a snack which is the mixture of sausages and french fries) from a cart, and to buy ingredients such as sausages, oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in bananas, oil, chili, lemon, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his tuition.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, cooking fat, and charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, cooking fat, and charcoal.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: Saúl de 56 años de edad es un padre responsable que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 4 hijos de 13, 11, 9 y 7 años de edad. Él es un hombre integro que se gana la vida realizando viajes exprés en su departamento y lugares aledaños, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace mucho tiempo por lo que ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que buscan sus servicios. Saúl tiene el firme propósito de ampliar su vivienda, ya que ha observado que sus hijos van creciendo y necesitan más espacio para vivir y evitar así el hacinamiento en el que viven actualmente, es para ello que Saúl solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro y lámina para ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Saul is 56 years old, and he is a responsible father who lives in his own house with his partner and their four children (13, 11, 9, and 7 years old). He is a man with integrity who makes a living making express trips in his department and surrounding places. He has done this work for a long time, so he has a good number of clients that request his services. 

Saul has a solid goal of growing his home. Since his children are growing up, they need more space to avoid overcrowding in the place they currently live. Because of this, Saul requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, iron, and sheets to make his home bigger.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, iron, and sheets to make his home bigger.

loans.name: Guillermo Antonio

texts.es: Guillermo tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre y un sobrino de 11 años de edad. GUillermo trabaja como electricista en diferentes zonas cercanas a su localidad. Guillermo desea construir un baño sanitario con ducha pero no cuenta con los ingresos disponibles para proceder a la construcción. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo, accesorios para el baño, lámina, etc.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 35 years old, and he lives in his own house with his mother and an 11-year-old nephew. Guillermo works as an electrician in different areas near his location. 

Guillermo wants to build a bathroom with a shower, but he doesn’t have disposable income to proceed with the construction. Because of this, he requests this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of cement, sand, brick, accessories for the bathroom, sheets, etc.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, brick, accessories for the bathroom, sheet, etc. to build a bathroom with a shower.

loans.name: Arnelo

texts.en:
Arnelo is a 42-year-old married man from Ormoc, Leyte. He is a father of five children. Arnelo earns a living through his hog-raising business. This has been the source of his income for more than five years now.

Arnelo is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise, and also animal feed. This loan will enable him to improve his business, thus augmenting his income.

Arnelo wants to save his earnings for reinvestment in the same business and for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise, and also animal feed.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en: Pilar is married and lives in Jimenez with her family. She has been selling snacks to make a living. Pilar sells suman [rice cakes] in her village and also accepts orders for any occasion. She is earning well for her family. Pilar has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying ingredients. To meet the current demand, she took out a new loan recently to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare suman to fill orders this yuletide season. She is happy to say that rest assured with this loan she will meet her desired income and save more for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare suman (rice cakes) for orders this yuletide season

loans.name: Wayua

texts.en:
Wayua is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells bread, milk, flour, sugar, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock. Her business goal is to be a wholesale distributor within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will sustain her family. 

This is Wayua's third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock.

loans.name: Ligia Elena

texts.es: Elena es madre soltera, ella tiene 31 años y su hija 5 años y asiste a la escuela,  Elena vive con sus padres y sus hija, sus padres se dedican a la agricultura y a la ganadería, Elena se dedica a la crianza de animales y también trabaja de empleada domestica en una casa, el crédito lo solicita para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos, la aspiración de Elena es mejorar su negocio y seguir trabajando para tener los ingresos que le permitan darle a su hija los implementos necesario para vestido, alimentación y sobre todo educación.
texts.en:
Elena is a single mother. She is 31 years old and has a 5-year-old daughter who attends school. Elena lives with her parents and her daughter. Her parents work in agriculture and livestock. Elena raises animals and also works as a domestic employee in a house. 

The loan she requests will be invested in the purchase of pigs. Elena’s goal is to improve her business and to continue working so that she has income that will allow her to give her daughter the things she needs for clothing, nutrition, and—above all—education.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con sus 3 hijos que se encuentran estudiando, su esposo trabaja dando mantenimiento del agua potable, Ana se dedica a la comercialización de ropa ya sea por pedido u ofreciendo su mercadería puerta a puerta, Ana necesita el crédito para  la compra de ropa que la adquiere en lugares retirados pero esa es su ventaja que la encuentra a bajo costo, la aspiración de Ana es adquirir mayor mercadería para ofrecer mayor variedad en sus productos y de las ventas que realice le quede algo de ingresos para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar y sobre todo en los gastos de educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is 35 years old, married, and the mother of three school-aged children. Ana's husband is a water system maintenance technician, while she sells clothing by order and door-to-door. 

Ana needs a loan for the purchase clothing. She casts a wide net, buying in various places in order to find the lowest costs. Ana hopes to purchase a greater variety of merchandise that she can offer to her customers. She also hopes that her clothing sales will provide her with income that she can combine with her husband's earnings to meet their household budget and pay for their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Azimzhan

texts.ru: Азимжан 62 года, женат, отец 3 детей. У Азимжана - среднее образование, он пенсионер, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи он занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1990 году с покупки скота, благодаря целеустремленности и трудолюбию Азимжана, на сегодняшний день у него в хозяйстве есть 8 овец. Также в сезон Азимжан занимается полеводством. На участке мерою 0,54 Га, она выращивает кукурузу и картофель. В целях дальнейшего развития своей животноводческой деятельности, она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для покупки бычков и овец. Скот Азимжан намерен перепродавать на местном скотном рынке, а доходы от кредита он направит на дальнейшее увеличить поголовья скота, что приведет к получению большей совокупной прибыли от перепродажи скота и мяса. Бизнес Азимжана по его замыслу должен помочь накопить средства на завершение строительства дома.
texts.en: Azimzhan is 62 years old, married, and the father of three children. He has the equivalent of a high school education and is now a pensioner.  He is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute an additional source of income for his family.  He started in this field in 1990 when he bought his first livestock.  Thanks to his perseverance and hard work, he currently owns eight sheep.  In addition, he also cultivates crops on a seasonal basis, growing corn and potatoes on 0.54 hectare of land.  In order to further develop his animal husbandry business, he has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  He will use this loan to purchase young bulls and sheep.  Azimzham intends to resell his livestock at the local cattle market and to reinvest the earnings from his loan into further increasing his livestock headcount.  This will lead to larger profits as he will resell more livestock and meat.  Azimzhan is planning to use the income from his business to save enough money to finish building his house.

loans.use: to buy additional sheep and young bulls for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Vingunguti Group

texts.en:
Stephano, who is in his late 30s, is married with three children. Two of them are in school and one is still small. He has been running a business of selling goats since 1997. He works from 4am to  6pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Stephano's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He has used the previous loans to increase his number of goats and has paid back all loans successfully. He is really doing great with his loans and appreciates Kiva for their support. He has used the profits to pay school fees, build a house, and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy more goats and sell to more customers.

Stephano will share this loan with Vingunguti Group, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more goats and sell to more customers.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan has been farming for many years and she earns a better income from this. With her previous loan, she was able to raise more farm products and was financially prepared for the next cropping season. She has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now planning to take a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer to restore the farm nutrients and have a productive harvest. She is now happy to say that with this loan, the entire farm will be fertilized and she can be assured of a productive farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients and have a productive harvest.

loans.name: Aplhelsina

texts.en:
Aplhelsina is a 51-year-old woman married to Michael, a 59-year-old man. They are blessed with five children: three of them have graduated from high school and are working. Two children are still living with them and are in school: Rikal, 12, in first year of junior high school; and Helen, 9, in fourth grade of elementary school.

Aplhelsina owns a kiosk business in an elementary school near her house, selling fried bananas, donuts, various candies, fried corn, soft drinks, and other snacks. She initiated the business five years ago. To make more income, Aplhelsina intends to add more stock to her business. She hopes the income from this business can help her cover her children's school fees and their living expenses as well. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Tanaoba Lais Manekat Foundation amounting to 3,000,000 Indonesian rupiah. She plans to spend the loan on snacks, candies, fruit, and cakes.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, candies, fruit, and cakes

loans.name: Arciniega Ramirez

texts.es: Johanna  tiene 21 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene un hijo de 2 años y espera la llegada de su otro hijo ya que en la actualidad está embarazada,  el esposo de Johanna se dedica  a trabajar en una planta florícola, Johanna se dedica a la crianza da animales menores, y el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ternros, lo que Johanna espera es que le vaya bien en su negocio para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos diarios de su hogar y mas aun con la llegada de su bebe.
texts.en:
Johanna is 21 years old, married, and the mother of two children, soon to be joined by a third child as she is pregnant. Johanna's husband works in a flower processing center, while she raises young livestock. She will use the funds from this loan to invest in the purchase of calves. 

Johanna hopes that her business will prosper so that she and her husband can meet their household expenses and provide for their two children, and the third one on the way.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is a very hardworking woman. Aside from taking care of eight children, she also operates a small retail business in her place in Leyte, Philippines. For more than a year now, this business has provided Antonieta what she needs to support her family, especially her children's schooling.
 
In order to expand her business, Antonieta is requesting a loan to buy more stocks to sell like soft drinks and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice and processed meat like hot dogs and sausages. 

In the future, Antonieta hopes to improve their way of living and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like soft drinks and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice and processed meat like hot dogs and sausages

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 55 years old and married with two children. She lives in Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She used her previous loan from GDMPC for her farm and it helped to improve and increase farm yields. 

She still wants to fertilize the entire farm to restore farm nutrients. She took a new loan recently to buy organic fertilizer to have a more productive harvest. Her future plans are to improve the entire farm and to renovate their house to make it more comfortable for the entire family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to have a more productive harvest.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman living with her husband and eight children. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to become a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village. 

With the Kshs 45,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her family and business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to her restaurant so that she can offer more comfort to her clients.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 30 years old. She is married to David and together they have been blessed with three children, who are 10, 8, and 3 years old. 

Alice sells soft drinks, a business she has done for the last 9 years earning a monthly income of KES 40,000. She has requested KES 30,000 for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to add to her stock of sodas for resale. 

With the anticipated profits, Alice will be able to expand her business further as well as repay her loan. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable business through which her family can be provided for.

loans.use: To buy more stock.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
This is Gemma. She sends you her thankfulness for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly entrenched her business. She was able to produce more products to sell and improve her profit. The loan also helped her provide for their everyday needs and expenses.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her lend her 19,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies and raw materials she needs in making homemade peanut and coco jam. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her business, Gemma wants to give her family a good life and a sustainable livelihood. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Maria Blanca

texts.es:
María  de 61 años de edad, es viuda y tiene una hija, cuando su esposo murió ella osla tuvo que hacerle frente  a la v id para sacar adelante a su hija, quien es la única que vive con ella.

María es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 15 años, lo hace de manera ambulante ofreciendo, desde temprano sale de su casa acompañada de su hija para realizar la ruta de venta. El préstamo lo necesita para comprar ropa para dama, caballeros y niños de distintos estilos y gustos, para aprovechar que se acerca la época navideña y es cuando a los clientes les gusta comprarse ropa.

María espera agrandar su negocio con venta de sandalias y zapatos y quizá algún día instalase en una boutique que maneje ella misma.
texts.en:
Maria is 61 years old, is a widow, and has one daughter. When her husband died, she had to make it a priority to take her daughter forward; her daughter is the only person who lives with Maria.

Maria is a businesswoman. She has been selling clothing door to door for 15 years. Recently, she has been selling her products on her route with the help of her daughter. 

The loan she needs is to buy clothing for women, men, and children of distinct styles and tastes, so that she can take advantage of the upcoming Christmas season, since that is when clients like to buy clothes.

Maria wants to grow her business by selling sandals and shoes, and maybe someday she will start a boutique that she manages herself.

loans.use: to buy clothing for women, men, and children of distinct styles.

loans.name: Nithanel

texts.en:
Nithanel is a 42-year-old man and is married to Makrina, a 40-year-old lady. They have been blessed with two children: Yanto, 15, attending third grade of junior high school; and Alfian, 10, attending fifth grade of elementary school. 

Nithanel owns two minivans and runs a transport business. The income from this business really helps Nithanel to meet his family's living expenses and children's school fees. Last month, one of his cars was damaged. He repaired it but sometimes it still does not work. He needs to buy new spare parts to replace the old ones but he does not have money to do so. Therefore Nithanel is requesting a loan of 4,500,000 IDR from TLM.

loans.use: to buy new spare parts to replace the old ones

loans.name: Carlos Cesar

texts.es:
Carlos de 40 años de edad, está casado y tiene 6 hijos de 19, 16, 14, 11, 6 y 5 años de edad. Él estudió hasta 4° grado de educación básica, su esposa es ama de casa y comerciante, se encarga de cuidar a sus hijos y tres veces por semana vende pan.

Carlos es albañil desde los 22 años de edad, aprendió por iniciativa propia, antes se dedicaba a elaborar lazos, cuerdas y hamacas con su padre desde que él tenía 6 años de edad le ayudaba dándole vuelta al torno. El préstamo será utilizado en instalar la luz en su vivienda, para facilitar las tareas en horas de la noche y vivir más cómodos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 40 years old, is married, and has six children, who are 19, 16, 14, 11, 6, and 5 years old. He studied until the fourth grade of primary school. His wife is a housewife and businesswoman. She is responsible for taking care of their children, and, three times per week, she sells bread.

Carlos has worked in construction since he was 22 years old. He learned the trade by his own initiative. Before that, he was making snares, cords, and hammocks with his father. He began doing this from the age of 6; he helped with turning the lathe. 

The loan will be used to install light in his home. This will make it easier to do tasks at night and will help his family live more comfortable.

loans.use: to install light in his home.

loans.name: Qamile

texts.en:
Qamile comes from an Ashkali community. She has two children, ages 5 and 7, and is a housewife and stay-at-home mother, while her husband works transporting goods. Like most people in their community, they live in very poor conditions that are substandard. Some of the walls in the house are full of mold and other bacteria, and the environment is unsanitary and unhealthy for her children. 

They have never had an opportunity to improve their living conditions and have decided it is important enough to request a loan in order to address this problem. The loan would have a direct impact on their living conditions, and she is grateful for the opportunity to give her children a healthier place to grow up. She hopes that in the future she will be able to find a job and contribute to the family budget. She wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to repair the walls of her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more crabs and fish to sell

loans.name: Gulchehrakhon

texts.ru: Эту милую женщину с открытым лицом зовут Гулчехрахон. Она вместе с мужем и детьми проживает на районе Рудаки. Гулчехрахону 44 года. И уже много лет она занимается швейным делом. Гулчехрахон научилась шить у своей мамы. Гулчехрахон хотела бы все свое мастерство передать своей дочке, как она получила от своей мамы. Муж Гулчерахона водитель маршрутки. У него хорошая работа, но сейчас ему срочно необходимо поменять маршрутку, чтобы не потерять работу. И Гулчехрахон решила помочь мужу. Муж нашел машину, но не хватает сбережения, чтобы совершить покупку. Гулчехрахон просит кредит в размере $5000 для купли маршрутки марки "Starex".
texts.en:
This nice lady with a kind face is Gulchehrakhon.  She is 44 and lives together with her husband and children in the Rudaki region of Tajikistan.  She's a seamstress by trade, and has worked as one for many years; she first learned her trade from her mother, and hopes to teach her own daughter in turn.  

Gulchehrakhon's husband is a taxi driver.  He has a good job, but needs to replace his taxi soon in order to keep working.  He's found a new vehicle, but lacks the money to buy it.  Gulchehrakhon would like to help her husband, and is seeking a loan of $5,000 to buy him a Starex-brand van.

loans.use: buy a Starex-brand van for her husband

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a married woman. She has three children ranging from 5 to 13 years old. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, milk, flour, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as the lack of enough stock. 

She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of bread, milk, flour and other items. Her business goal is to be a wholesale distributor within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will sustain her family and her business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more bread, milk, flour and other items

loans.name: Saidjon

texts.en: Saidjon was born in 1990. He is a clever and smart man. Saidjon studies in his second course at Tajikistan State University. He studies with the faculty of Orientalism. Saidjon studies well and he is one of the best students. He reads a lot of books. Saidjon is not married and he lives with parents. His father works in a school. He is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. He awaits your mercy and in advance thanks you for generosity.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Yulia

texts.en:
Yulia is a 38-yearold lady, married to Gasper, 48, a driver. They are blessed with four children: Ferdy, 23, who is working; Vita, 19, who graduated from senior high school; Naldy, 16, who is not in school and is working; Arni, 2. 

Yulia runs a business selling snacks and gasoline at home. She has been running the business for a year. She sells various snack products because her house is close to a school. The income from her business enables her to assist her husband in covering their household needs and school fees. 

Recently, Yulia was thinking to improve the business. She intends to open a new business by selling flowers. Therefore she has requested a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 3,000,000 to purchase seeds and pots, and more snacks for her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pots for her flower business, and more snacks for her snack business.

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.en:
Yuliana, a 62-year old woman, is married to Marthinus, a 62-year old man. They have four children, three of whom are married and living with their own families. They also have a daughter Dince, 29, who lives with Yuliana and is working.
 
Yuliana has a business selling cakes, fruits, and vegetables. She displays all products in a box in front of her house. She initiated the business four years ago using capital provided by her husband's pension. To generate more income, Yuliana intends to add more stock to her business. She hopes the income from this business can help her to cover living expenses. She has requested a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 3,000,000. She plans to spend the loan on fruit and cakes.

loans.use: to buy fruit and cakes

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet, 33, is a diligent farmer based in the Kitale region of Kenya. She has been able to sustain the livelihood of her family of three children for the last ten years by selling milk, eggs, and other crops produced on her farm. 

Many farmers are just like Linet; they practice mixed farming. Most of their problems are with crop farming, where the tasks take too much time to accomplish. It requires a lot of effort and labour to plough and cultivate land. Machinery and equipment come in handy to reduce all sorts of costs. 

Linet is seeking a loan to purchase farm implements. Old or poor farm implements usually result in high costs and poor quality of work. This is a clear recipe for losses. To resolve this issue, she joined a group named Soku Women Self Help Group in order to access Juhudi Kilimo’s agricultural loans. 

Juhudi offers loans to individual farmers in a group whose members share a strong bond of solidarity. Your loan contribution will enable Linet to afford proper farm implements necessary for quality work output on the farm. With the increased yields, she will comfortably afford her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Jose Ramiro

texts.es: Ramiro es un señor de 44 años de edad, el tiene 2 hijos, la hija tiene 15 y el hijo 9 años mismos que se encuentran estudiando, Ramiro trabaja en una planta florícola y adiciona a eso se dedica a la crianza de animales, el crédito lo necesita para hacer la compra de chanchos que los compra en el campo y que los vende en las ferias de la ciudad más cercana, la aspiración de Ramiro es mejorar su negocio todo para el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ramiro is a 44-year-old man. He has two children, a 15-year-old daughter and a 9-year-old son, both of whom go to school. 

Ramiro works at a flower factory and also raises animals.

He needs a loan to buy pigs, which he will purchase in the countryside and sell at the markets in the nearest city.

His goal is to improve his business for his children's well-being.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Ireen

texts.en: Ireen, 28, is a small-scale farmer who specializes in horticulture. She is based in a small village called Mukuni, near Chuka, Kenya. This charming mother has been doing agriculture on her small, fertile piece of land for 10 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops. Ireen is seeking a loan to expand her horticulture farm. Her biggest challenge over the years as a farmer has been the lack of adequate capital. It is very hard for small farmers to save enough capital for expansion, since farming is marred with all sorts of external risks, such as climatic conditions, pests and diseases, political instability, fluctuation of prices and high costs of inputs. Because of these factors, the sure way farmers can obtain adequate capital is through leveraging their businesses. With your loan investment, Ireen is going to expand her horticultural farm in order to increase its output. If and when the investment pays off, Ireen will plough the profits back into the farm and increase her asset base.

loans.use: to expand her farm

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en: Rolly earns a living from selling fruits in the market to make a living. His earnings go to his children's education costs.  He earns well from this and was able to repay his previous loan successfully. To add to his capital, he borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy an additional volume of fruits to cater to his customers' demands.  He hopes to have more returns in order to generate additional income for the purpose of providing a better education to his children.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits to cater to his customers' demands

loans.name: Nexhmije

texts.en:
Nehmije is 56 years old, a mother of 4 children, and widowed. She works as a cleaner and has to work hard and long hours in order to improve her living conditions and provide for her children. 

The windows and the doors in her home are very damaged because she has never had the money and opportunity to renovate her house. She is requesting 700 Euros to replace the windows and doors. She is very happy for this opportunity and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: To replace the windows and doors of her house

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman who is staying together with her husband and eight children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a firewood selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale

loans.name: Amari

texts.en:
Amari, who is 42 years old, lives in a small village in Dhenkanal district, Odisha, India. She has two children. 

To make a living, she operates and manages a rice farming business on rice farmland, which is located near her house. She has been in this career for 14 years. On average, she can generate earnings of 2,000 INR per month. 

Amari wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through Peoples Forum, with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials and laborer fees to make a latrine in her house

loans.name: Rosa Lizbeth

texts.es: Rosa tiene 19 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una hija de 2 años, ella vive con sus padres en una casa por la que pagan  arriendo, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores ya que dice que esa es su fuente de ingresos los que son necesarios para alimentar y vestir a su hija, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos, y de este negocio aspira mejorarlo y salir adelante con su hija.
texts.en: Rosa is 19 years old, a single mother of a 2 year old daughter. She lives with her parents in a rented house. She raises small animals and says that this is her source of income that is needed to feed and dress her daughter. The loan will be used to buy pigs, and she hopes this business grows and she can get ahead in life with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, blouses and children's clothing.

loans.name: Antonio Fernando

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos más conocido como Cantón del amor lleno de gente amable y trabajadora, es un lugar muy turístico, por las diversas cascadas y hosterías y el maravilloso clima, aquí encontramos la cascada del amor al cual se puede llegar muy rápido por el maravilloso teleférico que tienen en este Cantón.
En este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio el señor Antonio un hombre luchador de 30 años es casado de esta relación tienen 2 hijos, la esposa le ayuda en el negocio, ellos se dedican a la producción y venta de melcochas y maní dulce de forma ambulante venden en los buses, vienen de familia de bajos recursos económicos, desde muy niños tuvieron que trabajar, se iniciaron en esta actividad como vendedores cuando aprendieron lo necesario se dedicaron de forma independiente, al negocio le dedican un promedio de 10 horas diarias. 
Solicitan el crédito para invertir en el negocio, comprarán activos para incrementar la producción de melcochas y maní dulce, con esta nueva inversión mejorarán sus ingresos económicos y podrán ayudar a que sus hijos se preparen y  tengan un mejor futuro, el señor Antonio agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos is most known as the area of love, filled with nice and hard-working people. It is a touristy place because of the various waterfalls and marvelous climate. Here we find the waterfall of love, which you can arrive at quickly via the cable car that runs through this region.

In this region lives Antonio, a hard-working 30 year old man who is married and has 2 children. His wife helps him with the business. They produce and sell molasses syrups and sweet peanuts as street vendors to buses. They come from poor families, and since childhood had to work. They began this business selling when they learned the necessary skills for this work, and they started their own business, working on average 10 hours per day.

They seek a loan to invest in the business. They will buy material assets to increase production of syrup and sweet peanuts, thus increasing his income and they will be able to offer his children an education and a better future. Antonio is thankful to the Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support and opportunities provided.

loans.use: to buy material assets to increase his product production, thus increasing his income and he will be able to offer his children an education and a better future.

loans.name: Claudia Lorena

texts.es:
Claudia de 25 años de edad, es soltera  y no tiene hijos, estudió hasta bachillerato, vive con su madre y nadie depende de ella.

Claudia es comerciante, tiene 5 años de administrar un chalet en el instituto educativo de su comunidad, aprendió por iniciativa propia, ella estudio en ese instituto y se dio cuenta de la cantidad de venta que se lograba. Todos los días viaja 15 minutos en vehículo  para llegar al chalet, trabaja de 7:30 am hasta las 3:40 pm. Pero ella llega antes para preparar la venta. También se dedica al comercio de carne de res y cerdo con su madre que ya lleva 2 años en el negocio. 

El préstamo será utilizado mayormente en comprar cerdos para el sacrificio y venta de su carne y otra parte para abastecer el chalet. Claudia piensa en poner una pupuseria en su casa, pero necesita personal ya que ella debe estar pendiente de su chalet.
texts.en: Claudia is 25 years old, single, and does not have any children. She completed high school and lives with her parents. Claudia is a businesswoman. For 5 years she has run a snack bar in the school in her community, a business she taught herself. She studied in this school and realized the quantity of sales that were possible. Every day she travels 15 minutes by vehicle to arrive at the snack bar, and works from 7:30 AM until 3:40 PM. But she arrives earlier to prepare for sales.  She also sells beef and pork with her mother, and has had this business for 2 years. The loan will be used to buy pigs to butcher and sell the meat and also to supply the snack bar. Claudia is thinking about opening a convenience store in her home, but she needs additional help since she has to be at the snack bar.

loans.use: to buy pigs to butcher and sell the meat and also to supply the snack bar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to install a sanitation system and drinking water pipes in her house, which she still does not have.

loans.name: Leomar Del Socorro

texts.es: Socorro tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera de 5 hijos, mismos de los cuales solo una vive con ella ya que los demás ya son mayores de edad e independientes, Socorro vive con su hija y su nieta, ella vive arrendando y ahí mismo hay un espacio donde puede tener sus pollitos y comenta que también trabaja al jornal en agricultura, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para mejorar su negocio y lo que  Socorro espera es mejora su negocio y seguir trabajando para quedarse viviendo en Ecuador ya que ella es una señora colombiana y dice que en Ecuador se tiene una vida mas tranquila.
texts.en:
Socorro is 40 years old. She is a single mother and has five children, only one of whom still lives with her because the others are grown and independent. Socorro, her daughter, and one granddaughter live together in a rented home. There is a space in the home where she keeps her chickens. Socorro  mentions that she also works as a day laborer on a farm.

She is going to invest her loan in the purchase of chickens to improve her business. She wants to continue working hard and making the business better so that she can maintain her residence in Ecuador - she is originally from Colombia but says that life in Ecuador is much more relaxed.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wheels for and to maintain his mototaxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase equipment and tools needed for his window washing business.

loans.name: Ekome Feamo Group

texts.en:
Ekome Feamo Group is made up of seven people who live in the same area. The group's representative, named Humu, is 43 years old and has attended school to the secondary level. She's married to a driver named Abudu. Together they have two children, both of whom go to school and are in their care. Humu lives with her children, and she takes care of the family's various expenses. For this reason, she's been buying and selling groceries (Milo drink powder, milk, sardines, paper, drinks, etc.) to customers. She has been doing this business for the past five years. This enables her to provide for her family and for herself. Humu gets her supplies from the market in Ghana. To bolster her business, Humu, together with the other members of the group, is seeking a eighth loan from Kiva's partner, ID Ghana. 

They promise to work hard to repay this loan without trouble. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy and sell grocery products (Milo drink powder, milk, sardines, paper, drinks, etc.) to customers.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es: José de 28 años de edad es muy reconocido en su cantón por su emprendedurismo ya que desde hace 6 años tomo la decisión de instalar una granja de pollos en su vivienda, y hace 3 años al observar la necesidad de una tienda de productos básicos decidió instalar una en su vivienda, lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia. Él habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hermano desde hace muchos años. José ha sabido ganarse la vida apoyado en sus negocios, es por ello que desea invertir en ellos para obtener mejores ganancias para que su calidad de vida y la de su familia sea mucho mejor, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, café, pan dulce, etc.
texts.en:
Jose, aged 28, is well-known in his hamlet for his entrepreneurship. Six years ago, he made the decision to set up a chicken farm at his home; and three years ago, he decided to open a store selling basic consumer goods at his home after noting the need for one in the area. These decisions have enabled him to provide for his family. He has been living in his own home with his life partner and his brother for a long time. 

Jose has been able to earn a living through his businesses. For this reason, he wants to invest in them in order to generate a better profit, which will greatly improve his quality of life and that of his family. This is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy chickens, rice, beans, sugar, coffee, "pan dulce" (sweet yeast bread or pastry, baked in many varieties and sizes), and the like.

loans.use: to buy chickens, rice, beans, sugar, coffee, "pan dulce", and the like.

loans.name: Japeth

texts.en:
Japeth lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana-growing region. He is a smallholder mixed farmer who has been doing this work for over a decade to look after the needs of his family of four children. He keeps dairy and poultry and grows tea for the commercial production of milk, eggs, and tea, respectively.

Japeth stated that he would like to improve the productivity of his dairy. To do this, he has to have a source for funds to give the structures in place a facelift.  

Japeth has resorted to leveraging his business. He is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed for his dairy cattle. A shelter for the cow will provide the farmer an ample environment to operate and manage daily farm activities. The animals will also have an ample environment conducive for producing milk. 

Revenue from the sale of milk will repay the loan and help Japeth offset other business expenses. His family will greatly benefit from the developments accruing in the farm.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Ashanti

texts.en:
Ashanti, who is 42 years old, lives in Dhenkanal district of Odisha, India. She has three dependent children who are currently in school. She is a housewife, and her husband is a daily laborer who can make an income of 4,000 INR per month, on average. 

Ashanti wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through Peoples Forum with a much lower interest rate than its general loan products.

loans.use: to pay for building a latrine

loans.name: Francisco Xavier

texts.es: Francisco es un joven trabajador de 21 años de edad, el vive con sus padres y tiene una hija de  se 6 años de edad que asiste  a la escuela, Francisco se dedica al jornal y a la crianza de pollos ya que es su madre es quien le enseña a esta actividad, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, y de este negocio aspira mejora su negocio  seguir trabajando y darle todo lo necesario a su hija.
texts.en:
Francisco is a hardworking young man. He is 21 years old and lives with his parents. He has a six-year-old daughter who is going to school. Francisco works as a laborer and also raises chickens. He learned this business from his mother.

He will invest this loan in buying chickens. His goals are to improve his business, continue working, and give his daughter everything she needs.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya is a 24-year-old single lady, who works as a tutor. She does her work at her parents' house. She has been in the tutoring business for three years, to cover her needs and benefit from the chance of continuing her education.

Aya is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua. She will use it to pay her university fees. She takes the loan, because her income is not well enough to cover the additional fees she needs.

She hopes that one day, she can open a special tutoring center. Such a center would help her a lot, to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven de 24 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo ya que las laminas están deterioradas por las lluvias, pero no tiene de suficiente capital, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra, para que ella y su madre puedan vivir seguras y cómodas.
texts.en:
This 24 year old young woman lives in her own home with her mother. She has been working selling personal products for several years. Her business is located in her house. 

She wants to improve her home by replacing the roof, because the rain has damaged the sheet metal. However, she doesn't have enough capital, which is why she is requesting a loan to buy sheet metal and purlins and pay for labor. This will allow her and her mother to live more safely and comfortably.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal and purlins and pay for labor.

loans.name: Rosa De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Rosa vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace 30 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulantes por las diferentes colonias, Doña Rosa está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y asi poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos y darle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rosa lives in her own home with her daughter.  She's had a business selling personal care products for 30 years.  Her business is located in her home, and she also sells from place to place in various neighborhoods.  Rosa is requesting a loan to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoos, deodorants, and other products at wholesale.  This way, she can continue with her work so that she can have more income and give her daughter a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoos, deodorants, etc. at wholesale

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.en:
Firdavs is 20 years old. He lives in the capital of Tajikistan with his parents. Firdavs is a student of the third course at National University of Tajikistan. He studies well and always has excellent marks. 

Firdavs reads a variety books and usually goes to the university. Firdavs dreams to be a good specialist after graduating university. His parents are workers and have small salaries. Firdavs is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheet, wood and nails to build the corridor of her house.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is married and a father of seven children. He lives with his spouse, in a traditional family, in Isingiro.

Jackson has been buying and selling cereals for over 16 years. He buys his supplies in the markets around Isingiro and Mbarara. After buying his supplies, he briefly stores them in his home before reselling them. He sells in a local market, to a clientele comprised of men and women, who buy with cash or on credit.

This new loan will allow Jackson to buy 200kg bags of cereals. This is the third individual loan he's received from the microfinance institution, UGAFODE, in the hope of better satisfying his ever-growing clientele. His previous loans have been repaid. He would like to earn an average monthly profit of Uganda shillings 600,000 per month. This profit will allow him to pay his loan and interest, and to invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell at the local market

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget is a mother of the land, who has drive and perseverance. She lives with her husband and five children, on a humble farm in the rural zone of Kinono, in the Nkubu area of Kenya. Up until now, she has had the valor and courage to raise her children by her own means. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops, and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet.

Bridget passionately loves dairy farming. When she was asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated “feeding my cows.” Her hobby is milking Mutune (the name of her dairy cow). She sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet the demand. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an additional dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk production. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow; it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profit and an increased income level. Profits from selling milk will be used to repay the loan in full, and to grow her business enterprise further.

Bridget is very visionary. She intends that in the near future, she will start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling. She also intends to begin selling dairy products, such as yogurt. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow and increase milk production

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Purity dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Kulumkan

texts.ru: Кулумкан 43 года, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Кулумкан с 1994 года занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве Кулумкан на сегодняшний день имеется 3 дойные коровы, 4 бычка, 3 лошади и 25 овец. На ежедневной основе Кулумкан реализует молоко местным жителям, оно пользуется большим спросом и приносит хорошую прибыль. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулумкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства и хочет сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en: Kulumkan is 43 years old, married, and she is raising four children. She has been involved in animal husbandry since 1994, and this activity constitutes her family's main source of income.  She currently owns three dairy cows, four young bulls, three horses and 25 sheep.  She sells milk to the local residents on a daily basis.  She receives a high demand for the milk that she produces, thus making a nice profit.  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy young bulls for fattening and resale.  She is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her farming business.  She also wants to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy additional young bulls for fattening and resale, in order to grow her business.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 24 years old. She is married to John, and together they have been blessed with two children, now eight and six years old. Vivian is a butcher, a business she has engaged in for the past two years. She earns a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, in the amount of KES 20,000. She will use the loan to add to her stock of cow meat, goat meat, and liver. With the anticipated profits, Vivian will be able to purchase a deep freezer for storing leftover meat. This equipment will enable her to secure all the profits.

Her hope and dream for the future is to have a stable business, through which she can provide for her family.

loans.use: to add to her stock of cow meat, goat meat, and liver.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en: Rustam was born in the year 1992. He graduated from Technical University of Tajikistan last year. He got a bachelor's degree. This year, he applied to the National University of Tajikistan, to begin a master's degree program. Rustam now studies in the first-year course of magistracy. He learns banking systems. Rustam is going to work in any bank, after graduating in magistracy. He is asking for a loan to pay for education. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his master's degree course of study

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 45 years old and married with 5 children, living in Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She used her previous loan from GDMPC for her service-based business and repaid it successfully. She has a farm and in addition to coconuts, she grows vegetables to earn her weekly income. She wants to fertilize the entire farm to restore farm nutrients. She took a new loan recently to buy organic fertilizer to have a more productive harvest. Her future plan is to improve the entire farm and be able to renovate their house for a comfortable living for the entire family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to have a more productive harvest.

loans.name: Medaly

texts.es:
Medaly es una joven muy emprendedora y trabajadora, estudió la carrera de Farmacia en su ciudad natal, Tinguiña. Actualmente ejerce su profesión en una Botica como Técnica farmacéutica, y cree que le está yendo bien porque es muy dedicada y también ama lo que hace. En sus tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música y salir a pasear con su familia, siempre está preocupada por el bienestar de sus seres queridos y se esfuerza mucho para que vivan bien.
Medaly está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá realizar mejoras en su cuarto como pintarrajear las paredes y comprar algún mueble para amoblarlo, con esto su calidad de vida mejorará, dormirá más tranquila y seguirá luchando para más adelante poder tener su propia farmacia.
texts.en:
Medaly is a very enterprising and hard-working young woman. She studied for a career in pharmacy in her native city, Tinguiña. Currently she is practicing her profession at a pharmacy, working as a pharmacy technician. She believes it is going well because she is very dedicated and also loves what she does. 

In her free time she likes to listen to music and go walking with her family. She is always concerned about the well-being of her loved ones, and does her very best so that they can live well.  

Medaly is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with the support they have offered her, she will be able to undertake improvements to her room, such as painting the walls and buying some furniture. With this, her quality of life will improve, she will sleep more soundly, and will continue striving to someday have her own pharmacy.

loans.use: To paint the walls of her room and buy a bed.

loans.name: Rapiya

texts.ru: Рапия успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей с финансированием, для нее это была своевременная и очень необходимая ей помощь. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Рапии есть 2 коровы, 18 овец и коз, также 1,20 Га поливной земли, где Рапия выращивает ячмень. Ее ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). Рапия хочет и дальше развивать свой бизнес, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Рапия планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства и хочет накопить средства на строительство сарая для скота.
texts.en: Rapiya successfully repaid her loan and used it as intended.  She is very thankful to Kiva and to all the lenders who helped her get this financing, as this loan provided timely and much need support.  Rapiya currently owns two cows as well as 18 sheep and goats. In addition, she grows barley on 1.20 hectare of irrigated land.  She makes a total monthly income of about 15,000 som (KGS).  She would like to further grow her business, and for this reason, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy some cows.  She is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further developing her farming business.  She also wants to save enough money to build a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase additional cows in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Babita

texts.en:
Babita, 36 years old, is a married woman who lives in Odisha, India. She has two dependent children. 

Babita is an active farmer on a small rice farm, which is located near her house. By growing rice and selling the crop to local dealers, she can make an average income of 3,000 INR per month. So far, she has been involved in this career for five years. 

Babita wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine, something which is currently missing in her house. 

Therefore, Babita is requesting a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

Babita is thankful for the loan granted through Peoples Forum with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be honest and open. 

She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high competition. 

She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will open more branches of her business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Babita

texts.en:
Babita is a hardworking woman, 47 years old. She is married and has two children. The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family's living standard. Her family’s income is mainly from a small business. With more than 20 years experience and support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan.

She is thankful to Kiva and its lenders for this help and support.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Sujata

texts.en:
Sujata is 40 years old, a married lady who has two children. She lives in a rural village of the Dhenkanal district of Odisha state, India. 

She is a rice farmer in the local area and she also raises chickens and works for others for a fee. Having been in the business for 15 years, she can earn a monthly income of approximately 4,000 INR. She is able to save about 1,000 INR each month for future needs. 

Sujata is the main source of income in her family. She requested her first loan from Peoples Forum, which she will use to build a latrine for her family. She hopes to have a decent latrine so as to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to build a latrine for her family

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
Shavkat was born in 1993. He is a very hardworking and industrious man. He is not married and lives with his parents. 

He studies at the Technical University of Tajikistan. He studies well and successfully takes part in all university parties. Shavkat has a brother and sisters who are in school. His parents paid for their school tuition and now they have no money to pay the university tuition of Shavkat. 

Shavkat is asking for a loan of 1,200 USD to pay university tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: pay his tuition

loans.name: Bebelita

texts.en:
Bebelita is married and lives in Jimenez with her family. 

She  has been selling food and snacks to make a living.She sells a variety of food stuffs and also accepts orders for any occasion, earning well for the family. To meet the current demands, she took a  new loan recently to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare food to fulfill orders. 

She was happy to say that with this loan, she will rest assured to meet her desired income and to save more for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare food to fulfill orders

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
