Alice is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest and God-fearing. 

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are middle class. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

She will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have the best cereal shop in town within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have best quality products and improve her living standards.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Jarkynay

texts.ru: Жаркынай успешно погасила предыдущий кредит, использовала его по назначению. Она очень благодарна всем инвесторам и Фонду Кива. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Жаркынай есть 3 коровы, 8 овец и 2 лошади, также на собственной земельной доле она по-прежнему выращивает картофель, сеет зерновые культуры и эспарцет. Жаркынай уже заготовила 200 тюков сена на зиму для скота. Экологически чистая, вкусная продукция пользуется большим спросом, поэтому Жаркынай планируя дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса, обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля элитного сорта. Доходы от кредита она будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Jarkynay successfully repaid her previous loan after using it as intended.  She is very thankful to Kiva and to all the lenders who helped her.  She currently owns three cows, eight sheep and two horses.  In addition, she still grows potatoes, cereals and sainfoin on her own plot of land.  She has already prepared 200 bales of hay for her livestock, to be used this winter.  She receives a high demand for her organic, delicious crops, and for this reason, she is planning to further increase her business.  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to buy high quality potato seeds.  She is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further developing her farming business.

loans.use: to buy high-quality potato seeds for sowing, in order to increase her production of organic vegetables.

loans.name: Rafika

texts.en:
Rafika is a married mother of six children. Due to the low financial situation of her husband, she decided seven years ago to start selling beauty cosmetics from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Today, Rafika is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to open a shop and increase her business merchandise with new cosmetics products which will satisfy her customers' needs.

Rafika still hopes to expand her business more to satisfy the increasing needs of her beloved kids.

loans.use: to buy new cosmetics

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is married and is running a general store to earn a living. For many years, it has been running well and earning a better income that enables her to send her children to school. 

To offer more goods, she took a new loan to purchase additional goods like grains and dried fish  in addition to her stocks for sale. She is hopeful to improve her business and wants to make more home improvements to have a safe and comfortable living.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods like grains and dried fish  in addition to her stocks for sale.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a married woman. She describes herself to be patient and understanding. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be limited business space. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more seats and tables for her restaurant. Her business goal is to have a big hotel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more seats and tables for her restaurant

loans.name: Renubala

texts.en:
Renubala is 36-year-old lady. She is married and has three children. Renubala lives and works in Dhenkanal district, a rural area in Odisha state, India. She has a business of milk selling and has been involved in this business for eight years.

This is Renubala's first loan with People's Forum. The main hardship that she faces in her life is not having a clean water system or a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet. 

In the future, Renubala hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Kalyani

texts.en:
Kalyani is 45 and works as a farmer. Her husband is a driver of a private home. The couple have two children. 

Kalyani is very hardworking and loves her job. She use dugwell water for cooking food, drinking, and other wok. It is very difficult to take water from a dug well for her living and it is also very difficult for her health situation.

This is why Kalyani is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a pipe connection as soon as possible, in order to avail clean water for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a pipe connection to avail clean water

loans.name: Meybelin Carmina

texts.es: Meybelin de 33 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida de prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar desde hace 8 años. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 3 hijos una niña de 6 años de edad y 2 varones de 14 y 2 años de edad desde hace 30 años. Meybelin siempre busca la manera de mejorar las condiciones de su familia, por lo que ha decidido construir un corredor en su vivienda, para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: polines, pines, cemento, arena, grava y lámina para construir un corredor en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Meybelin is 33 years old. She is a hardworking woman who for the past 8 years has earned a living offering in-home housekeeping services. She lives in her own home with her three children - a daughter who is 6 years old, and two sons who are 14 and 2.

Meybelin always looks for ways to improve her family's lifestyle, and for this reason she has decided to build a passageway in her dwelling. She requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in: poles, pins, cement, sand, gravel and laminate to construct the hallway in her home.

loans.use: to purchase beams, pins, cement, sand, gravel and laminate to build a hallway in her home.

loans.name: Basanti

texts.en:
Basanti is a 42-year-old lady. She is married, and she has two children. Her husband is a small businessman. Basanti has been working as a farmer for 14 years and has good experience in this area. She raises seasonal vegetables and sells them at the local bazaar. Her monthly income is 3,000 INR per month.

Raising and selling vegetables is much expanded in Odisha. People sell seasonal vegetables at the local bazaar, and buyers use vegetables to make delicious kinds of foods. They also use dry vegetables because it’s very useful for health. 

Basanti's living situation is very hard. She doesn't have a latrine in her house so she has to go in the field and it's very unhealthy. She wants to make a latrine for her family so that her family members would be healthier. 

She applied for a loan in order to be able to build a latrine in her house. This will increase the cleanliness, and the family’s members health will be better.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy timber for selling.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest and jovial. 

She operates a farm where she grows crops and keeps pigs. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in an area with good rainfall and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to have increased profits within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her grandchildren.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea, who is a 35-year-old young woman, lives in Surami borough. She has a husband and parents-in-law, who get an age pension from the local government. Tea's husband is temporarily unemployed. 

In order to generate some income to earn a living, the family opened a traditional Georgian bakery near the house. They generate money only for covering basic needs; they live in poverty because they have no additional income for well-being. 

According to the above-mentioned situation, Tea lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience also.  The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Tea to get a loan of 1,500 USD. 

She will renovate the house and will rent it out to guests. The borough where the family lives is well-known and every year has a big range of loyal guests. Tea thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in a great location and will have good conditions for visitors. 

The family will have a chance to increase income which will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future.  With support of the Start Up program, Tea will get an opportunity to tackle the financial difficulties and make better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To renovate the house and rent it out

loans.name: 030913010004.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Long is 52 years old and she is married with four children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

She has a stall selling fruit. Long has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Long faces in her business is the lack of capital.She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

In 2010, Long joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Long has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Long is the group leader of the 030913010004.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of three members.

With her business profit, Long hopes to build a new house, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to resell

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Concepción de 53 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora, es ama de casa y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el 1° grado, por situaciones económicas no continuo sus estudios y decidió mejor aprender a trabajar para apoyar en los gastos de su casa, se acompaño y junto con su compañero de vida procrearon 3 hijos de 30, 32 y 34 años de edad, dos de ellos trabajan y dependen de ellos mismos pues ya tienen su propio hogar, luego su compañero de vida decidió alejarse del hogar y dejo sola a su familia.

 Concepción vive junto con una hija la cual ya esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos, también vive con un hermanito, Concepción trabaja como ordenanza en una oficina desde hace 10 años, trabajando en el horario de 8:00 am a 4:00 pm, también tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa en la cual le ayuda a su hija en atenderla.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en la institución de CREDICAMPO, es para comprar productos y surtir su tienda ya que viene la época de corta de caña y necesita productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes para surtir su negocio ella comprara churros, dulces, galletas, sodas, jugos, helados, jabón, lejía, rinso, etc. así ella podrá obtener un poco mas de ingresos para su alimentación y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su familia.

 El sueño de Concepción es construir una casa de ladrillo mas amplia ya que en la que vive es de adobe y es pequeña.
texts.en:
Concepcion is 53 years old and is a hardworking housewife with a first grade education.  She was not able to continue due to financial situations, so she decided to learn to work so she could help with the household expenses.  She married and she and her husband have three children, ages 30, 32, and 34.  Two of them work and she still depends on them because her husband later decided to abandon their home and left her to care for the family.

Concepcion lives with her daughter who is now married and has two children.  She also lives with her younger brother.  Concepcion has been working as an office orderly for the past 10 years and works from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm.  She also has a small store in her home that her daughter helps run.

She is asking for this loan through CREDICAMPO to buy merchandise to stock her store.  The sugarcane harvest season is approaching and she needs merchandise to offer her customers.  She will buy churros, candy, cookies, sodas, juices, frozen treats, soap, lye, rinso, etc.  This way she will be able to obtain a bit more income with which to support herself and also provide a better quality of life for herself and her family.

Concepcion’s dream is to build a larger brick house because the one she lives in is small and made of adobe.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Arise Group

texts.en:
These four people are part of the group called Arise. On average, they are 45 years old, and have two children each. They all live in the Chorkor neighborhood in Accra, Ghana. They are friends or neighbors, and also know one another through their income-generating activities at Chorkor. They are involved in charcoal, grocery, yam and lining. In order to have enough cash to buy fresh supplies of goods, the members of the group have decided to join ID-Ghana. This is their 3rd loan cycle with ID-Ghana. 
Regina, the featured borrower, is a well-known yam seller. She is planning to use her loan to buy yams from the farmers to sell to customers at the market. Most of her customers are women. She is expecting to make a good monthly profit, which will be reinvested in her business and also used to take care of her child. She is single and has one child.
The group will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy yams from the farmers to sell to customers at the market.

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra is 28 years old. There are three people in her family. Cultivation and husbandry are her main income. She can cover the family’s daily cost and education from the goat-raising income. 

With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve the health of her family members, especially the kids. She has daily income from farming,  such as vegetables, chickens, and goats.

Sumitra is very grateful to Kiva and its lenders for this help.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Yuli Elizabeth

texts.es: Yuli es madre soltera, tiene 22 años de edad y su hija tiene 6 años de edad y asiste a la escuela, Yuli vive con su madre y su hija en una casa por la que paga arriendo, Yuli se dedica a la crianza de animales, al jornal y a la agricultura, ella siembra a medias una cuadritas de cultivos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono y fungicidas para tener sanos a su cultivos de papas, la aspiración de Yuli es trabajar duro para poder darle a su hija lo que necesite para su edecacion.
texts.en: Yuli is a single mother.  She is 22 years old and her daughter is six and attends school.  Yuli lives with her mother and daughter in a rented home.  Yuli raises animals, works as a farm hand, and also farms and always has a plot of crops.  She will use the money from this loan to buy compost and fungicides to keep her potato crops healthy.  Yuli’s aspiration is to work hard to be able to provide her daughter with an education.

loans.use: to buy compost and fungicide.

loans.name: Ranjubala

texts.en:
Ranjubala works as a daily laborer for a farmer. She starts her job at 6 in the morning until 6 in the evening of the same day, and she has to work seven days per week to maintain her family needs. 

Ranjubala is requesting this loan from Kiva and Peoples Forum because in her house, currently, there is no latrine. She needs to build a septic tank and latrine seat so that she can give her family a better quality of life.

She is very happy with this loan, and she would like to give thanks to Kiva and its lenders for this great support.

loans.use: to build a septic tank and latrine seat so that she can give her family a better quality of life

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts and service his motorcycle

loans.name: Mohsen

texts.en:
Mohsen is a 28-year-old married father of two children who started nine years ago working as a blacksmith to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Today, Mohsen is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to expand his business through buying necessary blacksmith machines, which will facilitate his work and help him in providing his customers with quick and better service.

Mohsen hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary blacksmith machines

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings she is requesting, she wants to purchase more stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business as it grows into a wholesale business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a female Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a farm and also sells cereals. She describes her family challenge to be power interruptions. 

She will use the 30,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy materials to construct a biogas plant to generate power for home use. She hopes that in the future, she will have  a stable business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy materials to construct a biogas plant to generate power for home use

loans.name: Mehroj

texts.en: Mehroj is a young single man who is 20 years old. He lives in Khujand city with his brother, his wife's brother and his nephew. Mehroj is working and studying. He is studying full-time in the second year at the University of Law, Business and Policy of Khujand. After classes, he works in a confectionery shop until late evening. Mehroj is an active and smart boy. He manages to study well and earn a living. Mehroj dreams of finishing his studies with honors and becoming a good lawyer. But now he needs money to pay his tuition at the University. Mehroj is asking for a loan for the amount of 1000 USD. He will pay the loan with the expense of his work.

loans.use: To pay his tuition at the University

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be capable. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food to sell. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food to sell.

loans.name: Veronica Yasmin

texts.es: Veronica de 29 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace 2 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Veronica, 29, is a single mother who lives in her own home with her two children.  She makes and sells tortillas and has been in business for two years.  Her business is located in her home and she has many customers.

The loan she is requesting is to buy quintals of corn and lime to continue making tortillas.  This is to improve her income and enjoy a better lifestyle with her children.

loans.use: To buy quintals of corn and lime.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Doña Rosa vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella tiene un negocio de venta de tortas y hamburguesas desde hace 15 años, tiene muy buena clientela pues vende su comida a un buen precio, con las ganancias que obtiene cubre algunos gastos de su hogar, ella solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario para elaborar sus tortas y hamburguesas como: pan, tomates, cebollas, mayonesa, mortadelas, entre otros ingredientes y asi poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Rosa lives in her own home with her husband and for 15 years she has been in business selling sandwiches and hamburgers.   She has many customers because of the good prices she offers.  With the profit earned she is able to cover some of the household expenses.  The loan she is requesting will allow her to buy what she needs to make sandwiches and hamburgers, such as bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, sausages and other ingredients.  This way she can increase her profit.

loans.use: To buy bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, sausage and other ingredients.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria de 40 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su hermano, ella posee desde hace varios años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, 40, lives in her own house with her brother.  For several years she has been running a small store from home.  She has many customers, especially among her neighbors, because of her good prices and kind customer service.  

The loan she is requesting is to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc. to improve her income and enjoy a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a printer to improve customer service and earn more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, sand, iron, metal sheeting and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Mais

texts.en: Mais lives in the Absheron region together with his lovely wife and children. He has been in the business of making plastic windows and doors for 13 years. Mais loves his work. He has successfully repaid all the loans. Today he needs again a loan of 1350 AZN to buy new materials for making plastic doors and windows. Mais is thankful to Kiva and the Komak organization for the aid. He wants to recruit a few more assistants and to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new materials for making plastic doors and windows

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nuevo Amanecer se reúne en el sitio Bajo de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, es un pequeño lugar rodeado de mucha vegetación, sus habitantes se dedican a diferentes ocupaciones, como comerciantes y empelados de fabricas.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete  hijos pero dos de ellos fallecieron, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad, dos de ellos  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña María  tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, frutas y legumbres  entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, en su tienda sus clientes encuentran todo lo necesario y es por esto que cada día tiene más clientes.  Tiene más de 7  años su negocio con el cual salen adelante ya que su marido no gana mucho en el campo.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir más su tienda. Lleva 6 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con cada crédito mejora su negocio. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The New Dawn Communal Bank meets in the Bajo de Montecristi area in the Manabí province, which is a small place surrounded by a lot of vegetation.  The local people work in different jobs as salespeople and factory workers.

This is where María, 54, lives.  She is married and from this relationship has seven children but two passed away. Her children are all adults and two still live with her. Her husband is a farmer.

María has a store in her home and sells all types of products like rice, sugar, oils, detergents, fruits and vegetables and other items. She works everyday from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. and sometimes even later.  In her store her customers can find everything necessary and is the reason why each day she has more customers. María has worked 7 years in the business which supports the household since her husband does not earn much on the farm.

This loan will be used to buy groceries to stock the store.  She has been in the communal bank for six years and likes it because her business improves with each loan.  Her goal is to continue growing her business day after day.

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Ewa

texts.en: Ewa is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be innovative. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a competitive location and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. She hopes that in the future, she will have a huge store. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg (A) Group

texts.en:
Sukanti, age 28, is the leader of Maa Santoshi SHG of the Dhenkanal district of Odisha. They live in a small village called Gurujunga in Dhenkanal. The SHG members have come together to support each other in the various hardships they face every day. The village is in one of the remote locations and has poor grid connectivity. The problems of electricity are severe. The women want their children to be able to study in town, and want to support their family financially. 

Sukanti has applied for a loan of 150,000 INR for her SHG. She owns two goats and wants to expand her business. Her husband is a farmer involved in paddy and various other crops. She believes if she can support her family, she would be able to send her children to a better school and provide a better quality of life. She will use her portion to buy more goat kids for raising.

loans.use: to buy more goat kids to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of cosmetics, earrings, and perfumes

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of sufficient capital. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Vingunguti Group

texts.en:
Mbogo, who is in his mid 40s, is divorced with two children. One of his children is still in school and the other one is a grown-up.  He has been selling different types of domestic animals like goats, cows, pigs, etc. since 1999.  He works from 6 am to 5 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Mbogo's 16th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to keep on buying more animals and has paid back all his loans successfully. He is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  He used the profit to pay for school fees, buy a TV set, sofa set, Kinyamzi, cupboards for clothes and for the kitchen, to buy beds and mattresses and to cover household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy more and different types of animals to resell.  He dreams of building his own house.

Mbogo will share this loan with his loan group "Vingunguti", which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more and different types of animals to resell.

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: ROKHAYA est une femme brave qui habite à coté du guichet, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation du charbon de bois. Etant à son 3ème prêt, elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter un important stock de charbon qu’elle vend sur sa terrasse.  Elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans cette activité. Avec ses bénéfices, Rokhaya parvient à aider son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. Avec l’aide de l’institution,  elle souhaite à l’avenir  avoir un grand magasin d’stockage de charbon de bois. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses commandes et satisfaire ses clients. De ce fait elle aura l’occasion d’épargner de l’argent à coté.
texts.en: Rokhaya is a good woman who lives next to the branch; she is married and a mother. She has been building up a small business selling charcoal and is on her third loan, which she is requesting to buy a significant stock of charcoal, which she will sell from her terrace. She has more than five years' experience in this business. With the profits she makes, Rokhaya is able to help her husband with the family's daily outgoings and her children's school fees. She begins her day at eight o'clock in the morning and finishes at seven in the evening. With the help of the institution she would like in the future to have a large shop to stock her charcoal in. This would enable her to increase the orders she takes and satisfy customer demand. She would thus have the opportunity to put some money aside.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to resell on a retail basis.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: KHADY est une femme âgée de 46ans, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des tissus. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10ans et demande ce montant pour acheter des des denrées alimentaires destinées à la vente. Elle n’a pas de charges particulières à par ses besoins, car c’est son  mari qui gère les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de  ses enfants.  Elle commence sa journée à 7h 30mn et la termine à 19h. Elle voudrait renforcer son stock de marchandises afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et devenir le fournisseur potentiel dans le marché de sa commune.
texts.en: Khady is a 46-year old woman who is married and a mother. She has been building up a business selling fabric and has more than ten years' experience in this business. She is requesting this loan to buy food products fthat she intends to sell on. She does not have any particular responsibilities apart from taking care of her own needs, since her husband manages the family's daily outgoings and children's school fees. She begins her day at 7h30 in the morning and finishes at seven in the evening. She would like to boost her stock so she can increase her income and become a potential supplier in the market in her municipality.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale.

loans.name: Maria Olimpia

texts.es: Maria de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de leche desde hace 1 año su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también de forma ambulante tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, Maria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de  leche por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas ya que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Maria is 65 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her family. Maria has been making a living selling milk for one year. The business is in her home but Maria also works as a street vendor. She has many customers because of the good prices. Maria is applying for a loan in order to buy milk in bulk and continue with her sales, which generate good profits.

loans.use: to buy milk in bulk.

loans.name: Silvia Yessenia

texts.es: Silvia de 34 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa con sus dos hijas, ella se dedica a la venta de flores artificiales desde hace 3 años, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal, tiene muchos clientes ya establecidos, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos del hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de más variedad de flores por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Silvia is 34 years old and a single mother. She lives in a house with her two daughters and has been making a living selling artificial flowers for three years. Her business is located at the town market. Silvia has many regular customers. She is able to use her profits to cover household costs. Silvia is applying for a loan in order to buy a greater variety of flowers in bulk and continue with her work, which generates good profits.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of flowers in bulk.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Jose de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hermanos, el se dedica a la venta de café y leche de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados, tiene muchos clientes fijos, por los buenos precios y la calidad con la que elabora los alimentos, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de café y leche por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Jose is 39 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his two brothers. Jose makes a living selling coffee and milk as a street vendor in the different markets. He has many regular customers because of his low prices and the quality of his products. Jose is applying for this loan in order to buy coffee and milk in bulk to continue with his sales and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy coffee and milk in bulk.

loans.name: Ángela Eva

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nuevo Amanecer se reúne en el sitio Bajo de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, es un pequeño lugar rodeado de mucha vegetación, sus habitantes se dedican a diferentes ocupaciones, como comerciantes, y empelados de fabricas.
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 77 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen doce hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo no trabaja.
Doña Ángela para salir adelante junto a su esposo con la ayuda del primer crédito que recibió del banco surtió una pequeña tienda en su casa, la misma que con la ayuda de los créditos y con el paso del tiempo han ido mejorando, allí sus clientes pueden encontrar de todo un poco, vende productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes,  artículos de bazar y papelería, trabaja todos los días junto a su marido quien la acompaña en su negocio el  cual les da lo necesario para salir adelante.
Este crédito es para surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The "Nuevo Amanecer" group meets in Bajo de Montecristi in the province of Manabí. This is a small place surrounded by much vegetation. The inhabitants make a living in different jobs, including as traders and factory employees.

And it is here that 77-year-old Angela lives. She is married and has twelve children, now independent adults. Her husband does not work.

In order to get ahead, with the help of their first loan, Angela and her husband started a small shop in their house. With the help of loans and the passing of time, the shop has become better and there customer can find a little bit of everything. The shop sells products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, stationary and miscellaneous items. Angela works everyday alongside her husband who helps her with this business that is necessary for the couple to get ahead.

This loan will be used to stock up the shop. Angela will use it to buy rice, sugar, oil, cold meats, detergent and other staple products. 

Angela is a founding member of the loan group. She likes it because she started her business with her first loan. Angela's dreams are to have good health and continue moving forward.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, cold meats, detergent and other staple products.

loans.name: Khadissatou

texts.fr: KHADISSATOU est une femme très brave qui est mariée et mère de famille. Malgré la gestion de ses enfants, elle fait le commerce de draps, bijoux en argent et des chaussures. Elle n’a pas de parent bénéficiaire dans l’institution. Etant à son 2ème prêt, elle sollicite ce dernier pour renforcer son stock de marchandises et pouvoir satisfaire ses commandes. Elle gère ses propres charges et le reste c’est son mari qui en charge. Elle a une expérience de 3 ans et commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 17h. A l’avenir, elle voudrait gagner d’avantage des parts de marché et avoir le monopole de vente.
texts.en: Khadissatou is a very good woman who is married and a mother. As well as looking after her children she sells sheets, silver jewelry and shoes. None of her relatives have benefited from any loan from the institution. She is on her second loan which she is requesting to boost her stock and thereby meet customer demand. She manages her own expenses and her husband has responsibility for the rest. She has three years' experience and begins her day at nine o'clock in the morning, finishing at five in the afternoon. In the future she would like to be able to gain more market share and have a monopoly of the sales.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: FATOU  est une femme promotrice qui évolue dans la commercialisation des céréales.  Elle habite dans le même quartier que le guichet, et elle est à son 4ème prêt. Elle vient souvent dans le guichet pour faire des opérations. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui n’a pas de parent bénéficiaire  dans l’institution. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter du maïs, du mil, pain de singe, arachide et du Bissap (feuille) pour ensuite les vendre à ses clients potentiel. Elle n’a pas de charges particulières a part ses besoins personnels. Elle a une expérience de plus de 3ans.  Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 16h. Elle voudrait à l’avenir ouvrir une boutique de vente de produits alimentaires et augmenter son stock. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et épargner de l’argent.
texts.en: Fatou is a female promoter who is building up a business selling cereals. She lives in the same district as the branch, and she is on her fourth loan. She often comes to the branch to carry out transactions. She is married and a mother, and none of her relatives have benefited from loans from the institution. She is requesting this loan to buy corn, millet, monkey bread, groundnut and bissap (hibiscus leaves) to resell afterwards to her potential customers. She does not have any particular responsibilities apart from taking care of her own needs. She has more than three years' experience in her business. She begins her day at nine o'clock in the morning and finishes at four in the afternoon. She would like to open a shop in the future to sell food products and also boost her stock. She would thereby be able to increase her income and save some money.

loans.use: to buy cereals to resell.

loans.name: Richard Cesar

texts.es:
Richard es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz en su ciudad natal, Ica. Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar una profesión debido a que su familia era de bajos recursos económicos, es por ello que se esfuerza al máximo para que su familia viva bien y puedan tener un mejo futuro.
Richard se siente muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá realizar el mantenimiento de sus cultivos, así como el control fitosanitario de sus plantas. Más adelante espera poder cultivar productos permanentes y así innovar con otras frutas propias de su región.
texts.en:
Richard is a hardworking and responsible person. He has been working in agriculture since he was very young, growing corn in his hometown, Ica. Unfortunately, he could not study because of his family’s financial situation. This is why he works hard so that his family can live a good life and have a more promising future.

Richard appreciates the support that Kiva lenders have given him. He will be able to keep his crops in good shape and free from diseases. In the future, he hopes to grow perennial crops and innovate by growing native fruits.

loans.use: to keep his crops free from diseases.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria de 42 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus hijos, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, frijoles, quesillo, chicharrón, harina de arroz, etc. para poder continuar con la elaboración de las pupusas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 42 years old. She is a single mother who lives in her own house with her children. For several years she has worked making and selling pupusas. Her business is located in her residence and she has a lot of customers. She is asking for a loan to buy corn, beans, fresh cheese, rice flour, etc. so she can continue to make the pupusas and thus have better income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, fresh cheese, cracklings, rice flour, etc.

loans.name: Miriam Aydee

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nuevo Amanecer se reúne en el sitio Bajo de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, es un pequeño lugar rodeado de mucha vegetación, sus habitantes se dedican a diferentes ocupaciones, como comerciantes, y empelados de fabricas.
En este lugar vive la señora Miriam, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 13, 7 y 4 años de edad,  el mayor estudia en colegio y los menores  en escuela. Su esposo es chofer. 
Doña Miriam es maestra en una escuela de la localidad pero para tener más recursos   se dedica a la venta de productos Avon  (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, ella también le da parte del crédito a su marido para que él lo utilice en su trabajo, el tiene una fábrica de ladrillos, (material utilizado para la construcción de viviendas). Ella lleva más de 6 años que se dedica al comercio. 
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y arcilla para la fabricación de ladrillos. Está  en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Amanecer credit group meets in Bajo de Montecristi in the province of  Manabí. It is a small place surrounded by much vegetation. It's residents work in different occupations such as commerce, and in factories.

This is where Miriam lives. She is 42, married and has three children, aged 13, 7 and 4. The oldest is in high school and the younger ones are in elementary school. Her husband is a driver. 
 
Miriam is a teacher at a local school but in order to have more income she sells Avon products (beauty products such as cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She works three days a week and sells on credit, collecting every week. She also will give a part of the loan to her husband so that he can use it in his work. He has a brick factory (materials used to build homes). She has had her business for more than 6 years.
 
This loan is to buy perfumes, cosmetics and clay to make bricks. She has been in the credit group since the beginning and she likes it because of the help offered with the loans. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clay.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 46 years. She is married to Fred and together they have been blessed with 1 child who is 25 years old. Fred is a farmer, and he provides additional income for his family.

Judith is also a farmer, and this is a business she has been doing for the last 7 years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

For her first loan with VisionFund Kenya she has requested KES 5,000 which she will use to buy fertilizers, seedlings and manure for her farm.

With the anticipated profits, Judith will be able to pay education fees for her child as well as repay her loan. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable business with stable income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seedlings and manure

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself as honest. 

Anne operates a farm where she grows tea, and she has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are large scale. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future she will be a leading farmer. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Betsy Nelly

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nuevo Amanecer se reúne en el sitio Bajo de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, es un pequeño lugar rodeado de mucha vegetación, sus habitantes se dedican a diferentes ocupaciones, como comerciantes, y empelados de fabricas.
En este lugar vive la señora Betsy, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen  cuatro hijos, tres ya son mayores de edad y una chica de 16 años que estudia en colegio  y es la que aun vive con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos.
Doña Betsy es un gran ama de casa que para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica a la preparación de alimentos, ella  los tres últimos días de la semana se dedica a la venta de ceviches y encebollados de pescado, para lo cual en estos días instala en su casa un pequeño restaurante para que sus clientes tengan un buen servicio y cada vez lleguen más  a servirse sus  deliciosos platos, su hija le ayuda, lleva más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual ayuda a su marido a  salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar, pescado chifles, colas y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque siempre le han ayudado con los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Amanecer credit group meets in Bajo de Montecristi in the province of  Manabí. It's a small place surrounded by a lot of vegetation. Its residents have different occupations, such as commerce and working in factories.   

This is where Betsy lives. She is 54, married and has four children. Three are already grown and a 16 year old daughter is in high school and still lives with her. Her husband works making bricks. 

Betsy is a great housewife who in order to help her husband with the household expenses makes food. The last three days of the week she sells ceviches and fish encebollados. That is why she has installed in her house a small restaurant so her customers con have good service. Every day more of them come to try her delicious dishes. Her daughter helps her. She has been doing this activity for more than 20 years and with it she helps her husband get ahead. 

She is going to use this loan to buy fish, chips, sodas and other groceries to prepare her food. She has been in the credit group since the beginning because it has always helped with the loans. Her dream is to give her daughter the best.

loans.use: to buy fish, chips, sodas and other groceries.

loans.name: Sumomei 2 Group

texts.en:
The six members in the photo are part of the group called Sumomei 2, and they all live in the same neighborhood. They sell grocery products, cooked rice and stew, smoked fish, jeans, kenkey (cooked corn paste) and fish, banku (cooked corn and cassava dough) and stew. 

Clinton (seen in the photo standing third on the left) is the group's representative. He is 19 years old and single without any children. Clinton has been selling jeans at the market for four years. This allows him to take care of himself, as since he is a school dropout and has no good parental care, he has to fend for himself. He buys his jeans from the wholesaler's and resells them at the market in Ghana. 

Clinton and the other members of his group would like to improve their businesses, so they have requested a second loan from the field partner, ID Ghana. Their previous loan was fully and correctly repaid.

loans.use: To buy jeans from the wholesaler's to sell at the market in Ghana.

loans.name: Kande Leona Ps Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 30 juin 2010 du fait de la bonne entente du groupe. Le groupe est composé de commerçante qui ont la même vision et les mêmes objectifs. Madame Lalia qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est célibataire sans enfant, mais elle a en charge une fille de sa sœur. Elle compte acheter avec le montant reçu 30 mètre de tissu teinté et 20 paires de chaussures. Elle cherche à fidéliser ses clients en les offrant des produits de qualité. Les bénéfices serviront à subvenir à mes besoins(achat de terrain et construction), et aider mes parents.
texts.en: The village bank was inaugurated on 30 june 2010, thanks to the good harmony of its group members, who are all involved in commercial activities with shared vision and goals. Mrs Lalia, seen to the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group representative. She is single and without children, but has responsbility for one of her sister's daughters. She plans to use her loan to purchase 30 meters of died cloth and 20 pairs of shoes. She hopes to obtain loyalty from her customers by offering them quality products. She will use the profits to cover her personal needs (purchase of a plot of land and construction fees) and to assist her parents.

loans.use: purchase died cloth and shoes

loans.name: Aracely Jaqueline

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Patito Donald. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.
En este lugar vive la señora Aracely, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos de 20, 16 y 11 años de edad, los de 16 años son mellizos, todos estudian en universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo es maestro.
Do0ña Aracely es una gran ama de casa y buena esposa que realiza los créditos para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la cría de pollos y gallinas criollas, tiene un pequeño corral en el cual cría sus animalitos, ella los compra pequeños y los mantiene por espacio de tres meses tiempo adecuado para que tengan un buen crecimiento para luego venderlos a vecinos del lugar,  con esto ella se gana lo suyo lo cual invierte en los estudios de sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar alimento y medicinas  para los pollos y gallinas. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
In Racofuerte canton, the members of the Patito Donald communal bank meet every two weeks. This place is known for its delicious sweets that the locals make which are known throughout the country and for the warmth of the friendly, hard-working people.

In this place, Aracely lives. She is 43 years old, married, and in this relationship they have 4 children ages 20, 16 and 11 years old. The 11-year-olds are fraternal twins. All of them are students, in university, secondary and primary school. Her husband is a teacher.

Aracely is a great housewife and good wife, who takes out loans to help her husband with the household expenses. She works raising chickens and Creole hens. She has a small corral where she raises her animals. She buys them small and keeps them for three months, adequate time for them to grow well, to then sell them to her neighbors. With this, she earns her own income which she invests in her children's education.

This loan is to buy feed and medicine for the chickens and hens. She has been a member of the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because the loans help her a lot. Her dreams are that her children become good professionals.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicines for chickens and hens.

loans.name: Kipkurui

texts.en:
Kipkurui is a 25-year-old man married to Faith, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with one child.  

Kipkurui has been a livestock farmer for a period of five years, earning himself an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Kipkurui was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing his first loan of KES 10,000. He intends to buy goats and cows to sell to his customers.

Kipkurui plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his child and hopes to provide the best education to his children.

loans.use: To buy goats and cows to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Patito Donald. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.
En este lugar vive la señora Lucrecia, tiene 63 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 6 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Lucrecia es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para  salir adelante y con esto ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar, ella se dedica a  preparar pan de almidón, corviches, empanadas entre otros bocadillos, su forma de venta es por pedidos ya que entrega al por mayor a otros comerciantes que venden al menudeo, ella también vende en su casa al público en general, lleva 7 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo ya que su marido en ocasiones no gana mucho en sus faenas en el campo.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar los bocadillos. Lleva 7 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir incrementando su negocio.
texts.en:
In Rocafuerte canton, the members of the communal bank Patito Donald meet every two weeks. This place is known for its delicious sweets that the locals make which are known throughout the country, and for the warmth of the friendly, hard-working people. 

In this place, Lucrecia lives. She is 63 years old, married, and from this relationship they have 6 adult children who are independent. Her husband is a farmer. She works making yucca bread, corviches, and empanadas among other snacks. She sells to order since she delivers them in bulk to other business owners who sell them retail. She also sells them in her house to the general public. She has worked in this business for 7 years, with which she earns her own income since her husband sometimes doesn't earn a lot in his work in the countryside.

This loan is to purchase groceries to prepare her snacks. She has been in the communal bank for 7 years and she likes it because with the loans, she finances her business. Her dreams are to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a single woman. She describes herself as honest. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and belts. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area for business and her primary customers are of all types. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of stock due to insufficient funds. She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes and belts. 

Her business goal is to expand business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes and belts.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 14 years. He describes himself as visionary. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. His primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge as insecurity. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to be the best within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will raise the living standards of his family. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Jenny María

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Patito Donald. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.
En este lugar vive la señora Jenny, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos de 14, 6 y 1 año de edad, los mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es artesano.
Doña Jenny es una muy buena ama de casa que se dedica a la venta de  productos para el hogar (planchas, licuadoras, ventiladores, camas, etc.) además de zapatos y zapatillas  por catalogo. Su forma de venta es por cartilla o por catalogo, enseña la revista donde están todos estos artículos y sus clientes deciden que es lo que quieren comprar, luego ella realiza los pedidos y entrega los productos. Ella también le da parte del crédito para su marido el cual tiene un taller de ebanistería.  Lleva 7 años realizando esta labor y que le va bien.
Este crédito es para comprar planchas, licuadoras, ventiladores, camas, sandalias y madera para el trabajo de su marido. Lleva 7 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ella sale adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In Rocafuerte canton, the members of the communal bank Patito Donald meet every two weeks. This place is known for its delicious sweets that the locals make which are known throughout the country, and for the warmth of the friendly, hard-working people.

In this place, Jenny lives. She is 33 years old, married, and in this relationship has 3 children, ages 14, 6, and 1 years old. The older ones are students in the secondary and primary school. Her husband is a craftsman. 

Jenny is a good housewife who works selling products for the home (irons, blenders, fans, beds, etc.) in addition to shoes and sandals by catalog. Her sales method is by cart or by catalog. She shows the magazine that has all the items and her customers decide what they want to buy. Later, she does the orders and delivers the products. She also gives some of the loan to her husband who has a cabinetmaking shop. She has been doing this work for 7 years, and it is going well.

This loan is to purchase irons, blenders, fans, beds, sandals, and wood for her husband's work. She has been a member of the communal bank for 7 years and she likes it because, with it, she can get ahead. Her dreams are to give her children the best.

loans.use: to purchase irons, blenders, fans, beds, sandals, and wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Isaac Asamaoh

texts.en:
Isaac is a second year student at the University of Education, Winneba, reading Post Diploma Bachelors of Science. The loan is to help pay for his tuition fees.

The completion of his studies would help him pass along the knowledge acquired to the next generation and also serve as a role model to people living in his community. In the next five to ten years he hopes to become a lecturer in order to affect the lives of the people he comes into contact with.

Seeing the younger ones in his community motivates him to further his education to help pass along knowledge onto these young ones. The realization of his dreams also keeps him working towards his goal.

Without the support of this loan, furthering his education would have been shelved. He would have had to save and support himself and family before he could think of going back to school.

“Most of the young ones lack financial assistance to pursue their education, so I would like investors to give more grants to help in that regard," he says.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition fees.

loans.name: Rafig

texts.en:
Rafig is 32 years-old and married. He has two children. Rafig’s family is IDP (internally displacted persons) from Fuzuli city already 22 years, and now they live in the Abseron region.

Rafig is a taxi driver. He transports passengers between different areas of the Abseron region. 

This is Rafig's second loan. The first loan he repaid on time. Rafig wants to change the tires on his car because winter is coming. He wants to buy new tires so he can work in winter. For this reason he applied for a loan amount of 1,300 AZN ( Azerbaijan new manat).

He is thankful for help to Kiva and the Komak organization.

loans.use: to buy new tires for winter.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Luciana operates a vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Ilombi

texts.en:
This is Ilombi. She is a capable and enterprising woman at the age of 55, living in Kulob town. Ilombi is married and the mother of three children. Her husband works as a master of house repair. Her eldest son is in the military, and the youngest son is still studying. 

She has her own sewing business that she began two years ago. Ilombi wants to develop her business. She needs to buy an upgraded sewing machine in order to take more orders for sewing. For this purpose, Ilombi applied for a loan. She hopes for your responsiveness.

loans.use: To purchase an upgraded sewing machine.

loans.name: Genaro Antonio

texts.es:
Genaro de 38 años de edad, es empleado y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el 3° año de bachillerato, no continuo sus estudios porque decidió mejor trabajar para apoyar a su familia en los gastos de la casa, esta soltero y no tiene hijos, vive con su papá.

Genaro se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras y recargas de teléfonos en la plaza pública de la comunidad,  desde hace 3 años, trabajo que lo aprendió por la misma necesidad en que tenia para la alimentación de él y de su padre, para llegar a su trabajo Genaro camina 2 cuadras, su horario es de 6:00 am a 4:00 pm todos los días.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en la institución, es para surtir su negocio de frutas y verduras comprará manzanas, uvas, naranjas, guineos, plátanos, tomates, chile verde, pepino, cebollas, etc. así podrá ofrecerles mejor productos a sus clientes donde ellos se sentirán satisfechos por cumplirle sus necesidades, con ello Genaro tendrá un mejor ingreso y lograra tener una mejora calidad de vida junto a su padre.

El sueño de Genaro es tener una tienda muy grande y surtida en su casa.
texts.en:
Genaro is 38 years old and has an 11th grade education.  He did not continue his education because he decided to work so he could help with his family’s household expenses.  He is single, has no children, and lives with his father.

Genaro has been selling fruits and vegetables and cell phone minutes in the community’s public plaza for three years.  He learned this out of a need to feed himself and his father.  Genaro walks 2 blocks to get to work and works from 6:00 am to 4:00 pm every day.

He will use the money from this loan to stock his business with fruits and vegetables and will buy apples, grapes, oranges, bananas, plantains, tomatoes, green pepper, cucumbers, onions, etc.  This way he will be able to offer better products to his customers so they can meet their own needs and he will have better income and hopes to have a better quality of life for himself and his father.

Genaro’s dream is to have a large, well-stocked store in his home.

loans.use: to stock his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Orlanda Mercedes

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Patito Donald. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.
En este lugar vive la señora Orlanda, tiene 48 años de edad, hace algunos años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo tres hijos de 22, 21 y 15 años de edad, los dos menores estudian en universidad y colegio, todos aun viven con ella.
Doña Orlanda es una muy buena madre que realiza el crédito para un taller de aluminio que tenía su esposo pero  al fallecer su hijo tuvo que hacerse cargo, allí  realizan diversidad de trabajos como puertas, ventanas, pasamanos, etc. a base de pedidos que las hacen sus clientes, lleva más de 25 años  con su taller el cual lo tienen desde que su marido vivía y es con el cual siempre han salido adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar aluminio y vidrio para el negocio. Lleva 7 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su pequeña.
texts.en:
The" Patito Donald" communal bank meets every fortnight in Rocafuerte Canton. This area is known for it's delicious sweets made by the local people, which are known throughout the country and for the warmth of it's hard-working, gentle people.

Orlanda lives in this place. She is 48 years old. Her husband died some years ago and she was left a widow. She has three children from this relationship aged 22, 21 and 15 years old. The two youngest study in university and Secondary school. They all still live with her.

Orlanda is a very good mother who is taking out the loan for the aluminum workshop that her husband had. When he died her son had to take charge of it They make different things like doors, windows, rails, etc. on request for their clients. They have had the workshop for 25 years which was started when her husband was alive and it has always gotten them by.

This loan is to buy aluminum and glass for the business. She has been a member of the communal bank for 7 years and she likes it because of the support given by the loans. Her dream is to provide the best to her young daughter.

loans.use: to buy aluminum and glass.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
En total son 16 mujeres inspiradas que se esfuerzan día a día para solventar los gastos de su hogar y por sobre todo aumentar sus ingresos y ayudar a sus familias.  Forman parte del comité con el fundamento de ayudarse y más bien consideran una oportunidad de suma importancia para ellas.
La Sra. Nilsa, una de las integrantes se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza por medio de la elaboración de pelotas y se dedica a la venta, es una mujer muy buena en lo que hace, por lo que le está yendo muy bien y ya tiene bastante clientela.
La Sra. Nilsa  pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de cuero, para poder seguir haciendo sus pelotas, y continuar con su venta como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
In total they are 16 inspired women who strive every day to cover household expenses and above all to increase their income and help their families. They are part of the committee with the purpose of helping each other and they consider it a very important opportunity.

One of the members, Nilsa, is improving her level of poverty by making balls and selling them. This woman is very good at what she does so it is going well for her and she already has quite a few customers.

Nilsa is requesting this loan in order to invest in the purchase of leather to continue making her balls and selling them as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy leather to make balls.

loans.name: Edinah

texts.en:
Edinah is a 25-year-old farmer whose main source of income is milk. She decided to concentrate her efforts in dairy farming since she comes from Nyamira where milk is in increasingly high demand due to an upsurge in the population. 

Edinah is seeking a loan to buy barbed wire. Her dairy cows have been trespassing and eating her neighbors' crops, which has led to massive losses for both her neighbours and her because she was forced to pay for the crops that were destroyed. 

Through this loan, she will save the money that she previously spent on paying for damages. All that Edinah waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: To buy barbed wire to retain her dairy cows.

loans.name: Tushauriane Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Priscilla, a member of Tushauriane Women Group in Nakuru, Kenya. She is 50 years old, married and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in July 2013.

Priscilla farms maize and bananas on her small farm. She is grateful for HiH EA enterprise training, which has enabled her to manage her farming business well. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as manure and hybrid planting seeds. This will help her increase her crop yield and income so she can provide for her family's needs such as education, medical care and clothing.

She is happy with Kiva lenders' help and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy manure and planting seeds.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Divino Niño Jesús está en su ciclo número 7 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.   A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, todas ellas se encuentran mejorando.
La Sra. Eligia  es una de las integrantes, quien es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, ella vende chipa, un alimento típico paraguayo.  Su sueño es poder seguir trabajando y no tener que trabajar mas de manera ambulante el día de mañana.
La Sra. Eligia   solicita de este préstamo para la compra de materia prima, como ser almidón, grasa, harina de maíz entre otros, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group known as "Divino Niño Jesús" is in their 7th loan cycle with the Woman's Committee Program where each members works and helps each other to get ahead. Through their effort and continuous labor and applying the vital behaviors to become a successful woman, they are all improving. 

Eligia is one of the members. She is a humble and hard-working woman. She sells cheese buns, a traditional food in Paraguay. Her dream is to continue to work but not in the streets as she does now every morning. Eligia is requesting this loan to buy raw materials like starch, lard, corn flour amongst others. This will help her fulfill her business plan which will help to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make cheese buns like starch, lard, corn flour amongst others.

loans.name: Priscilar

texts.en:
Priscilar is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has run an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. The major challenge she faces is seasonality in demand for her products. 

With the 50,000 Kenyan Shillings loan she has requested, Priscilar wants to buy bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to get access to loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  milk.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 42-year-old hard working Ugandan lady who lives in Kagadi. She has operated a bar, lodge, and farm since 2000. 

She hopes to educate her children and grow her business, competition is her major threat. Christine intends to use a loan to buy crates of beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer.

loans.name: Venesio

texts.en:
Venesio is a 42-year-old married with nine children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. He sells dry beans, maize, rice, coffee, and nuts to earn income for his family. Venesio also grows rice, beans, and  maize to supplement his income. 

He dreams of building a  first class home. Venesio is challenged by seasonal changes and fluctuating prices. Venesio requests a loan to buy maize, beans, rice,and nuts.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans, rice,and nuts.

loans.name: Matiya

texts.en:
Matiya is a 40-year-old man who lives in Kasese, Uganda with his family and five children. He operates a retail shop to sell general merchandise. 

Matiya is a loving father who would love to see his children receive an education. He works hard to ensure that he gets money to pay his children's school fees. He has a dream of expanding his business into new markets and trade wholesale. 

Matiya requests a loan to buy sugar, salt, cassava, flour, and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, cassava, flour and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman with two children, both attend school. She owns a house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a cereal business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Seasonal changes and theft are her major challenges.  Zawadi dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

She will use the 20,000 KES to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Edicta

texts.es:
Edicta es madre soltera; desde hace aproximadamente 13 años se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, actividad que aprendió de manera empírica y que surgió de la necesidad de generar recursos para el sustento de su familia; ofrece todo tipo de productos como ropa, perfumería, cremas corporales, accesorios, entre otros y cuenta con la ventaja de que diariamente conoce nuevas personas a las que les puede ofrecer su mercancía, mejorando cada día sus ventas. 

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor (blusas, jeans, zapatos, accesorios, perfumería, entre otros), así podrá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en esta temporada de fin de año; mejorando su nivel de ingresos.

Edicta, con empeño y dedicación, desea seguir trabajando para sacar adelante su negocio, ya que para un futuro cercano, sueña con tener la posibilidad de montar un almacén en un local comercial donde pueda ofrecer mayor variedad de artículos y que le genere una rentabilidad y una estabilidad económica favorable para dar a su hijo una excelente educación y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Edicta is a single mother. She has worked for approximately 13 years as an independent businesswoman, an activity that she learned empirically and that arose from the necessity to generate income for the sustenance of her family. She offers all types of products, such as clothing, perfume, body creams, and accessories, among other items, and she has the advantage of daily meeting new people to whom she can offer her merchandise, improving her sales every day.

She is now applying for the assistance of the loan in order to buy merchandise wholesale (blouses, jeans, shoes, accessories, and perfumes, among other items). Thus she will be able to stock up with more variety in order to satisfy the demand that increases in this season at the end of the year, improving her level of income.
